author: {'steamid': '76561198129008638', 'num_games_owned': 32, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1767, 'last_played': 1618868107}
review:
Having played 2 different types of hero characters so far I understand all the negative comments concerning out-numbered battles, too many foes etc......   If you go into this game with a typical gaming mindset than yes the battles are going to drive you up a wall.   On the other hand, if you've wargamed in the past the battles (or tactical puzzles as they call them) aren't that bad.

Equip your party right, know how to read a battlefield, position your troops and you'll find winning isn't that hard.

While the story is only so-so and not worth buying the game for, the series of tactical battles more than makes up for that.

The character voices are engaging, a nice mix of dry humor keeps it interesting.  I'm not usually big on games that use voice overs, but I didn't mind this one.

Starting off in the expert mode helps you get off on the right foot as it allows you to craft your hero character the way you want them to be.

All games have bad parts and this one does too.   I disliked how on some maps you need to open chests or break things in order to increase your loot.  In most games you'd clear the map and then loot.  BG's on the other hand requires you to take care of those things while you fight.  Once the last foe goes down, the map closes out, zippo, period, you're done.  No more looting.

The other thing is I found the percentage to hit is sometimes baffling.  Hit chances would go from 85% / 95% to hit down to 65% for my melee character;  same type of target, positioning, nothing I could see was different, but the game thought so.  Minor, but like I said baffling.

A good game, fun to play and seems to go on sale alot.  Very recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090899901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 1998, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1998, 'last_played': 1532368952}
review: A tactical rpg with point and click story telling that has given me a lot hours of joy. The makers of this game are point and click experts, so the art and placement of characters are really well done. After playing a few hours and making up my mind for the builds of my characters, I embarked on this adventure. After gaining a lot of perks and skills, I managed to hit a point where I thought I could beat anything in this game. Until I faced enemies with immunities and came across the crystal that heal and fought again multiple rangers and mages that decimate my party and maps full of traps and maps full of obstacles and maps with alarms bells and pits and spiderwebs and beehives and swamps and and and... This video game has fantastic battle map designers that have worked on it. The things you can do with mages is just a joy to behold and dreadful to play against. Trust the reviewers with high playing hours. This is a unique game that I very much recommend to anyone who enjoys tactical rpgs.

review:
EHI TU . SI DICO A TE. HO FATTO QUESTA RECENSIONE SOLO PER TE. quindi...gentilmente...leggila.

VUOI COMPRARE UN BEL GIOCO CON UNA BELLA TRAMA? NON COMPRARLO
VUOI COMPRARE UN GIOCO CON UNA BELLA GRAFICA? AHAHAHAHAAHAHAHAHAAAHAHAAH
VUOI COMPRARE UN GIOCO CON UNA BUONA IA? AHAHAHAHAHAHAH NON COMPRARLO PASSA AVANTI VAI VIA .

 ALMENO TU...SALVATI.

Apparte gli scherzi, parliamo seriamente:

Vediamo per prima cosa i punti di forza di questo "meraviglioso" gioco:
-Niente
-Personaggi carini
-Niente
-Trama sufficiente
-Niente
-Ancora Niente
-Grafica pressocchÃ¨ accettabile.

E ora andiamo ai punti negativi, sei pronto? Sono davvero pochi:
-IA inesistente , giocherellare a sasso carta forbice con le proprie mani sarÃ  piÃ¹ divertente...
-Missioni Secondarie che non hanno nÃ¨ testa nÃ¨ coda. 
-Mappa enorme con tante cittÃ  ma puoi benissimo aver visitato anche la metÃ  di esse.
-5 capitoli uniti con colla e scotch *(Non ricordo come si scrive e siccome sono un recensore professionista non puÃ² fregarmene di meno).
-Equipaggiamento che equivale al tuo stesso armadio di casa. ( Qui l'esperienza di gioco cambia mio caro lettore, se tu hai un armadio con 3 magliette ti ritroverai nella situazione di Blackguards se tu ne hai di piÃ¹...no non cambia niente, le armature sono quelle , punto e basta).
-Un boss finale che equivale alla somma di tutti i boss della trilogia di Dark Souls, Bloodborne e Sekiro.
-Nemici sbilanciatissimi, posso avere anche buone caratteristiche ma Ã¨ il gioco a decidere se vinci o meno.
-Caricamenti cosÃ¬ lunghi che forse finiscono prima la Ã¹Salerno-Reggio Calabria
-Un casino di Crush insensanti e non intendo Bandicoot ( Ditemi che avete capito la battuta... lo so la mia vita Ã¨ triste)
-Sistema a turni completamente casuale. ( Il gioco i spiega che agiscono prima coloro che hanno una statistica , di cui non ricordo minimamente il nome, al massimo...bene ...non serve a un emerito cazzo)
-Non lo comprare.
-Ancora stai leggendo?
-Vattene via.
-No ora vai via...sono serio.
-Il bello Ã¨ che uscito pure il sequel , boh.

Vabbene, sei arrivato alla fine.
Penso di essere stato abbastanza chiaro, se avessi domande. Chiedi pure, sono pronto a sfogarmi .

author: {'steamid': '76561198050023700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1531388495}
review:
It's an okay game with passable mechanics ruined by the worst scenario design I can remember. The vast majority of complaints about this game are from people who've played quite a lot longer than I have, but the problems they have with the game surface very early in it.

To put this into perspective, about 2 hours in [spoiler] there's an optional fork in the game where you can rescue a baroness or leave her to be hanged by the Bailiff who said he was gonna burn out her eyes.... not fucking hang her. The Bailiff is a crazed maniac, very obviously mentally unstable man who for some reason which I'm sure will never be explained in a way that makes sense, made it into a position of power and is trying to kill the Baroness because she's sat on your party members face and anyone who does any crime no matter how insignificant is deemed a murderer by the Bailiff and anyone who shags a criminal is also a murderer. It's already dumb. [/spoiler]

The level where spoiler above takes place is just poorly designed. You have to make it across two bridges in 5 turns to rescue her. The bridges are three spots wide, there's 7 enemies, there's 6 guarding both bridges (3 per bridge) and one dick with a crossbow peppering the squad. When the level kicks off, two enemies always have to initiative and will block the first bridge with boxes and then stand in your way, you can't move them, you have to kill them, get really lucky or waste half a day trying to get past it only to realize when you finally do, this is how the whole game is going to be presented to you.

Almost insurmountable challenges that take ages and then realizing you didn't enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072130676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1478331877}
review:
My first miss

Blackguards might look like nice title. Turn-based tactical combat, RPG, fantasy - whatâ€™s not to like? Well, nothing to like if everything is Fâ€™d up. 

Plot is boring, generic and uninspiring.  Protagonist accused of a murder of princess or something like that, no one really cares. How to? Voice acting is ridiculous, as it was developers themselves (like good olâ€™ days, yeah?). Visual style is mundane, and animation is way worse than early 2000s RPGs.

Combat is turn-based on a hex-gridded maps and monotonous as hell. No tactical options, no environment to use and your options are confusing mostly useless abilities in that terrible-terrible radial menu. 

Maybe the worst thing in this game is a roleplay system. It is too much bloated with numerous stats, talents and abilities, and at the same time so empty, that character becomes one of three timeworn archetypes: caster, archer, warrior. Well, Iâ€™m no stranger to getting my head around different RPG systems, but horrible UI made it impossible this time. 

All the gameplay consists of boring fights with horrible animations on mostly empty arenas, moving between dots on maybe the blandest looking world map and clicking on a static picture called â€œcityâ€ to hear more laughably bad dialogs.

Well, you can try it, but youâ€™ve been warned. Price tag is ridiculously high for that garbage, but at least it has 90% discount more often than not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022058877', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1630, 'last_played': 1530048290}
review:
4/10

Playable, has a decent (if bland) story, but gameplay is tedious, frustrating, and often boring.

I'm not familiar with the Dark Eye system this game is based on, so this was my introduction. After playing this though, I can say with certainty that I don't like it. 

I can handle a some RNG, and I realize that the game wasn't actively screwing me, but by the gods sometimes I swear...

But I digress, the main reason this gets a no from me is that I felt more annoyed than anything while playing it. 

The game is entirely battle focused. There is a world map and point and click style locations to visit, but these only serve to get you into the battles. 
The battles themselves are slow, drawn out affairs. While this isn't necessarily a bad thing, it makes a bad RNG roll all the more frustrating since you have to wait what feels like hours for the next chance. (it's really actually less than a minute, but it adds to the annoyance factor). There are also a number of very annoying things about them: 
- Low level spells are literally useless, requiring virgin sacrifices to whatever capricious god holds sway in this world to even cast them (this includes basic healing spells), while the enemies have near 100% accuracy from the get go. This isn't even due to the RNG gods not smiling on me either, the game actually lists the chances of successful casts at welll below 40% until you either upgrade the spell, or get your casters the appropriate skills. 
- Enemies employ poison more often than not, and using the counter measures such as antidotes and spells is pointless since the next enemy strike will just poison you again. (and now you've wasted a turn to boot).
- When it isn't poison, it's traps. But usually, it's both. And traps that poison you. Great.

There are a number of sidequests, but the questlog often forgets to tell you where to go. For instance, it wanted me to go to meet Madavar, but didn't say where he was. ( I eventually just googled it rather than wasting time checking everywhere).

The story is OK. Nothing special.

Basically, the battle system just annoyed me to the point where the story no longer held my attention. I got partway through the final chapter and just decided to uninstall. 

If you like the system it's based on, you'll probably have more fun with it than I did. If you don't, then wait for an 80%+ sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261510448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 10294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4429, 'last_played': 1698278727}
review:
I certainly took my time to finish the game and even though it was repetitive i loved playing for the most part, except for those bullshit part where i fought that plant and those tentacles who sometimes dealt 20 - 30 damage to me and my characters didn't seem to be able to hit that plant at all. -_-

I was playing on hard all the way, i just tuned down the dificulty to easy to complete some fights, and overall i really enjoyed the game, i just wished i had a way to speed up the fights since there was some battles who had more than 20 people on the screen and it took way too much time on that.

But even with those faults, i really liked the game. The story, characters, world navigation, the quests and the freedom you have to use the environment to help you win some fights.. I loved setting the grass on fire with Zurbaran and have the enemy sitting there and taking damage every turn.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046232770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1208, 'last_played': 1453848667}
review:
I picked this game up thinking that i'd be a great introduction to a new world, and built on a strong pen-and-paper mechanic.

I have only ever been this wrong twice before: My mother not doing meth, and my ex girlfriend having a side piece. 

This is a half-made game with a great voice cast, solid grid and terrain system, and not much else. The combat difficulty is an oscilliscope. No information is provided in game as to why it fluxes with such dynamic, brain-busting frequency.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168190542', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4007, 'last_played': 1556070753}
review:
Received this game as part of a bundle I purchased, and didn't know anything about it.  Decided to play a few days ago, and found that I'm really enjoying it. The game mechanics are really different from other RPGs I've played, but that's not a bad thing. I find that I actually like the hex-tiles and turn-based combat. It is a challenge to build the skills for my character and the companions so that they compliment each other and produce a solid team that can survive really tough fights. On harder settings, some of those fights are really rough. 

Best thing I can say about the game is that to me, it really has this "feel" to it - it's like playing a tabletop RPG with a bunch of friends but without quite the level of drama produced by a large group. :-D  

I'm still figuring out the story and I've only just finished the second chapter out of five, but it's keeping my interet and providing me with genuine enjoyment. I would recommed giving it a go if you like solving mysteries, adventuring for adventure's sake, and don't mind having your character die in combat and producing a need to go back and try something different.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003032109', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1527276243}
review:
I really like turn-based games like Shadowrun or Fallen Enchantress, but this one falls very short.

- The game is uninteresting, the storyline is boring. There is no world exploration, just click until you get to the next fight.

- All the places look the same, and all the battles look the same (with some monster variations.)

- All the battles feel like you're grinding for hours, there is no dynamism to it, and there is no way to fast forward or accelerate the enemies' turns. Even the fucking static traps and machines have unnecessary long turns you have to wait for.

- Even though it "seems" you have many choices for your characters, you can't really develop many different tactics, so every battle plays the same.

TLDR; I really want to like this game, but sadly it is a bore-fest.

El juego te deja una sensaciÃ³n de 'ha sido lo justo, ni mÃ¡s ni menos'. Para nada es un juego de rol como dice en sus etiquetas, es, sin mÃ¡s, una aventura. Una aventura decente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084313112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 4480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4473, 'last_played': 1649970328}
review:
Ich war im Grunde ziemlich zufrieden mit dem Game. Ich habe beide fÃ¼r insgesammt 3â‚¬ und ein paar kaputte gezahlt, denke aber ich hÃ¤tte im Nachhinein auch bei 10 Euro nicht dem Geld hinterhergeweint.

Mein Preis LeistungsverhÃ¤ltniss ist da vielleicht ein anderes und es mag vielleicht stimmen das die Characterentwicklung selbst nicht die beste ist, dennoch hat es fÃ¼r einige entspannte Stunden gereicht und war seltsam befriedigend an einigen Stellen. 

Zumindestens mit dem DLC zusammen, vermutlich auch ohne, kommt man gut an alle FÃ¤higkeiten ran, sodass mann sich nicht unbedingt panisch geben muss wenn man das GefÃ¼hl hat mann hÃ¤tte sich verskillt. 

Das Ende fand ich jetzt vielleicht etwas weniger befriedigend, (SPOILER)!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Ich stehe nicht so auf " Ich opfer mich fÃ¼r das allgemeinwohl enden, oder wo das Abenteuer mit dem (augenscheinlich) eigenem Tod belohnt wird.

Naja was kann ich nun eigentlich sagen...es ist wohl ganz gut selbst fÃ¼r nen skeptiker wie mich, aber wohl nicht den Vollpreis wert und erfindet vermutlich auch nicht irgendein Genre neu. Ich meine die breite Auswahl an Waffen, Skills, Talente und eigentlichen FÃ¤higkeiten die sich nochmal unterscheiden ist schon net aber trotz mancher nett gestalteten Schlacht fand ichs jetzt auch nicht so innovativ.

Kauf es euch vielleicht einfach billiger, vorallem wenn ihr Drakensang mochtet und die DSA Games mÃ¶gt.

Ich hoff mal ich war einigen deutlich genug, ich schreibe das Review hier nach ner kleinen Party und spÃ¤t Abends also habt nachsicht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004963609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1526493605}
review:
You sort of click until you get into the next fight. There is no exploring or looking at the world. The game so far could have just as easily taken place in room (heal, buy/sell stuff, get quests) and you click on next level once everything is prepared. Its comparable to the map mode of dragon age origins. Only that once you get into 3d mode the levels are laughably small.

Fights are an RNG fail mess. Probably 50% of my 95% accuracy attacks just simply missed. Healing spell with 79% success rate works maybe half the time as well. Its the same for the enemy though. And if you hit numbers will vary wildly. Normal attacks will do way more damage then power attacks often enough that i felt there is no real point in using abilities. Maybe it gets better later on...? I dont know but im not sticking around to find out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025949530', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 930, 'last_played': 1526417422}
review:
Dieses Spiel ist etwa so gut gebalanced wie eine kaputte Waage. Man kann es schaffen, aber manches frustriert und entnervt nur. Etwa wenn man einen Kampf mit dem Ziel "bewege deine Helden auf die andere Seite" nur geschafft hat, weil der Hauptcharakter am Zielort war und der Rest der Gruppe tot, ist es besonders erfreulich, wenn man danach sofort in den Bosskampf mit einem drachenartigen Wesen geschickt wird, ohne MÃ¶glichkeit auf Heilung. Was bedeutet, alle Gruppenmitglieder sind auf 1 HP, auÃŸer eben der Hauptcharakter. SchÃ¶n, wenn der Boss dann AoE spamt und seine normalen Attacken zwischen 12 und 16 Schaden machen (50 HP sind viel, als Vergleich).
Oh, und an einer bestimmten Stelle wird ein Caster-Char mit einer Schandmaske ausgestattet, die dafÃ¼r sorgt, dass diese Person nicht mehr zaubern kann und damit ein Ã¼berglorifizierter laufender Dolch ohne nennenswerte FÃ¤higkeiten und VerteidigungsmÃ¶glichkeiten wird. AuÃŸer man skillt da vorher drauf, aber WOHER SOLL MAN DAS WISSEN WENN MAN KEINE LÃ–SUNG LIEST?! Folglich kÃ¤mpft man dann mit diesem Klotz am Bein sich durch die Gegend, auch durch besagte DrachenhÃ¶hle. Gut, als Meatshield vielleicht noch brauchbar, aber da wÃ¤re etwas mehr Effizienz schon schÃ¶n...
Auch zu bewundern sind Gegner, die in doppelter MannstÃ¤rke der Spielergruppe aufrennen, durch die Bank etwa so viel HP haben wie der Gruppentank und andauernd fÃ¼r 20+ Schaden critten (erneut, 50 HP sind hier relativ viel). Da man vermutlich nur einen Heiler hat, der logischerweise Magier ist, also in Runde 2 den LÃ¶ffel abgibt (ja, der wird gerne mal als Ziel priorisiert), ist man reichlich geliefert.
Bei letzterem Beispiel hatte ich dann genug und das Spiel durfte den Abflug machen.
Und nein, nicht alle KÃ¤mpfe sind so schlimm. Aber wenn man jede Spielstunde auf einen Kampf trifft, bei dem es einen nur so juckt, eine Atombombe statt der Helden ins Gefecht zu werfen, lÃ¤uft was falsch.

TL;DR: Streckenweise extrem schlecht gebalanced und daher frustrierend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981732943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1526539815}
review: I have only put less than 8 hours into this game so far, and I like it. It reminds me of the ol "Gold Box" games from TSR (Dungeons & Dragons, back in the early 1990s. Most u you probably never heard of them, if some of you were even alive then! I like tactical games. I like turn based RPG that are not in first person view. Not to say I don't like Skyrim and uch, I do, but for different reasons. This game might be very linear, and some do find the constant battles challenging, so do I. I like that aspect and If you figure out how to get the console working (google it) you can give your adventurers what the game calls AP - action points but they are really spendable experience points. You don't "level up" (or at least I haven;t yet) but they let you improve many aspects of your game by expending these AP points. If it is too hard, give your starting characters a few thousand experience points. Spread them around carefully. The set it to normal. If you can't bring yourself to cheat this way, play on easy. It is still challenging. I like this so far. I'm having a great time. I frankly don't understand all the negative reviews unless it is inexperiences Action RPG'ers who want instant fast paced action (arcade like) and don't care about taking your time and using turn-based strategy. After playing several mindless ARPG's this is a definite welcome! If you like turn based combat in your RPG and are patient...but this game. For the price it is now, how can you go wrong?

author: {'steamid': '76561198033843646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1526602267}
review:
Ok. Now I understand the negative reviews.

Blackguards is extremely challenging. It feels sometimes really unfair. I thought it is much easier on 'easy' than on 'medium'. ... Mistake.
I changed the difficulty to complete the 'dwarf game'. (you can change it anytimes)
On normal I died always. Even with all other completed sidequests and thought-out skilltree.
Easy mode, only a close win. This game is really hard, even for veterans.
Masochistic game, like Xcom. You need luck to win battles, because of dice calculation/ percentage chance to hit.

Sketchy, because of this rediculous difficulty. 5/10
I recommend it only for veterans and masochistic inclined players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273928279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 3034, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2839, 'last_played': 1525652072}
review:
- TECHNIQUE ET FASTIDIEUX
AttirÃ©e par une promotion allÃ©chante sur un bundle de jeux Daedalic, je me suis retrouvÃ©e en possession de 'Blackguards', un RPG organisÃ© autour de combats au tour par tour. Le pitch paraissait sympathique (du RPG et des combats), mais je me suis rapidement retrouvÃ©e embourbÃ©e dans un gameplay lent et ennuyeux.
Du role playing, je n'en ai pas vraiment vu: les choix dans les dialogues n'influent que rarement sur le cours de l'histoire. Les relations entre les personnages sont stÃ©rÃ©otypÃ©es. On ne s'attache pas vraiment Ã  eux. Les villes se ressemblent. Les PNJ sont interchangeables. 
Des combats, par contre, j'en ai vu, vu, vu et revu. Les critiques que j'avais lues attiraient l'attention sur leur difficultÃ©. En fait, Ã  part quatre ou cinq combats plutÃ´t compliquÃ©s, ils s'agit juste d'optimiser une ou deux aptitudes chez chacun des personnages et les utiliser encore et encore, avec, de temps en temps, quelques variations de tactique. Il m'a fallu recommencer plusieurs fois un certain nombre de combats, certes, mais j'ai vu pire dans d'autres rpg. 
Entre temps, il faudra s'armer de patience pour cumuler points d'aventures (nÃ©cessaires Ã  la progression de vos personnages) et Ducats (nÃ©cessaire Ã  l'achat de matÃ©riel dÃ©cent).
Vous l'aurez compris, je n'ai pas vraiment aimÃ© ce jeu, trop rÃ©pÃ©titif et linÃ©aire. Le mot qui me revenait Ã  chaque fois Ã©tait le mot FASTIDEUX.
NÃ©anmoins, j'ai apprÃ©ciÃ© le systÃ¨me trÃ¨s ouvert de customisation des personnages grÃ¢ce aux points d'aventure, le moteur pour l'optimisatrice que je suis, dans ce jeu. 
Si vous Ãªtes fans de jeux de rÃ´le ouverts (Baldur's Gate, Pillars of Eternity...), vous pouvez vous passer de Blackguards, trÃ¨s  technique et peu satisfaisant en terme de construction de personnages rÃ©alistes. 
Par contre si vous aimez le combat au tour par tour (et Ãªtes plein de patience!), ou si vous trouvez le jeu Ã  un prix rÃ©duit et que vous Ãªtes curieux de tester ce genre de gameplay, allez voir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198798159939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 9107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3936, 'last_played': 1574333452}
review: Die Geschichte ist gut gemacht und stimmungsvoll. Grafik und Gameplay sind in Ordnung. Die KÃ¤mpfe sind hÃ¤ufig extrem unfair und von GlÃ¼ck und Zufall abhÃ¤ngig (Und ich bin ein erfahrener Spieler und spiele nur auf "normal"). Manche KÃ¤mpfe habe ich ein Dutzend Mal gespielt bevor ich sie so mehr schlecht als recht geschafft habe. Die Zwergenspiele habe ich nie hin bekommen, weil die Gegner viel zu heftig sind. Obwohl ich Zauber auf Stufe 8 habe und nur Zauber relevante Attribute gesteigert habe misslingen die Zauber sehr hÃ¤ufig (teilweise 3-4 Mal hinter einander, so das der Zauberer in manchen KÃ¤mpfen im Prinzip keinen Zauber hin bekommt. Ganz im Gegensatz zu den Gegnern). Wundheilung habe ich ebenfalls auf 8 und trotzdem misslingt die Heilung im Extremfall 5 Mal hinter einander. Sehr frustrierend. Deshalb empfehle ich das Spiel nicht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118428259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 3615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2291, 'last_played': 1558886788}
review:
Blackguards is one of those odd RPGs for folks who love unique stat mechanics in their battles and a slight variation on what you would expect in a story. It is frustrating at times, but more often enjoyable. An interesting story and combat rules make up for a couple of glaring technical issues and writing foibles.

-

I'll start with the negative aspects, since they are notable enough to be "make or break" for most RPG players:

There are no respec options or training areas to get infinite "experience" to round out characters. If you commit a stat point, then you have to live with the long-term consequences. In general, you have to decide in advance what you want each party member to specialize in. The real kicker is that several achievements require you to spend a lot of stat points to make a character have a bunch of general skills with no specialization, guaranteeing that they will be useless in most situations rather than very strong in their main role. Finally, some builds just aren't viable past the mid-game; if you chose to specialize someone in Fencing and Throwing weapons or Traps, then you'll be very annoyed to find a lack of legendary Fencing weapons and that Traps and Throwables just do not deal enough damage or utility to scratch later enemies.

The game pulls an Aerith on [spoiler]one of the more interesting and well-written playable characters less than halfway through. You will lose someone permanently, and their replacement is a very dull and flat Generic Tribal Warrior dude with  little personality, backstory, or plot importance; the replacement is just kind of there to be another body on your team and will never do anything in cutscenes other than sit back and grunt.[/spoiler]

The game is very buggy, even after years of supposed bug fixes. Graphics sometimes bug out, the UI occasionally stops working, enemy AI turns off, side-quests randomly appear or disappear with no known reason, and achievements that require an entire playthrough to acquire simply will not be awarded no matter how many times you reload that Point Of No Return save. The sound also falters every single time a multi-target spell goes off, without fail.

Lastly, the game just... ends. On most story paths, there is a brief and inconclusive epilogue after the final boss that does not really address the repercussions (or lack thereof) and may even contradict the warnings that the final boss gives you about your actions.

-

Now, on to the strengths of the game!

Almost every battle is unique. I never felt like I was redoing the same fight over and over again like I do in other RPGs. Even fights that take place in the same gladiator arena as an earlier battle require a new set of tactics and positioning choices. A lot of fights also involve small puzzles or gimmicks that contribute to victory. This is probably the biggest step-up over other RPGs, in my opinion.

Most of your playable characters are entertaining to listen to and have their own perspectives on the situation. Witty banter and sardonic humor abound, and everyone will offer several solutions to multiple situations; choosing one option is quite likely to amuse someone else and annoy a third. Although, it's a pity that [spoiler]you lose one of the better, more dramatic characters and are stuck with a dull meatbot partway through[/spoiler].

While you are limited in the amount of points you get for stat and talent distribution, you do get many options on how to build your main character and allies. It is very feasible to make an archer that dodges all melee attacks while picking away at enemy rangers, or to have a tank mage casually ignoring everything the boss tries to do to them. Just remember that you kind of need to commit to a character only having one or two specialties if you want them to be effective.

The story takes some unexpected and delightful turns, especially on some of the longer sidequests. You also have a good amount of influence on it, even in comparison to most RPGs. The outcomes of several quests and the overall story in your game will likely deviate a lot from what someone else did.

-

In conclusion, I recommend picking up the Blackguards bundle off of the Blackguards 2 Steam page whenever it goes on sale. The games are worth playing, so long as you can tolerate a few black spots on the gems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258192941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 4964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4964, 'last_played': 1524858473}
review:
[h1] 6,5/10 Affascinante sotto alcuni aspetti [/h1]

Grafica accettabile, reparto sonoro molto gradevole, la storia Ã¨ valida ma poteva venire molto meglio.

Storia interessante i combattimenti a turni ce ne sono troppi messi per allungare il brodo, in alcuni punti ci si annoia per la ripetivitÃ  mentre in altri i dialoghi, eventi inaspettati e trama sono molto piacevoli, dalle primare alle secondarie le missioni sono abbastanza varie, dei bug (parlo per la versione MAC) sono stato obbligato a riavviare degli scontri perchÃ¨ si bloccava, nulla di eccessivamente grave, solo un po frustrante.

Un sistema di LV up inizialmente complesso ma abbastanza varieggiato.

Bocciatura per la personalizzazione del personaggio in cui si dovrÃ  scegliere tra pochissimi visi di default (alcuni anche molto brutti) si avrebbe potuto arginare il problema con la varietÃ  di armi/armature e etc. che purtroppo le ho trovate troppo poche.

Tutto sommato Ã¨ stato divertente anche se non rimmarrÃ  negli annali come miglior rpg a turni resta un buon titolo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971663658', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1529068663}
review: Simple game, if a little clumsy with a pithy storyline and forgettable characters.  On balance a thumbs up, because it has such captivating graphics.  But graphics aren't everything, so if you're easaily bored by simplicity and repetition and uninspired gameplay, stay clear of this one.  A pity Steam don't give a third option, in additon to "like" and "dislike" -- a neutral choice for a so-so game.  I'd suggest popping it on your wishlist and waiting till it's at 90% off like I did, so you won't feel cheated if you find it tiresomely simple.  At just a few quid it passes the time nicely, at full price I'd be screaming for a refund.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088229804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 2373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2373, 'last_played': 1524608486}
review:
Blackguards ist meiner Meinung nach ein durchaus gutes rundenbasiertes Rollenspiel, sofern man einige EinstiegshÃ¼rden Ã¼bersteht.

Das Spiel basiert auf dem Regelwerk von "Das schwarze Auge" und ist eine PC-Version von den mehr oder weniger bekannten "Pen&Paper"-Spielen. Hierunter darf man sich eine Mischung aus Gesellschaftspiel, ErzÃ¤hlung und Improvisationstheater verstehen, welche eben einem recht strengen Regelwerk folgt.

Und hier liegt die EinstiegshÃ¼rde. Zum einen sind die Regeln nicht direkt aus dem Spiel-/Kampfablauf erkennbar, wodurch man nicht wirklich gut versteht wie die Aktionen Angriff, Parieren und Ausweichen mit diversen Spezialaktionen und Charakterattributen zusammenhÃ¤ngen. ZusÃ¤tzlich spielt halt noch ein gewisser Zufallsfaktor mit, da es eben sich um die Adaption eines (wÃ¼rfelbasierten) Gesellschaftsspiel handelt.

Und dann kommt noch hinzu, dass es ein "level-loses" Spiel ist. Man bekommt als Belohnung fÃ¼r KÃ¤mpfe und AuftrÃ¤ge sogenannte "Abenteuerpunkte". Diese werden fÃ¼r alle Aktionen verwendet, die einen Charakter betreffen. Das ErhÃ¶hen der Grundwerte, der Fertigkeiten, der WaffenfÃ¤higkeiten, sowie von SonderfÃ¤higkeiten und Zaubern (wenn der Charakter Magie begabt ist). Gerade zu Beginn ist man hier schnell Ã¼berfordert und man kann auch recht viel falsch machen.

Mein Tip ist: Bevor man das Spiel startet, sollte man sich erstmal mit dem Regelwerk auseinander setzen. Zum Beispiel gibt es bei Steam echt gute Guides/Anleitungen, die einem echt weiterhelfen und das nÃ¶tige VerstÃ¤ndnis schaffen.

Wenn man sich mithilfe eines Guides in das Regelwerk eingearbeitet hat, entfaltet die Charakterentwicklung sehr viel Potential. Man kann die Charakter nach Lust und Laune als NahkÃ¤mpfer, FernkÃ¤mpfer oder Magier spezialisieren. Man kann aber auch beliebige Kombinationen erstellen. Ausnahme sind die Zauber, diese kÃ¶nnen nur von Charakteren erlernt und angewendet werden, die Magie als Grundausrichtung haben. SchÃ¶n ist hier, dass sich die Charakter auch wirklich "anders" spielen, jenachdem welche Waffen sie beherrschen und Ã¼ber welche FÃ¤higkieten sie verfÃ¼gen.

Auch wird der Zusammenhang zwischen der einzelnen Werten und Fertigkeiten und dem Kampfsystem spÃ¼rbar verstÃ¤ndlich und man kann es gezielt ausnutzen um starke Charakterer zu entwicklen. Hier liegt dann wirklich eine groÃŸe StÃ¤rke des Spiels.

Die KÃ¤mpfe sind taktisch mitunter sehr fordernd, lassen sich aber hÃ¤ufig mit guten Management der FÃ¤higkeiten der Charaktere, Waffen und Zauber gut schaffen. Die Umgebung lÃ¤sst sich hÃ¤ufig auch mit in den Kampf einbinden, so dass auch hier taktische KÃ¤mpfe mÃ¶glich sind.

Das Spiel selber ist sehr story-lastig. Dies beruht wieder darauf, dass es sich um die Adaption eines Pen&Paper-Spiels handelt. Die Geschichte enthÃ¤lt einige Ãœberraschungen, den ein oder anderen Spannungsbogen und erzÃ¤hlt auch gut die Beziehungen zwischen den einzelnen Figuren. Diese wirken sehr passend fÃ¼r die AtmosphÃ¤re.

Zusammenfassend kann ich sagen, dass das Spiel sich lohnt. Man muss sich definitiv in das Spiel einarbeiten, am Besten mit Hilfe eines Guides. FÃ¼r Spieler die mal eben eine schnelle Runde "Monster-Metzeln" wollen ist es dagegen wahrscheinlich eher ungeeignet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068141034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 3046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3046, 'last_played': 1524708570}
review:
I have a bit more time logged than shown cuz I played offline. I'm in Chapter 4, and I think Ch 5 is the last one. 

People have panned this game, unfairly I think, it deserves much more than a 'mixed' response. 

It's a haxagonal spaces, turn based, team combat, rpg. The atmosphere is dark, tho not depressing, there's a lot of black humor, and violence humor. 

The team really are BlackGuards - blaggards! Your mage is a womanizer, your witch is a liar, the dwarf is like addicted to violence (don't let him speak to anyone lol! Unless, ofc, you want some more exp, but sometimes you can overdo it and sort of violence your way out the wrong end of a quest, or finish it too early because there's no players left in the storyline :s). 

Some of the things you do are very questionable. While you might do heroic stuff - rescue maidens, priests, etc. you're also going to beat people into servitude, frame people, kill them on a whim, or because someone paid you to do it. Sometimes you find a quest item, and it's actually an awesome peice of weaponry, and you lie to the guy who sent you looking for it. No, we didn't find it yet :) 

Occasionally you can use an alternative to violence, e.g. charm, negotiate, or bribe your way forward. But rah, it's the beatings that this game is all about! 

Now... whyyy it gets panned in reviews.... cuz the first two chapters are the most difficult.... they are very very difficult.... gold is hard to get, Action Points (AP) which are the building blocks for your skills, are slow to accumulate, and the dizzying array of skills and spells and talents you can spend them on just seem to absorb what little AP you get, to very little effect. All of the stats grow very slowly, and among them is the percentile chance of your attack actually hitting home. 

At this point in the game, ranged opposition like archers will chop your team to quivering sushi. Your healer runs out of mana crazy fast, and you can't afford the pots to boost him. You need to sleep in an inn after every battle to recover. 

Under these conditions, you... are... streeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeetched to your team's limits. You can have an okay team, statted as well as you can stat them for that time in the story/game, you know that if you could set up your ideal defence or offence layout, that you could probably whup anything... but.... the field of battle is not letting you! lol! Stretched thin, is your line, at your absolute limit of what each individual and the team as a whole is capable of dealing with.... so... in that situation... what's the feeling when one of your melee fighters fumbles a crucial attack, swings, misses, lets some beast thru that savages your mage, the whole thing 's toppling like a tower of cards! 

It happens over, and over.. sometimes it happens becuase you didn't figure the map/baddies or the battlefield layout properly. In the early days, there are things in the battle areas that you neeeed to take advantage of, or you're not gonna get thru the battle. In other words, you team isn't always enough, the first couopla chapters has you on a knife edge of whether you can or can't beat the battle you're in, and like I say, your actual hit success stats are low, the lowest they're ever going to be, so its really tough. 

It gets you determined tho! 

It riles you up, that's for sure. But there is a way to ease the strain of all this. 

I got to a particular battle.... the 8th part of The Nine Hordes (which isn't really what it sounds like) (no spiolers! I just mention it to segue into this story....)

It got me, over and over, and I juuuust couldn't see howww, howwwww I couold ever prevent x, y, and z, from happening.... there seemed nothing I could do... so... I went looking for a walkthru.... 

I found on YouTube, this guy, freaki'n pretending... pretending! To be playing BlackGuards for the first time.... all like, what's that? idk what they do.... while at the same time flashing through the ability menus like a pro, he was doing it far faster than me! and as well... this battle... this particular one I looked up like this... he's like... okay... this this, that that... he was WORSE than me! But he beat it.... and I'm like, wth!? They move differently against me! They run away and re-energise! They go straight for the maguffin and bring the battle to a sudden halt in just a few moves! Why didn't they do that to him!? 

So... this is when I took the nuclear option.... the ultimate in winning strategy! 

I accessed the difficulty settings and put the game on 'easy' :) 

Oh nowww! Nooowwwww those things move like they did for that guy in the YT vid! Omg!!! What a cheese! What a Cheese head thing to do! Put it on 'easy' and then pretend that you've never played it before, and be all like, hawwww-he-hawwww, euuuhhh, ohheyyyy, yeuuhhh,  yupyup, I'm so good.... WHAT!? You freaki'n moron! 

omg... so... anyway.... I made it soooo far, before changing the settings to 'easy' ... and rah! The AP accumlates quicker, the hit rate is higher on my team, and the battles come down from 'impossible' to 'manageable.' 

Then give it another chapter... oh thennn we see some payback! 

Then... thennnn.... you start to build those skills.. you've earned literally tens of thousands of AP... you've maxed some abilities out already... you barely miss hit anymore.... you don't need to use pots to repelnish your mage and witch, becuasse they generate mana as they go along! You don't need to sleep after every battle, because you can just heal at the start of the next one, and replenish mages while you and the bad guys are rushing toward each other. And arrows?
 Arrows?? Don't make me laugh! My men brush them aside! The team is strong! Very strong! 

My dwarf now has a 'hammerblow' ability, which gives him three times his attack power, at the cost of lower hit rate... it's 60% usually, his hit rate on that.... which means that more than half the time he's gonna use 3 times his power. ALWAYS use it! lolol! It's a bad guy crusher! He's an OHKO machine! 

So... the game is long.. the battles are long.. and it's a slow burner to get started.... the 'easy' setting feels like it should be the default setting, with the normal one as 'veteran' perhaps... that's how it feels compared to other games. 

And... its... satisfying! Ohhhhh yes, nowww we're motorin', nowww we're talkin'! This is what I wanted to see! My hard, hard team pushing back the bad guys, weathering their spell storms, brushing their arrows aside, and then SMAK!!!!! Oh yeahhhh! You deserved that! You thougth you'd get by because you paralyzed my healer? Think again! Wham-bam-balammmm! awwwwww, are you on the floor? Here, have a 100% chance of landing Power shot while you lay there! 

BAMMMMMMMMMMMMMM!!!!

Ha! Haaaaa! Yeahhhh! 

That's what this game is all about :) 

The graphics are good, I'd say, scenery is nice. Gameplay is compulsive and satisfying. The voice acting is amazing, I love it, there's real layers in the toning. Your witch is a Kiera Knightly-a-like, with that English sort of delectation on the ends of some of her words. Really a hot voice, and liek I say rich with character, it's difficult to even envision people are reading this stuff from sheets into microphones, these voices are so authentic.

Your own team, and people in towns, react to how beautiful your witch is :) tha'ts sorta fun :) 

The team is fun as a whole. 

I've already bought BlackGuards 2, on the basis of the first three chapters of this. I absolutely love it, I don't want it to end, it has me that gripped. 

Okay, it's not going to be for everyone, but I think... well crikey.... the sheer number of people complaining that the game is too difficult... fraaaa... you mean... you paid for the game... it stopped you in your tracks... so rather than lowering the difficulty setting, you throw that cash away, turn your nose up at the game, and leave a bad review? 

Nyeuuuhhh, don't listen to them. This is fantastic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107896640', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 857, 'last_played': 1524599377}
review:
I obtained a copy because the regional price for 1 & 2 bundle was barely more than 1 usd. The main features that attracted my attention was turn-based, hex playboard and rpg. I was a big fan of xcom games, and I was so impressed by Daedalic's blade of the shogun, so my expectation was high. The game turned out to be a real pain instead.

Technically, the game crashed on the first startup, with a full size loading screen that cannot be removed or superposed, and I had to force restart my pc. Also, every time I tried to adjust sound or any other options, the game will be reset to an 800x600 resolution with full screen. The font of the UI also look blurry at 1440p while the rest of the UI looks fine.

In terms of game mechanics, I should not impose my subjective opinion on others, but like many have said, the rng was no joke. For example, a weapon with a 2D6+3 damage (two dice rolls plus 3) generates an output ranging from 4 to 15, so most of the time you will find it futile to plan your moves since its performace is unpredictable out of proportion. Most of the time I find myself quickloading an encounter over and over to have the fight starts favorably, because otherwise I would not be able to progress through the game, since the quest lines are mostly plainly linear. For reference, I played on normal difficulty.

There are of course interesting aspects of this game. I enjoyed the voice acting, for what it's worth, and the skill tree is mildly interesting. The visual is ok, albeit the lack of horizontal camera rotation was irritating. All in all, I'd recommand you to just try out other rpgs like divinity series and pillar of eternity, or even heroes of might & magic 3 for the hex mechanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028993615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 1983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1761, 'last_played': 1522242303}
review:
The story is bland and the gameplay has annoying faults.
- camera can't be rotated - thus you end up fighting the camera more often than enemies
- there is no way to skip or speed up enemy turns - enjoy waiting for ages until a horde of zombies slowly walk to their destination one by one
- alt-tabbing pauses the game - so you can't skip enemy turns that way either
- inventory management is a pain - there are no option to sort equipment in any meaningful way, to compare an item across characters, the encumbrance system gets annoying fast
- the skill wheel is tiresome to navigate once all the hotkey skills are used up.

All these issues make the game feel more like a chore than something fun.

review:
Ã¨ un bel malloppo davvero questo gioco, sono ben venti giga da scaricare all'interno del vostro computer e ci potrebbero volere dei giorni per riuscirci
detto questo, diciamo che Ã¨ un titolo western rpg, con nani, elfi, goblin e via discorrendo
lo sviluppo dei characters Ã¨ la prima cosa che ho notato essere strana, Ã¨ un metodo bizzarro e difficile da descrivere a parole, riassumendo i programmatori non hanno impostato il salire di livello come avrebbero invece dovuto; ovvero con logica
la stessa cosa si puÃ² dire per le abilitÃ  di battaglia da utilizzare in guerra, tutto ha una tonalitÃ  offuscata e non precisa come invece dovrebbe
le colonne sonore sono davvero pessime e molto mal suonate, l'unica loro vera utilitÃ  Ã¨ il "pagliaccizzare" le nostre gesta
parliamo delle animazioni perchÃ© graficamente Ã¨ invece un bestione con cui dovrete scendere a patti con i settaggi per settarlo a dovere, i personaggi hanno delle animazioni che io personalente ho trovato strane, sembra quasi che il muoversi, costi loro eccessiva fatica, inoltre sono ridicoli e si muovono in maniera ridicola
a proposito della difficoltÃ , puntualmente il gioco, ti fa affrontare delle situazioni ben al di sopra delle nostre possibilitÃ , con un numero di nemici su schermo, puntualmente di gran lunga superiore al nostro
poi c'Ã¨ da segnalare invece un fattore molto positivo; ovvero il poter disporre di numerose tipologie di azioni negli scontri che generalmente, andranno a sfociare nell'interazione con l'ambiente
in ultimo voglio solo segnalare un evento molto strano, se il gioco mi dice che ho il 95% di possibilitÃ  di centrare un colpo di spada su un nemico, mi aspetto che esattamente come viene scritto, una volta su venti io possa effettivamente sbagliare il colpo, e invece no, a conti fatti io non so esattamente che colcoli faccia blackguards e che calcolatrice usi perchÃ© io personalmente ho fatto i conti, il 95% corrisponde piÃ¹ o meno al centrare 4 colpi su dieci
questo Ã¨ tutto
ne ho parlato male? non ho consigliato questo gioco? fregatevene e se potete acquistatelo, Ã¨ comunque un'ottima esperienza ed Ã¨ davvero molto divertente

author: {'steamid': '76561197993894575', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 253, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1523907291}
review:
Awful, kinda what I figured before making my purchase but got it for like 3 dollars so pulled the trigger hoping to find a hidden gem. 

The UI is terrible, it is so hard to even look at gear and compare; and mostly screens are void of essential information while being full of pointless gibberish.  The UI in battles is even worse. Almost impossible to click on the hex you mean to and half the time it just deselects it faster than you can left or right click; but you will be doing mostly right clicking as you have to go through three menus just to do a basic attack with both weapons when dual wielding. This game is a disaster in sensible UI design and function.

The game falls into a rut most clueless gameplay designers choose when building strategy games. Just another missing simulator that is more frustrating than tactical. I could miss or I could hit for 2 or I could hit for 11; who knows but canâ€™t create tactics around it.

I would just pass on this for any amount; itâ€™s just a generic strategy RPG that does everything wrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026383113', 'num_games_owned': 1217, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1391098109}
review:
A turn-based strategy RPG that will take you a very long time to get through.

I really enjoyed playing this game, as it has a strong story aspect & in-depth combat.

But a huge amount of time passes when your going through many parts of the game, would recommend to anyone with a lot of time & patients.

- Trop facile/difficile. Il suffit de quelques erreurs de rÃ©partition de points pour qu'un combat devienne horrible. A l'inverse Ã§a peut devenir trop facile et vous aimeriez passer le combat.
- "Et hop!" C'Ã©tait tendu Ã©quilibrÃ© aux deux premiers chapitres et au troisiÃ¨me j'ai rempli mes personnages de PA! J'ai maxÃ© plein de choses. Je ne sais pas trop quoi en penser...

author: {'steamid': '76561198071095171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7734, 'last_played': 1707687011}
review: I really love this game, even if it has it's limitations. It is very atmospheric and deep rooted within in the realms of Aventuria. Maybe not 100% accurate - but we're talking about a fictional universe anyways, right? So if you want to dive deeper into the realms of "Das Schwarze Auge"/ "The Dark Eye", I really can't recommend you this game enough. I had well fun with it. It is also quite close to the ruleset of the of the 4.1 Edition of Das Schwarze Auge and even thaught me some mechanics when I was new to the system. Many of the places and cities you visit have their own describtions and maps in supplements etc. - so there is a really rich background  you can really see (if you know where and what to look for) and feel in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028367646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3063, 'last_played': 1591356819}

author: {'steamid': '76561197978969288', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 2104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2104, 'last_played': 1522181263}
review:
Blackguards is a RPG with a lot of emphasis on combat, every encounter in the game was handicrafted and therefore can be very challenging, while the combat system can be ok and the game allows you to pursue a lot of different careers, the game suffers from a whole lot of problems, starting from its longevity, its pretty long and you'll be doing a lot of combat in this game, so if you're somebody that prefers comfy experiences in RPG you're in for a rough time with this game, its very action oriented and there's not much of roleplaying here. 
It's certainly a good game but if you give this game a shot, you're in for a bumpy ride.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149866476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2789, 'last_played': 1522010522}
review:
Daumen hoch!

Huhu, ich muss etwas weiter ausholen! 

Also ich habe einige schlechte Rezensionen gelesen, das Spiel aber in einem Bundle trotzdem erworben, da ich ein groÃŸer Daedalic-Fan bin. Ich war anfangs auch sehr genervt und hab den ersten Durchlauf als Magierin abgebrochen. 

Aber dann hab ich als Kriegerin losgelegt und anders geskillt. Wenn jemandem das Spiel nicht gefÃ¤llt, hatte er wohl einfach kein Interesse, sich mit dem System richtig auseinander zu setzen und mag keine rundenbasierten Spiele. Ich habe mir gerade den zweiten Teil gekauft und freue mich, gleich los zu legen.

Story/Hauptquest: Sehr fesselnd, ich wollte unbedingt wissen, wie es weiter geht. 

Nebenquests: Ich bin da ein kleiner Junkie, hoffe, ich habe alle erwischt. 
Am Anfang auf der Karte dachte ich, is ja etwas dÃ¼rftig, hoffentlich ist das Spiel nicht zu kurz und irgendwann kommt man dann auf die restliche Karte und denkt, das dauert bestimmt ewig, wie geil ist das denn!

Nachdem ich mich in das Gameplay und die Skills eingefunden habe, hat es mega viel SpaÃŸ gemacht! Ich gebe eine klare Empfehlung und werde es bestimmt noch ein paar mal spielen!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971355620', 'num_games_owned': 512, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1691, 'last_played': 1676229547}
review:
Descubri Deadalic por el juego llamado Deponia, el cual me gusto bastante y me parecio entretenido, ya que no so mucho de aventura grafica.

Vi este en ofertas de steam a un precio ridiculo, y me decidi a pillarlo, GRATA SORPRESA AMIGO!
Yo pense q ya no se hacian juegos de este estilo, por turnos de fantasia y jodidos como debe ser, me recuerda mucho a mis partidas de D&D 3,5 en mis tiempos mozos.. bueno un mozo sigo siendo pero ya me entiendes xD

A lo q voy q se me va la cabeza, si eres de esas personas q buscar un reto, pensar xq haces cada movimiento y para que, y escalonar tus jugadas pensado q va hacer la IA, un poco cheta aveces XD, y salga todo como tu kerias, lo cual da un gustico.....

RECOMENDADO SIN DUDA!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992456098', 'num_games_owned': 908, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1522852719}
review: I waited for the sale to buy this one, just because of the mixed reviews.  And all I have to say is that I simply love this one.  The storyline, the aesthetics, the premise, the mechanics, the difficulty... all of it... I've been waiting for this.  Longer than I should have.  I'm emmersed in it and very, very happy.  I don't recommend it, maybe it's not your cup of tea, or your brand of game.  Maybe you're not into something that's rogue and different... I just like it.  It's for me.

review: Un juego de combate por turnos y gestiÃ³n de escuadrÃ³n muy cuidado y desafiante. La historia, aunque escueta, es suficiente para mantenerte interesado. Los combates son todos interesantes, con escenarios estÃ©ticamente muy bonitos. Las decisiones que tomas como jugador en cuanto al inventario y progreso de tus personajes, realmente da la sensaciÃ³n de ser importante y determinante en la resoluciÃ³n de muchos combates. Si te gusta el gÃ©nero, este es un tÃ­tulo al que debes jugar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075880603', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1563, 'last_played': 1518993248}
review:
Si no quieres leer todo el analisis al final tienes una valoraciÃ³n numerica.

Blackguards nos pone en la piel de un grupo de marginados sociales y nuestro personaje, los cuales estan todos encerrados en la carcel por motivos injustos, Â¿o no? este peculiar grupo va a intentar salver el mundo no sin percances por el camino, Â¿Te fiaras de esta panda de criminales?

La idea era buena, mecanicas del juego de rol Dungeons and Dragons aplicadas a un juego por turnos en el que "podemos" elegir el camino de evoluciÃ³n de los pj... o eso pense al principio... la dificultad de los niceles varia absurdamente dejandote como unica opciÃ³n, empezar de nuevo e combate y rezar para que no te envenene esta vez, no falles todo el tiempo un golpe del 95% o que los enemigos caigan en tus trampas... esto una y otra vez.

La traducciÃ³n es "decente" no te vas a sorprender excepto en una de las ciudades ya el en ese momento el juego no esta traducido almenos 15-20 dialogos, no os preocupeis puesto que esta secciÃ³n es un ingles muy sencillo que todos podremos entender, si embargo lo que no podremos hacer es la cantidad de bugs, la falta de farmeo para que nuestros pj cojan exp equipo, etc la imposibilidad de tomar muchas de las decisiones (no os encariÃ±eis con la arquera drogata) y las dificultades constantemente cambiantes.

En definitiva un juaego que me ha dado unas 30h de diversiÃ³n/desesperaciÃ³n y que las ultimas horas me costo horrores jugar haciendolo obligado practicamente, teniendo un final decente.

Musica 4/10
Niveles 0/10
Apartado grafico 7/10
Mecanica 7/10
Histotia 6/10

ValoraciÃ³n final: 4,8 

DuraciÃ³n 20-40h
Rejugable NO

author: {'steamid': '76561198812268190', 'num_games_owned': 17, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1520312594}
review:
I am newer to the specific genre of hex grid games like this, or Turn-Based RPG.
I didn't like it, but I believe it is a pretty decent representation of what to expect.
The one thing I struggle to accept, is that there is a lack of camera controls, and honestly, sometimes you can barely click on an opponents feet in order to attack. It's a silly complaint, but a "zoom" feature, or "rotate camera" would in my opinion turn this rather blasÃ© gaming experience into a memorable excursion from the everyday grind of life.

7/10 Graphics
5/10 Mechanics
6/10 Story
----------
6/10 Overall

author: {'steamid': '76561198009190567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 3513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1118, 'last_played': 1589311791}
review:
If this were a phone app It would be great! unfortunately It is a "game", it is really a point and click interactive story that is interupted by anoying battles.

POOR and repetative. 
Over complicated armour and weapons system.
Graphic style makes it look ten years older than it is.
Charecters are weak story-wise, i do not care about what happens to them.
NPC encounters are linear and dull.
trade system is needlesly awkward.

Plus points,
Story is ok, but battles feel like they interupt it. Or maybe it is the other way around. 
You can smash objects in fights that add some tactical advantages.

Bottom Line. Buy if it is on sale and you don't have anything else to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008324440', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 5651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5651, 'last_played': 1519766143}
review:
Phex zum GruÃŸe!

Fans von Games mit rundenbasierenden ("Schachbrett-") KÃ¤mpfen Ã¤hnlich wie in "M&M: Heroes", "Disciples" oder "Grotesque Tactics"werdem mit Sicherheit auf ihre Kosten kommen. Bei Blackguards fÃ¼rht ihr allerdings keine Armeen in die Schlacht, sondern "nur" euch selbst und eure Heldentruppe.

Das Spiel ist unter einer DSA-Lizenz (Das schwarze Auge/Pen & Paper RPG) erschienen. Ihr spielt also in Aventurien. Die Regeln sind etwas angepasst (soweit ich das sagen kann), alte DSA-Veteranen werden sich in den Talenten, Zaubern u.Ã¤. aber schnell zurecht finden. Alle anderen aber auch nach kurzer EingewÃ¶hnung. Entweder erklÃ¤rt der Infotext Funktionen und Items oder das kompakte Ingame-Tutorial bringt Licht ins Dunkel.

Die Story ist ok, keine groÃŸen Ãœberraschungen oder Wendungen, welche man nicht erahnen kann. Ihr werdet eines Mordes angeklagt, den ihr vermutlich nicht begangen habt. Schnell zeigen sich auch Anzeichen, dass der Kult des Namenlosen wohl auch seine Finger mit im Spiel hat. Neben der Hauptquest gibt es zahlreiche Nebenquest, diese sollte man am besten auch alle erledigen. Die Erfahrungspunkte und Belohnungen sind relativ wichtig fÃ¼r ein sicheres vorankommen im Spiel.

Da alle Zauber, Angriffe, Talentanwendungen im DSA Stil ausgewÃ¼rfelt werden, kann der Chaosfaktor manchmal recht hoch sein. Deshalb immer:

SOS (SEHR OFT SPEICHERN)

und nicht gleich verzagen, wenn ein Kampf mal 4-5 AnlÃ¤ufe braucht. Nutzt Gifte, Fallen und benutzbare Punkte (Hotkey: V) auf dem Schlachtfeld.

Mit den erhaltenen Erfahrungspunkten kÃ¶nnt ihr eure Charaktere direkt aufleveln. Einen "richtigen" Levelaufstieg gibt es nicht. Je nach HÃ¶he des angestrebten Wertes im Talent/Attribut/Kampfskill zahlt ihren einen mit jedem mal steigenden Betrag an XP. Das kÃ¶nnt ihr, auÃŸer im Kampf, jederzeit machen. 

Die Grafik ist kein Ãœberflieger, sondern eher zweckdienlich. Reicht aber vollkommend fÃ¼r vollen SpielgenuÃŸ, wenn einem die Sicherungen noch nicht durchgeschmorrt sind und man auÃŸer Grafik auch noch andere Dinge in Spielen wertschÃ¤tzen kann. Die Vertonung ist auch in Ordnung fÃ¼r so ein kleines Spielprojekt und spiegelt wie auch die Grafik das finanzielle Budget der Entwickler wider.

KÃ¤fer habe ich im Spiel bis auf einen keine gefunden: In einem Dungeon konnte ich die Druckplatten nicht so aktivieren, dass eine TÃ¼r aufgeht. Ein Neustart der Kampfes hat Abhilfe geschafft. 


Fazit: DSA Fans & AnhÃ¤nger des rundenbasierten Goblinkloppens werden bestimmt auf ihre Kosten kommen. Grafik-
 und HD Junkies sollten Abstand halten. Ebenso Menschen fÃ¼r die es nur Top Games (<80% Wertungen/aktuelle Engine/etc) gibt und alles darunter nicht so ist, wie sie es mÃ¶gen und kennen.

La seconde fois, j'ai mieux gÃ©rÃ©. Mais Ã  la fin, une grosse pÃ©riode wtf qui m'a saoulÃ©. 

Au final... je ne le recommande pas. Mais ce serait plus un bon, tentez, chacun est diffÃ©rent, et rÃ©agit diffÃ©remment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045783871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1955, 'last_played': 1528135799}
review:
L'Oeil Noir... Que de bons moments dans cet univers de jeu de rÃ´le...
Dommage que Blackguards n'arrivent pas Ã  la cheville de lÃ  d'oÃ¹ il est tirÃ©. Et je dis dommage, car que de possibilitÃ©s, de bonnes intentions et de potentiel ! Malheureusement, ce dernier n'est en rien rÃ©vÃ©lÃ© sous un bon jour. Alors certes, on est heureux de trouver un arbre de compÃ©tence, la possibilitÃ© de mÃ©langer les genres et les couleurs dans la construction de son personnage, une ambiance sympathique et bel et bien digne de l'hÃ©roÃ¯c fantasy mais... Ca s'arrÃªte lÃ .

Les lourdeurs s'enchaÃ®nent rapidement, passÃ© les premiÃ¨res heures de jeu, Ã  commencer par un scÃ©nario bancal, pas vraiment intÃ©ressant car totalement obscur du dÃ©but Ã  la fin et dont la chute (non, je sais, je n'ai pas fini le jeu mais franchement, c'est tellement bateau que ca en devient navrant) n'apporte aucune surprise et ne semble mÃªme pas bien menÃ©e. Dommage pour un jeu de rÃ´le...
Alors forcÃ©ment, si le scÃ©nario est en carton, les personnages sont en... papier mÃ¢chÃ©, hein. Pas vraiment de relief, pas de pronfondeur dans leur personnalitÃ©, seulement superficielle, sans compter que le personnage principal est sans doute le pire de tous (appelez-le NarutardÃ© mental, ce sera parfait !).
Enfin l'interface et le gameplay. : sympathique au dÃ©but, ils enchaÃ®nent les lourdeurs, l'arbre des compÃ©tences est fourni, certes, mais trop et dans n'importe quel sens et je vous souhaite de ne pas tomber sur des combats contre des zombis ou autres crÃ©atures avec 2 de tension, car alors cela prend une lonnnngueur, mais une lonnnnnnnnnngueur !...

Blackguards, de trÃ¨s belles promesses et un rÃ©el potentiel pour un jet d'Ã©chec critique. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198084584379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 988, 'last_played': 1482958272}
review:
You could have told me this game came out in 1995 and I would have believed you - but no, 2014... Note, this is not just because of the odd artistic choices of the developers, but also because of the clunky mechanics and obtuse progression system. All of this echoes from an era where we "didn't know" what to do about these things - but sadly, we do know... and the reminiscnence of ignorant times isn't charming or fun, it's just annoying. There's also a massive difficulty spike about 5 hours into the game - if you have misbuilt your hero, you may need to restart the game to rectify your mistake... something that wouldn't be a big deal if it weren't for sub-par voice acting and a very disappointing plot line. The freedom to f*@& up is there, which is a good thing. 
2/5 for story
3/5 for gameplay
4/5 for difficulty
1/5 for visual appeal

author: {'steamid': '76561198005059057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5362, 'last_played': 1519513243}
review:
There's a lot to like about Blackguards. The story is decent enough that you should have fun, and the voice acting is really high quality. Finding items to put on your characters feels like scrounging around, trying to cobble together something decent until you finally get that nice suit of armor -- an experience I personally enjoy.

The combat animations are quick enough that I never felt impatient waiting for them to resolve, and the available spells offer some really great tactical options.

So why am I giving this game a thumbs down?

There's no respec. The battles are tough enough that you have to optimize your character builds to progress the story or defeat the higher level side quests, and I've made some build choices that I had no way of knowing would not be viable. I'm no stranger to tough tactical battles, but without some kind of mechanic to either respec my points, or grind new points to correct my errors, my game is over.

I'm going to cheat and finish the story, but that shouldn't be necessary.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029288199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1501707029}
review:
Ich muss sagen es ist ein sehr schÃ¶nes Spiel, welches einiges zu bieten hat. Man hat schÃ¶ne KÃ¤mpfe, eine normale Story und man kann sich mit dem Spiel gut die Zeit vertreiben.
Zu 90 % kommt man auch mit 1, 2 oder 3 AnlÃ¤ufen durch eine Quest durch. 
Man muss teilweise taktisch gut Denken und seine Schritte im Voraus plannen, was auch sehr viel Spass macht.

ABER, es gibt Quests wo ich selbst nach Ã¼ber 50 Versuchen es nicht geschafft habe diese zu erledigen. Um aber die Story weiter erleben zu kÃ¶nnen, musste ich "gezwungenermaÃŸen" cheaten bzw einen Trainer benutzen der mir hilft die Mission zu schaffen. Sehr nervig!
Das Endspiel ist einfach nur trÃ¤ge und zieht sich ewig in die lÃ¤nge. Alleine das die Gegner ewig fÃ¼r ihren Zug brauchen nervt ab einem gewissen Zeitpunkt, genauso wie die immer gleichen SprÃ¼che der Helden. Wenn man in einer Kampfrunde gegen Gegner mit Gift 10-15 mal den Spruch hÃ¶ren muss "Ich hasse Gift" und das Ã¼ber teilweise 20-30 Kampfrunden verzweifelt man irgendwann daran.
Der einzige Grund warum ich mich durch dieses Spiel bis zum Ende durchgeqÃ¼Ã¤lt habe, war, dass ich das Ende erleben wollte.
Und....
Einfach nur EnttÃ¤uschend. Mehr als das... man sieht die Helden in einer Reihe stehen und der Zwerg fragt die Magierin nur eine einfach Frage die zwar zum Spiel gehÃ¶rt aber in diesem Augenblick absolut unnÃ¶tig ist. Nach 30 Sekunden ohne nennenswerte Handung ist das Spiel vorbei. Nichts .... einfach nichts.... Genauso wie der Abspann von Demonicon. Genauso sinnfrei.
Einfach nur Traurig. 

Kauft euch bloÃŸ nicht dieses Spiel. Selbst mit 90 % Rabatt ist es immer noch zu teuer fÃ¼r so einen MIST. 

PS: Ich bin jahrelanger DSA-Spieler. Dieses Spiel ist eine einzige Klopperei. Kaum mehr. LEIDER.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998233236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1520880631}
review: A mio parere si tratta di una piccola perla.  Certo, i ritmi sono compassati e la grafica magari accusa un po' il peso degli anni, ma la componente gdr e quella tattica alla X-Com sono ben implementati. Gli scontri sono molto interessanti. E finora anche la storia riesce a mantenere alta la curiositÃ , malgrado alcuni dialoghi non riuscitissimi. Considerando che ormai spesso si trova in offerta davvero a poco (io ho preso il bundle con il 2 che dicono sia anche piÃ¹ riuscito a soli 4,90) ne consiglio caldamente l'acquisto ai saggi giocatori old school che amano le belle trame e un bel livello di sfida.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077629735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1847, 'last_played': 1509411634}
review:
Ufff, no sÃ© por dÃ³nde empezar. Llevo unas cuantas horas jugadas y no tengo claro quÃ© puedo decir de este juego. Por un lado puede que sea un buen juego de combates por turnos (tampoco lo tengo claro), pero por otro lado lo considero un pÃ©simo juego de rol. La historia es lineal, los escenarios pobres y con apenas capacidad de interacciÃ³n, mÃ¡s propios de una aventura grÃ¡fica que de un juego de estas caracterÃ­sticas. Hay momentos en los que da la sensaciÃ³n de estar viendo una pelÃ­cula entre combate y combate. Por muy tÃ¡cticos que sean, los combates se hacen pesados y repetitivos, en parte porque los enemigos no ofrecen mucha variedad, en parte porque la evoluciÃ³n de los personajes no permite incrementar las habilidades con la suficiente celeridad. 
En definitiva, creo que no vale demasiado la pena, pero entiendo que a los fanÃ¡ticos de los combates por turnos les pueda gustar ya que al fin y al cabo es una sucesiÃ³n de combates con un mapa y unas ridÃ­culas pantallas entre ellos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082493342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2830, 'last_played': 1516315380}
review:
Be prepared for a long haul. 
The game is amazing, but the beginning is a bit of a chore. 
Getting your character to a state where a group of 4 characters can take on 4 enemies will take you atleast 10 hours. 
The payout is a game that has your character killing multiple enemies by the end .
Frustrating at the beginning, immensely satisfying by the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966760304', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1549024748}
review:
Bought this in the last Steam sale after a couple of years of it in my wishlist, should I or shouldn't I...

No real game. Just a story with hex grid-based field fighting, which is done fairly well. Very RNG based.

Overall, game is ok, but would be a better mobile game than a PC game. Can't recommend as a PC game.

review: Szczerze, spodobaÅ‚a mi siÄ™. LubiÄ™ erpegi, gram aktualnie w drugÄ… czÄ™Å›Ä‡, ktÃ³ra juÅ¼ mniej mi sie podoba, aczkolwiek polecam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198306649890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 1943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1943, 'last_played': 1515582179}
review:
Its a good game to play after you played multiple games with interesting story, options in beginning to choose from basic set up with starts you package of mage, archer and warrior, whilst if you choose expert mode choice is you get choose warrior/archer together, mage it cost you 500 ap. 

AP translate into Adventure points They are crucial to gaining maximum on any of panels. 
Weapon panel is 18 if you get that far one your characters becomes weapon master. 

Story is sad but interesting to complete there are many options of temptation, but how to make money, I don't know don't ask me. You could sell all our gear still don't make profit. If your warrior and you get tome your tempted to use tome on your available magic person but half its value and selling has bigger profit margin it keep your economy afloat. 


You can choose either sex and name which is pretty interesting then for first part of it your wanted fugitive the second part your a gladitator you could get test what that like if you go with dwarves get sample what that like. 

there are walkthroughs if I had known that I probably would used it help get pass a difficult part, baroness area if you survive it and still end up with her dying you might want to find the walkthrough states how you doing it wrong. 
It was interesting read if you get my meaning. 

I still have defeat the game once again I have to get to it when "goat" chores are done.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970456109', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1515107542}
review: Another game I thought I wanted that really sucked. Glad it was on sale. Buy this if your a glutton for punishment. I *knew* there was a reason why I hesitated so long to buy it. Pick this title up ONLY if you want the reason to buy a new keyboard,mouse or monitor. At some point you might break, throw or smash over your leg in frustration with that games "cheating" mechanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052353402', 'num_games_owned': 637, 'num_reviews': 856, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1514982059}
review:
7 out of 10.
Blackguards is not that bad of a game as some reviews might suggest, but it is is clearly much worse than most of the modern RPGs with turn-based combat. I'd still recommend it but only for fans of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005650677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 2867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2074, 'last_played': 1543159444}
review: If you like DSA this is the game for you. It can be pretty challenging at times and there are no save in battles, so if you have a low frustration tolerance, maybe this is not for you. Any RPG / Strategy lover should have a look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070568882', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1983, 'last_played': 1514872132}
review:
Buscaba , solo un entretenimiento pasajero, que equivocado estaba , me ha enganchado , desde los primeros minutos, la historia , no es que se diga muy profunda , y las armas pocas , pero al ser menos profundo que otro juegos de rol , y de combates por turnos , las horas se te van voladas , ahora queda terminar el juego y empezar , por su segunda parte, que por lo que leo , es aun mejor , que este.

Contras: Hombre graficamente , ni en su epoca era un portento, miralo como el hermano "muy tonto" de titulos mas serios"

Pero como ya he dicho antes engancha , y que mas quieres , por un buen precio mas de 30 horas de entretenimiento , pocos te lo van a dar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014628174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1514807365}
review: As much as I like the freedom of putting skills anywhere you want I equally hate the forced combat decisions,you have to do this or lose.pull a lever that's behind enemies.cover an endless spawning hole that's behind arches and enemies and so on(they don't grant extra exp. if you're wondering).....the Game gets really frustrating unfortunately. I play games for pleasure not to get pissted(like I am now after trying to save the baroness 5 times in a row-have to do it in 5 turns 3 of us vs. 7 of them with traps that end your turn and archers and crap-guess what you have to do cross 2 bridges behind enemies and then fight everyone you ignored and that surrounded you so you can save  her) unninstal

author: {'steamid': '76561198031359449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1514447985}
review:
they give you many options to put points into your character but the actual game design actually forces the player to select a few. Otherwise you will encounter difficulty spikes which no chance of success.

other than a few interesting concepts of cover and enviromental interaction, which unfortunately are half baked and missing in most of the game, the graphics/sound/UI/world design/lore/economics is all 3rd rate, B-to-C grade fantasy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035524768', 'num_games_owned': 835, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1034, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 968, 'last_played': 1706740314}
review:
This game feels more like a puzzle solver than an RPG. Not my kind of game.

There is no Farming. If you make some bad choices with your "level ups" you might just not make it. Combat is mostly trial and error, but you don't even know if your character is even able to handle the situation. In the end, a lot of wasted time.
