author: {'steamid': '76561198001570682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2530, 'last_played': 1513439958}
review:
Plot was dull.
Graphics and sound were OK.
Gameplay was OK.
Level design was awful.  I do not recommend this game due to how poorly the levels were designed.  They detract from the fun and make the game just not fun to play.
Character selection was non-existant.  There does not appear to be any real choices to make when establishing your team.  For a team-based RPG, the lack of selection does not allow for varied gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052213780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1476, 'last_played': 1512069736}
review:
Overall I don't dislike the concept of focusing on combat and just having light rpg-elements. The biggest problem in this game however is how akward the mechanics of the black eye system are. Leveling your characters feels tedious and not rewarding, the combat is full of ridiculous rng and so on...
I'm really glad they streamlined a lot of things for Blackguards 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013296662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1408, 'last_played': 1512600697}
review:
This game gets a bad rap.  I always enjoyed this game.  Enough for a second play-through.
I generally get frustrated with RPGs if they wast my time, ect.  I don't have that problem with this game.

It'd be sad if the poor reviews caused this to be overlooked for one of the many actually BAD RPGs out there.

review:
Rol de verdad, por turnos y difÃ­cil. Necesitas pensar, fallar, volver a intentarlo, tener suerte en las tiradas y sobre todo paciencia. Algunas veces pensarÃ¡s que no puedes avanzar, porque no tienes suficiente potencial con tu equipo. Carga una partida anterior y haz misiones menores para mejorar. Equilibra el tipo de personajes y su tabla de evoluciÃ³n. 
Pasar de un combate complicado te darÃ¡ un momento de placer que no te darÃ¡n los juegos de rol de la nueva era.

Si jugaste a D&D o El seÃ±or de los anillos cuando eras joven (nada de ordenadores) segurÃ³ que te dejarÃ¡ buen sabor de boca. Si lo tuyo es la partida rÃ¡pida... no te lo recomiendo

author: {'steamid': '76561198031041139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 4063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4027, 'last_played': 1511707756}
review:
I'm really conflicted about this game, and it is hard to give it the thumb down, because there is a lot of good in it.
But for every great moment, there was another when I wanted to slit my own wrists...
I bought it out of pure nostalgia, it is an old school, turn based RPG, that you would have played in the '90s.
It is complex in a good way, not so easy like modern PRGs, quests are connected, they form a coherent world.
But the difficulty is uneven. Almost every battle has a gimmick or trick to it, like in one you need to kill a necromancer, and skeletons are spawning endlessly until you do, or in another you have to destroy a crystal, that is healing your enemies, or you need to avoid standing in water etc. It is interesting and fun when it works, but gets very frustrating when it doesn't, and you have no clue what you are supposed to do, and fight off endless waves of enemies until your party dies. Because of this and unclear objectives it sometimes feels unfair, I'm not proud to admit, that I rage-quit it a couple of times.
The story is one of the strong points of the game, it is competently written with genuinely good plot twists, interesting characters. Voice acting is generally decent for an indy game, but there are a couple of weak performances.
But the ending is underwhelming, the only thing I felt was relief, that it's over, and I can stop playing it...
Graphics is dated a bit, but the magic effects look pretty and powerful.
There are a couple of annoying little problems too:Quests are easy to miss. If you restart a battle (and you will), you have to watch the dialogue again and again, you can only skip one line at a time. There is no way to rotate the camera, only elevate it a bit, so sometimes walls, trees and such obstruct your vision of the battle. There is no way to store your gear, so you either drag everything around and encumber your party, or sell everything and hope you will not need it later on.

I really want to like this game, but I cannot honestly recommend it. Hope the devs improved it in the sequel...

author: {'steamid': '76561198073380932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 4836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4836, 'last_played': 1418477263}
review:
One of the most underrated games for me. While not for everyone it has a pretty fun combat mechanic based on the TDE rules and close to XCOM. The story is quite dark and interesting there are some decisions to make but it is not as story driven as classic RPGs like Pillars of Eternity for example.

Before you buy this game you should ask yourself a question: Are you okay with the highly percentage reliant combat? If yes then this game is for you. It is really hardcore and not forgiving you may come to a point in the game when you realize that your party setup is messed up - restart is the only possibilty then. But then again if you use half a brain and don't try to get the jack of all trades but try to specialise the game is really rewarding. There is nothing more satisfying than proceed in the game after 20 tries by using the environment and everything perfectly - and maybe do your decisive kill by a lucky punch in the end.

One of the main reasons for the critics is part of the UI: while you can see the percentage to hit a target (close to XCOM as already mentioned) you can't see your parry chance i.e. once you hit with let's say 75% chance your opponent still has the chance (let's say 50%) to parry your attack. In the end you might only have a chance of 38% for example to actually do damage to your target.
But then again your opponents rely on the same rules.

At the end of the day this is one of my favorite games of all times it feels like a strategic Dark Souls. But it is not flawless

review: NÃ£o consigo descrever. Amo RPG, e esse aqui me surpreendeu em todos os aspectos. Comprei o jogo, achando que era simples, comum e sÃ³ com grÃ¡ficos bonitos. Ele Ã© muito mais do que isso. Recomendo Ã  jogadores mais habituados com o sistema de distribuiÃ§Ã£o de pontos de um RPG tÃ¡tico, porque cada ponto vai fazer a diferenÃ§a, entÃ£o gaste com sabedoria. O jogo Ã© lindo, a qualidade grÃ¡fica dele Ã© incrÃ­vel. Tem uma resposta do comando sensacional, alguns bugzinhos BEEEM esporÃ¡dicos mas se o jogador for calmo e nÃ£o se incomodar, Ã© possÃ­vel jogar tranquilamente sem ficar preocupado (comigo Ã© complexo ver os hexagonos coloridos bugados, pelo meu TOC de perfeccionismo). E por fim, o jogo tem uma trilha sonora linda. Eu simplesmente me pego vÃ¡rias vezes fazendo o som da trilha simplesmente porque Ã© muito gostosa de se ouvir. Recomendo muitÃ­ssimo pra outras pessoas que buscam por um bom RPG, com uma BOA histÃ³ria, com bons e diversificados comandos, alÃ©m de uma excelente capacidade criativa de batalhas com uma trilha ainda melhor do que a anterior! Personagens muito carismÃ¡ticos, e que em vÃ¡rios pontos, vocÃª vai sentir as mesmas dores que eles! Comprem o jogo se gostarem do estilo, vale muito a "pena" e a "galinha" inteira!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044487090', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3044, 'last_played': 1404175947}
review:
There are a lot of great reviews for this game already so I'll keep this simple. Back when I played Blackguards, I was really look for something to scratch that tactical rpg itch and it looked like a great fit and- I was not dissapointed. There are certainly low points as the story can lose itself from time to time and make it difficult to be invested, the loading every city and every conversation can get agonizing espicially when continually checking every person in every location is the only real way to make sure you aren't missing content as completing story battles moves the world forward and there are certain huge diffculty spikes in story battles (a certain one protecting a woman from bugs comes to mind). Taking all of this into account, though I still found myself staying up well into the next day playing, which I hadn't done for a single player game in years. 

Slogging into melee feels good, the plethora of spells and the differences from each spell's levels keep combat varied, every map has something to interact with in the environment and no matter how long the loading takes it feels so rewarding to find some guy on the other end of the world that suddenly wants you to clear out a non-story tower after completing a entirely unrelated story mission.

 I fully enjoyed this game even while this indie company struggling to translate an obscure table top rpg into a game is fairly apparent, it still managed to capture that feeling of adventure and optimization that table tops give you

Great game
Got it and the sequel on sale from a humble bundle dirt cheap (as in less than 5 bucks for it, sequel and other games)
Game is a bit dark and slow (not that that is a bad thing). Story is cryptic so while you want to know more, you cannot count on definite answers.
Half the fun is learning the combat on the fly. You get to realize how inter-actable the environment is (using forcefields to create choke points/preventing flanking or even causing a hallways through your other units who have attacks of opportunity or blowing up swamp gas bubbles etc)
It is rare to have 100% hit chance so some people are complaining about that but I didn't find that to be an issue. Game is difficult but generally, that is what people want from tactical rpgs. It has a unique feature where you can forgo your characters turn to attack in exchange for extra movement. I probably wouldn't pay full price for this but if you can get it on sale, it is great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019391728', 'num_games_owned': 376, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1440863810}

author: {'steamid': '76561198126131226', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 820, 'last_played': 1549245165}
review:
[table]
    [tr]
        [th]Catagories[/th]
        [th]Ranking[/th]
        [th]Summery[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Value[/td]
        [td] $2.99 (Normally $19.99)  [/td]
        [td] Wow, I've got to say I got one hell of a sale on this one folks. Very much worth the $2.99 I paid for it. BUT is it worth the $19.99 it normally costs? Yeah honestly it is, I'm not super huge on the whole Turn-based strategy genre but I've got to admit its got a great story that keeps it moving and its not a super long wait between rounds which is really nice. Itâ€™s a great game to play on the side of doing some other stuff. [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Gameplay[/td]
        [td] 8 stars[/td]
        [td] Like I said I'm not  huge on this genre but damn me if all the turn-based games were like this I would definitely play more of them. The fluid and relatively quick game play in combination with the story line is pretty damn good if you ask me. Though I do wish there was more ability to wander around like you had in the Heroes of Might and Magic games or do a lot of side quests to level up.  [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Story[/td]
        [td] 8 stars[/td]
        [td] It's no Lord of the Rings by any means but I've got to say I find it fairly gripping. I mean I've ignored a lot of the side quests pretty easilyâ€¦ its almost like I got tunnel vision there from time to time. The story starts with one of those "wtf is going on here? I donâ€™t get what's going onâ€¦" sort of situations and if you're anything like me, you've got to find out what is going onâ€¦. [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Social System[/td]
        [td] N/A [/td]
        [td] Single Player Game [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Community[/td]
        [td] 7 stars[/td]
        [td] They all seem to be a decent group of people though some can be a bit brutal in their honesty.  If I had read the community forums prior to purchase I MIGHT have second guessed my purchase. Lets get this straight. The games RNG can be fairly brutal and you may curse it up and down repeatedly. But if you sit back and take your time to really plan out your characters its pretty damn fun. Yes you do have to put some effort into planning ahead with this game! So be prepared to not go and try to make your character an almighty god among men who can do and be anything they want. [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Graphics[/td]
        [td] 7 stars[/td]
        [td] They're not bad honestly my one complaint is the text box location within the UI but thatâ€™s not really graphics thatâ€™s the UI. So take that as it is Graphics :Thumbs Up: UI :Meh: [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Ease of Learning[/td]
        [td] 8 stars[/td]
        [td] It's fairly easy to learn and the DO include a pretty good tutorial in the game so read that and you should be good. The trouble is your character planningâ€¦ I know I had a bit of an issue at the start and had to restartâ€¦ 6 times I think? Other than that I'd say yeah pretty easy to learn. [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Playable Factions[/td]
        [td] Factions N/A[/td]
        [td] This is an RPG with Turn-based combat there really aren't factions to worry about. [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Combat Style[/td]
        [td] 9 stars[/td]
        [td] High marks for this one, Like I said I'm not big on this RTS/ Turn-based stuff but the combat is pretty fluidâ€¦ The combats difficulty spikes on the other handâ€¦ wow I thought I had the game all sorted out, then the Bailiff showed up the first timeâ€¦. Wow was not expecting that sort of resistance. It took me a number of WTF moments before I sorted out my strategy and succeeded. Honestly if your playing to have fun and enjoy the story you may want to hunt down the god cheats or a trainer or something other wise its like reading a book and going back to re read that last battle scene 7-8 times because its garbled Englishâ€¦.. written by a 3 yr oldâ€¦.. in crayonâ€¦. upside down.  [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Soundtrack[/td]
        [td] 7 stars[/td]
        [td] Its nothing super stellar id say but its pretty smooth, and a great ambient feature. [/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

Final Thoughts:
I really didnâ€™t know what to expect when I bought this one, I half watched the videos and thought "cool a fantasy rpg where I can be a mageâ€¦" and tossed it into the wish list for about half a year, saw it on sale and said to myself "hell why not." In the end I'm really happy with the purchase, thrilled I got it so cheap but honestly I think id be happy with it even if I got it for the full price. Great little buy for anyone who likes to put some decent thought and planning into a character.

review:
Der GlÃ¼cksfaktor ist einfach viel zu hoch und mir kommt es so vor, als ob es fÃ¼r jeden Kampf nur einen Weg gibt ihn zu gewinnen. Und das alles fÃ¼hrt zu viel Laden, Probieren und Frustration. 
Wenn die Charaktere nicht entsprechend gelevelt sind, dann klappts manchmal auch gar nicht.

Ich habe nichts gegen eine Herausforderung, aber ein Taktik-Spiel sollte eben ein Taktik-Spiel sein und kein GlÃ¼cksspiel.

Und damit meine ich nicht, dass mal eine 95 % Chance daneben geht, sondern dass ein kompletter Kampf verloren gehen kann, wenn 1-2 80 % Chancen daneben gehen

author: {'steamid': '76561198079854208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 4560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4283, 'last_played': 1509265178}
review:
I don't think that I would like to buy a sequel of part two of this game. It had a great plot, it's own lore but the crappiest ending I ever got from a game. I know there are multiple endings... I got the one where I got to rescue the girl, passed all the challenges and got the dwarf saying "No more secrets". Anyone can tell me if there was any better ending than that?

I'm not sure if I can recommend the game having such a lame ending. If you wish to play a good strategy game with it's unique rules and story plot. Be my guess, just to complain not being warned when you get the ending. Well, the ending might just be subjective for me being lame but look great for someone else (Some who might have no idea of a quality ending at all)

Celui a distance t'inflige 10 points de dÃ©gats en moyenne alors que tes personnages ne possÃ©dent qu'une trentaine de points de vie et celui au corps Ã  corps bloque toutes tes attaques, empoisonne quand il attaque, si tu passe Ã  cÃ´tÃ© de lui il te met un coup et t'empoisonne et fait du 10 points de dÃ©gats aussi, sans oublier qu'il se regÃ©nÃ©re tous les deux. Comment les battre ?!
- 2Ã©me cas: tu doit sauver une baronne de la pendaison, pour cela le jeu te dit que tu doit passer le deuxiÃ©me ponts en moins de 5 tours MAIS sur le chemin il y a une dizaine de gars qui dÃ¨s le premiers tour mettent des obstacles sur ton chemin pour pas que tu passe et se mettent Ã  s'agglutiner derriere ces obstacles. Donc tu doit casser les obstacles et faire en sorte de tuer des gars pour te frayÃ© un chemin. SEULEMENT, tu atteint les obstacles Ã  la fin du premier tour, au deuxieme tour tu doit casser les obstacles, au troisieme tour en admÃ©tant que tu a rÃ©ussi Ã  Ã©viter les gars, tu vient seulement de passer le premier pont. AprÃ©s tu te prend sur le deuxiÃ©me pont des piÃ©ges invisible qui te coupe net dans ton Ã©lan et au cinquiÃ©me tour en admetant toujours que tu arrive a Ã©viter les mecs qui se mettent devant toi pour te bloquer tu arrive Ã  la sauver. CEPENDANT, pour gagner il ne te reste plus qu'a tous les tuer sachant que tu a speeder pour la sauver et donc Ã©viter un max de frapper les gens pour pas gaspiller un tour mais que toi tu a pris tous les dÃ©gats du monde, il rest 10 pv Ã  tes personnages pour tuer 10 gars en full pv qui font du 10 points de dÃ©gats. Comment faire ?!
De plus, on nous donne des pourcentages de chances de rÃ©usite pour les coups donnÃ©s, mais quand ta un coup qui a 95% de chance de rÃ©ussir et que sur une dizaine de coup, il y en a 4-5 qui on ratÃ©, on ce pose des questions. Surtout avec le mage, de un il a pas de vie et deux deux il rate quasiment tous ces sorts.
Bref, je trouve que ce jeu Ã  du potentiel, les graphisme sont plutÃ´t bon, l'histoire est simple mais entrainante, des quettes annexes plutÃ´t sympa mais le jeu pour certains combats est injouable, les combats sont dÃ©loyales c'est pourquoi je dÃ©conseille. Ayant obtenu le jeu gratuitement, je ne sais pas combien il cÃ´ute mais je dÃ©conseille d'acheter s'il est Ã  plus de 10â‚¬ (parce que je suis gentil). Ce n'est absolument pas mon genre de laisser tomber un jeu mais lÃ  je vais le faire.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020049439', 'num_games_owned': 2603, 'num_reviews': 277, 'playtime_forever': 6778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4507, 'last_played': 1507935773}
review:
Coraje.

Coraje es lo que siento al analizar un juego que conceptualmente es bastante bueno e interesante pero que tÃ©cnicamente deja bastante que desear y se convierte en un autentico dolor de muelas.

En efecto, tÃ©cnicamente el juego es un pequeÃ±o desastre. Esta mal optimizado y de ahÃ­ parten la mayorÃ­a de sus problemas. Depende el ordenador que tengamos tendremos mas o menos bugs, pudiendo incluso quedarnos sin poder avanzar en el juego si tenemos la peor de las suertes. Los tiempos de carga cada vez que cambiamos de pantalla son interminables y para colmo de males tiene muchos de sus logros bugueados.

Â¿A que entran ganas de salir corriendo y que el ultimo apague la luz ?

Pues claro que si... y mas aun cuando los desarrolladores hace tiempo que dejaron de actualizar el juego y pasan olÃ­mpicamente de los bugs y las muchas quejas de los usuarios, lo cual te deja con ganas de quemar algo o lapidar a alguien antes de salir corriendo y olvidarte para siempre del juego.

Pero con lo que no contaba es que pese a todo lo dicho el juego me gustase, lo cual solo contribuye a que aumente mas el coraje y la frustraciÃ³n que siento ante lo que podÃ­a haber sido un buen juego y se ha quedado en un juego del montÃ³n. Gracias a la falta de ganas y el pasotismo de unos desarrolladores mas interesados en irse de bares con los testeadores que de finalizar bien el juego.

Y es una pena porque el concepto del juego y la puesta en escena son bastantes buenos. BÃ¡sicamente es un juego de rol ligero, muy centrado en un sistema de combate tÃ¡ctico muy completo y cojonudo, una historia decente y un sistema de creaciÃ³n y desarrollo de personajes, basado en el mundo de Dark Eye, elaborado y completo.

AdemÃ¡s el juego se bastante difÃ­cil y se preocupa por plantear situaciones y combates muy diferentes para no cansar al jugador y someterle a todo tipo de retos. Algo muy de agradecer porque hay algunos combates realmente complicados, no siempre bien balanceados, que necesitarÃ¡n de toda nuestra pericia y paciencia para salir bien librados.

Â¿ EntendÃ©is ahora el motivo de mi enfado ?.

Como amante de los juegos de combate tÃ¡ctico Blackguards lo tenia todo para triunfar conmigo y merecer un anÃ¡lisis mucho mas benigno pero la falta de optimizaciÃ³n y de testeo, junto a la nula respuesta para solucionarlo, terminan por lastrar un juego que de otra manera podÃ­a haber sido mucho mejor.

Y es que carajo, han sido demasiadas horas repitiendo combates por culpa de los bugs y la dejadez de los tipos de Daedalic a la hora de solucionarlos. 

Para invitatrlos a jamÃ³n, vamos. 

Recomendable solamente para los amantes de los juegos de combate tÃ¡ctico y aquellos que sepan armarse de paciencia ante tanto problema tÃ©cnico.

Abstenerse el jugador medio, le saldrÃ¡ una ulcera estomacal... o algo peor. 



6/10.

review: I bought this game in a bundle for a couple of dollars. Its a barain and I loved it. I haven't played many turn based fighting games but I really enjoyed this game. It requires a fair bit of thinking through, thinking ahead, getting killed and retrying. (Save your game lots!) The storyline keeps the game interesting - without it the fights would get quite stale I think. It does have a few bugs, but I seriously can't complain when I only paid a few dollars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089652452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 11246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7476, 'last_played': 1506378833}
review:
I really enjoyed this game.I found it chalenging AND engaging throughout.So i dont really get the complaints about the games difficulty...ill admit it can be a bit rough to get going but i found the mid game to be a refreshing pleasure challenging the player to use and pic the right skill sets and abilitys,it felt rewarding and was never boring as some other easier games can be as you blow through the mid game,untill the end game where a challenge is considered enemies with way to many hitpoints not quite smart enough to use that finishing blow,unless your party is at max health: FACEPALM. Eventually leading to a boss that does a lot of nothing and has that 1 ability that leaves only one party member standing near death,goes back to doing a lot of nothing while your team recovers....
seriously there will be none of that in blackguardds,when your team fails it's usually abundantly clear where you are lacking or what mistake was made,so yes i suppose unfortunately for some this game does require the player to actually think about their strategy..in most battles.A severely lacking aspect in most games these days...if you enjoy challenging and rewarding gameplay then this is the game for you.

I feel this game was way underrated and under appreciated, it deserves so much more credit.thx for making this game guys i had a blast...now on to blackguards 2 ! i cant wait to see whats in store ;) !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989620359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1557257494}
review:
*UPDATE* I've read the corerules and found something about the fumble rule + some miscalculations in the review... This is a hastily written 'review' *UPDATE*

The real reason why Iâ€™m writing this review is because of the hit chance percentages. EVERYBODY COMPLAINS ABOUT THIS. For those who doesnâ€™t know The Dark Eye ruleset this is very confusing. A 100% chance of successfully hitting someone  doesnâ€™t give you a 100% chance of doing actual damage, and I think the percentages are thus misleading, also, the rules arenâ€™t explained anywhere and the rolls arenâ€™t shown in the battlelog. And to be honest, according to the rules, I donâ€™t really know how you can have 100% for certain in the game - you always have minimum change of have a fumble.

Iâ€™m going to explain it a little bit with the actual rolls of the core rules. This is by memory actually and I'm just guessing some percentages, since I'm not a mathematician.

THE ROLLS BEHIND COMBAT:

You want to hit an enemy with your sword! You have two actions. One is moving toward the enemy, the other one is swinging with your sword trying to hit him. Your PC has an attack value of lets say 8. Your Rapier has an Attack Value of +1. The Rapierâ€™s special attribute is agility, for every 3 points in agility above 8 you get a +1. You Agility is 14. 14-8= 6. You get a +2 to hit. This means you have to throw lower than 11 with you 20 sided die.

This means you have 55% chance to hit. (This would be a starting level character btw).

If you hit, the following happens.

Your enemy can parry or dodge with his parry or dodge skill. His parry skill is 13. Which is calculated by his DEX. Now he can use every 3 points above a base value 8 for agility. He has an agility of 12. 12-8= 4. So he gets a +1. Which is 14. Now he tries to parry with a short weapon against a medium weapon. He recieves -2 on his parry. He has to roll lower than 12. He has a chance of 60% to parry the weapon.

He can also dodge the attack. A Dodge is your agility divided by 2. 12/2= 6. But he has a skill body control which gives him +1. He has a dodge of 7. Which is too low to use.

You have 55% to hit and the defender 60% chance to defend himself. Which gives you less then 33% in total to hit. But the game will show 55%.

I think the percentages shown ingame are your own hit percentages. Because you canâ€™t know your enemies stats.

THE FUMBLE RULE (IN TDE IT'S CALLED A BOTCH )

Now why still miss when a 100% hit percentage is shown? Two reasons. Probably the game rounds up. Lets say if you have to roll lower than a 19. But if your enemy lies on the ground, this gives you an advantage: making your *chance* 100% to hit: this can even go over 20. Lets say you have to roll lower than 23 to hit. This means that if you roll a 19 + a random disadvantage of + 2 making a 21 still is a hit. But the fumble rule still applies. If you roll a 20 itâ€™s still an instant fumble (or botch as they call it in TDE, fumble is a DnD term) and norally in the P&P the gamemaster may get creative and invents a random failure. An archer misses on 19-20 rolls. So there is always a 5%-10% chance you fumble, and a 5% chance you crit (on rolling a 1) .

(If you played Drakensang, the first game wich uses the same DSA ruleset, there you can even fumble on picking up a flower.)

So in the original P&P, lets say you are in a house with a low ceiling. Your enemy lies unconscious before you on the ground. Letâ€™s kill him in coldblood! You swing your sword full of rage. Outgame you have to roll a d20; letâ€™s say that everything except a 20 hits. Youâ€™re unlucky: you roll a 20. The DM decides what happens: your swing your sword above your head in full rage and your sword gets stuck in the ceiling.

ABOUT THE GAME

Itâ€™s a difficult and unforgiving game. But itâ€™s somehow still entertaining!

Daedalic is known for making point and click adventure games set in the Dark Eye world. This game is a story driven turn based strategy game with the occasional cutscenes which have some dialogue options for the fluff. The towns and outposts are like in an adventure game, where you can click on merchants or NPCâ€™s. The cutscenes are ok, the way the story is told feels a bid like a normal P&P RPG session. Where a DM narrates what happens and you are given the ILLUSION of choice. But in this game there is NOT much choice, doesnâ€™t matter if you have choice or not: itâ€™s entertaining.

The turn based strategy is very difficult. Gamers without patience will have a hard time restarting the same combat over and over.

Itâ€™s fun, Itâ€™s hardcore. Its worth playing.

review:
Je ne m'explique pas pourquoi j'ai autant jouÃ© Ã  ce jeu. Faux rpg, faux tactical, sans aucune variation Ã  la rejouabilitÃ© et une brouettÃ©e de succÃ¨s qui ne se valident pas. Ce n'est pas glorieux. Je suppose que j'Ã©tais dans un Ã©tat d'humeur propice au bon gros bourrinage sans rÃ©flÃ©chir.

Faux rpg parce que totalement directif. On progresse dans une histoire linÃ©aire qui nous contraint gÃ©ographiquement et humainement au sens oÃ¹ c'est elle qui dÃ©cide de qui nous accompagne. MÃªme si on a par moment une impression de libertÃ©, elle se rÃ©sume Ã  savoir dans quel ordre on va faire les quÃªtes secondaires accessibles Ã  l'instant t. Les dialogues sont essentiellement destinÃ©s Ã  donner une ambiance, il n'auront que trÃ¨s rarement un impact sur la rÃ©solution d'une quÃªte secondaire et jamais sur le dÃ©roulement de l'histoire Ã  part ceux avec un personnage prÃ©cis qui dÃ©termineront son comportement tout Ã  la fin et uniquement tout Ã  la fin (je l'ai lu sur le forum parce que personnellement j'ai toujours eu la mÃªme fin sans jamais comprendre quels combinaisons de mes choix m'y avait conduit). La linÃ©aritÃ© de l'histoire et l'absence d'impact de la majoritÃ© des dialogues ne serait pas forcÃ¨ment une tare rhÃ©dibitoire si l'ensemble ne se traduisait pas en une forte contrainte dans le dÃ©veloppement des persos. Au-delÃ  de la nÃ©cessitÃ© de dÃ©velopper certaines compÃ©tences critiques et de l'inutilitÃ© des sorts de bas-niveau qui en canibalisant les points conduisent Ã  l'habituel min-max, Blackguards nous encourage trop fortement Ã  dÃ©velopper un archer et privilÃ©gier les armes contondantes pour qu'on se sente maitre de notre Ã©quipe qui, cerise sur le gateau, nous est imposÃ©e et modifiÃ©e sans prÃ©avis.
AprÃ¨s il y a un autre aspect que je trouve un peu dommageable pour un RPG et qui est l'absence d'exploration, l'histoire nous propose des points accessibles sur une carte, Ã  la maniÃ¨re d'un Hard West et les interactions en ville se font sur des images fixes. Mais bon le goÃ»t de l'explo c'est du goÃ»t perso, pas un dÃ©faut absolu du jeu.

Faux tactical parce que de nombreuses cartes sont trÃ¨s typÃ©es et ne se rÃ©soudront que d'une seule faÃ§on, genre fermer tous les tunnels, utiliser les flaques inflammables... Les cartes Ã  rÃ©soudre par nous-mÃªmes en combat pur sont pour la plupart beaucoup trop petites pour dÃ©velopper une quelconque manoeuvre ou tenir une quelconque position. La tactique se rÃ©sume Ã  essayer de maintenir les archers Ã  distance de tir, et encore, une fois atteint un bon dÃ©veloppement leurs compÃ©tences spÃ©ciales et talent leur permettent de s'affranchir de toute contrainte de distance. 
Bon il y a un aspect RNG qui dÃ©coiffe. Perso Ã§a ne me choque pas, des sÃ©ries de ratÃ©s ou de rÃ©ussites improbables c'est juste la vrai vie. Mais contrairement Ã  un XCOM oÃ¹ tout est rattrapable, l'affrontement des boss de Blackguards m'a renvoyÃ© Ã  mes pires souvenirs de combat d'Age Of Decadence, si vous ratez vos premiers coups et que l'ia rÃ©ussi les siens, il n'y a plus qu'Ã  recharger, point barre. 
A noter que ce typage trÃ¨s fort des combats est plutÃ´t dÃ©courageant en dÃ©but de jeu parce que, le temps de piger la logique du truc Ã  exploiter dans l'environnement, on a l'impression d'aller de combat impossible en combat impossible, j'ai failli dÃ©sinstaller Blackguards au bout d'une heure face au premier troll. Donc si vous prenez ce jeu, prÃ©parez vous Ã  devoir vous accrochez. L'effet pervers de cette rÃ©solution de combat faÃ§on puzzle est que, une fois plongÃ© dans cette logique, bizarrement en progressant vers des adversaires de plus en plus costaud, l'impression de difficultÃ© s'estompe et ne tient plus qu'Ã  la RNG.
  
Tout ceci l'un dans l'autre fait que la rejouabilitÃ© est thÃ©oriquement nulle. Sauf Ã  vouloir se vider la tÃªte comme c'Ã©tait manifestement mon cas quand j'ai pris ce jeu. 

Je vais quand mÃªme recommander ce jeu parce que primo l'histoire m'a plu, vraiment l'histoire l'univers lui est quelconque, deuxio/secundo cette faÃ§on de rÃ©soudre les combats Ã  le mÃ©rite de la variÃ©tÃ©, Blackguards n'est pas un jeu oÃ¹ l'on rÃ©pÃ©te le mÃªme combat au fil des rencontres, tertio/troizio mener une partie au bout reprÃ©sente suffisament de temps de jeu pour que la non rejouabilitÃ© ne soit pas critique.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121140992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1505416979}
review:
J'ai mis "Oui" mais je suis mitigÃ©, a reserve au joueur experimentÃ© selon moi (Si vous cherchiez un XCOM comme moi passez votre chemin)

Le jeu est trÃ¨s narratif mais comme beaucoup (TROP) de jeu on nous lance 5 noms a la minute et en plus pas simple a retenir, scÃ©nario trop classique de " Je m'en souviens plus ?! j'ai fait Ã§a ?! nan je n'y crois pas ?! mais je ne me souviens plus de rien"
Les mÃ©canique sont classique, dÃ©placement Hexagonale mais basÃ© sur l'initiative donc pas de vrai "Tour par tour"
Couverture haute et basse, non indiquÃ© par contre mais le jeu prend en compte la taille donc le nain a de meilleur couverture et un ogre cherche moins a se couvrir avec sa taille, des fois on comprend pas pourquoi l'archer/mages a pas la ligne de vu
pas de details sur les probabilitÃ© non plus
+1 pour les different "Slot" d'arme qui permet de changer d'armes en cours de partie mais Ã§a passe le tour.

par contre
Tuto trop vague j'ai passÃ© au moins 5 minutes a comprendre qu'il faut Double clique pour deplacer un perso (parce que dans le ""TUTO"" il suffisait de un) et j'ai passer plusieurs tours a la place de bouger
le systeme de roue pour voir toutes les actions possible est confus (mais V pour voir les objet interactif est interresant)
Lorsque l'on tombe sur de nouvelles situation, le jeu ne l'explique pas

Exemple: 
La mission: Trouver la bonne tombe dans une crypte
Je tombe sur des genre de Cafard des crypte mais le jeu ne m'a pas expliquer que je devait dedier l'un de mes perso a faire le tour du terrain pour boucher les trou d'oÃ¹ sortent les cafard
Nan le jeu te le dit 3 tour plus tard, (quand il fait sortir le 1er) puis en sort 1 par tour
Ya 5 ou 6 trou, 2 perso contre les cafard (qui Ã©tait la depuis le debut hein) et le 3eme tourne pour boucher les trou

En bref: soyez averti que le jeu est narratif et a des dÃ©faut mais si vous passez au dessus de Ã§a il a l'air interressant

author: {'steamid': '76561197989040570', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3843, 'last_played': 1505410778}
review:
Its entertaining for about 98% of the game but the end is fucked up. 


[spoiler]Your choices dont mater for the ending you dont even get stuff explained, you dont need to win the final battle you still get the same ending and the worst i think the ending scenes at the end explain nothing at all and are confusing as if the 
 were for another game with similar characters.[/spoiler]

The fighting is fun but missing 3 shots in sucsession with 100% hit chance is infuriating. 

The story is interesting, and the quests are fun.
The arrow system stupid you can only have a set amount of arrows with you and can only switch between 3 sets and this only if you dont take a melee wepon wich you might need because some object are immun to piercing dmg or not targetable at all. If you use the abilities very often that shoots 7 arrows at once you might get problems because the vendors have a fixed amount of stuff and you might waste all your arrows.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962007744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4464, 'last_played': 1502838003}
review:
A really nice cRPG linear adventure. Definitely not that black or anti hero thoug...
All the ingredient are there and the one huge downside is the not-appropriate pricing.

It feels a bit like an indie game, cheap cinematik and lack of polishing here and there (and there too).
I really did not mind, but I baught it around 5â‚¬. 

Story, leveling, general content and battles are worth it if you like the genre; just find a way to buy it a the right price (should have been around 20â‚¬ when launched, below 5-10â‚¬ nowadays).

author: {'steamid': '76561198044441888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1558713700}
review:
Seriously!?

I can't pass a certain part because I wasn't playing a 'certain way', then why give me options? I stopped caring while I was playing, and seeing I didn't write a review I thought I could muster up enough 'care' to share my sub-par experience with this graphic novels with option of failures woven throughout.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071926221', 'num_games_owned': 446, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 5455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5242, 'last_played': 1505014066}
review:
I am a sucker for turn based games.  If you have other games in your back log, go play those instead.  

I finished the game on the hardest difficulty available.

Here are the undesirable things for me in this game:

- You cant compare weapons/armor that easily.
- 100% chance to hit with an enemy who is knocked down, will still miss.
Of course, a lot of 90% chance would miss.
- There are gameplay mechanics that are downright not fun, like a tentacle monster that will perma knockdown you eventhough you have max balance skill.
- Quests map is not intuitive.
- Unique named items you get in later chapters are weaker than normal weapons
- Mages are just buff and healbots.  You are always at a disadvantage as a mage, while enemy mages are a little OP.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273762327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1591586558}
review: It's super lame. Thankfully it was on sale, but this game is simply frustrating. You struggle to keep up the entire time, you don't get enough gold to buy the supplies you need. I you're going to make a game this difficult, at least provide some cheats. This game had so much potential. Disappointing!

author: {'steamid': '76561198102300423', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1132, 'last_played': 1506463515}
review: This game is broken. Dont buy it unless u have a serious masochism issues. The game constantly puts u against higher level enemies that dont give two f about "in game miss chance". Sure u have 89% and u try to cast a spell and 3times in a row it fails... 89%my ass, enemy on the other hand has a 60%miss chance and lands  a perfect spell every time AND I MEAN EVERY TIME 70times i did one battle and 60% chance was 100%. Also the spreed of dmg - ignite lvl2 deals 8-28dmg. when u use the spell its 10 or 12 if ur lucky but when enemy uses that spell it lands 16,20,24dmg. Also the taking of the gear. HOW CAN U TAKE ALL THE GEAR, ALL THE POTIONS,  and then make player fight with a scripted enemy that crits u for 2/3of your health with no problem has not one but 2 potions, enchanted gear and scripted responses. This game is fun for 10/30min until the developers decide its time for you to loose and then u have to repeat and repeat and repeat and watch how you can not land a hit on your enemy because for some reason a battle dwarf with 2 axes cant hit a gladiator RIGHT IN FRONT OF HIM and the enemy not only hits u but also crits u every 2/3hit. I hope people who made this game go bancrupt and will not make any onther game ever again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032137848', 'num_games_owned': 1957, 'num_reviews': 775, 'playtime_forever': 960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1539596180}
review: lackguards is a straightforward, simple RPG with short battles that are easy to complete in a short time frame however it's very linear and the difficulty level is intentional and not needed and hence the bad reviews. I ado agree with those, but it's okay otherwise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144089640', 'num_games_owned': 1608, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1457294421}
review: Ğ¡ĞºÑƒÑ‡Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ°Ñ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°,Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ¸Ğ´Ğ°Ğ» Ğ»ÑƒÑ‡ÑˆĞµĞ³Ğ¾

author: {'steamid': '76561198202036207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 881, 'last_played': 1505418269}
review: I really like this game so far. It has crashed on me once..but no big issues so far. I am totally new to this genre and the game is not that hard to learn...however..the tutorial could be made more interesting..you don't have to dumb the game down..just make learning the game fun. I think the story is as good as any story....To me..the game would be perfect if it had exploration and this type of strategy in one package...add local and online multiplayer and you would have a real gem. Its the best tactial game I have found so far...Divinity Original Sin is also a great exporation and tactical game..add that exploration to this game and you have a huge winner...ohhh and a little bit better graphics..the graphics are not bad...but could be better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971066870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 963, 'last_played': 1503106523}
review:
This game sucks.  Chance to hit enemy 100%.  MISS.  BLOODY HELL.  The devs can rot in hell.  It seems the only goal of this game is to frustrate the gamer and nothing else.  Good thing I bought this on a sale.  Never ever touching this developer ever again.  Utter Garbage.


Stay far away from it unless you want to chew a mouthful of crushed glass.  And even then that might be more fun than this excuse of a "game".

author: {'steamid': '76561197972040704', 'num_games_owned': 1835, 'num_reviews': 724, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1419096337}
review: I found the game to be a bit overwhelming and unwelcoming to new players. It seems like it expects you to already be a fan of this genre of game, and familiar with it. The world it was set in didn't hook me in during the intro area to make me want to stick around and try to catch on. If you're into this genre, it might be a game you would enjoy, but I cannot recommend it to anyone not already "in the know" about this brand of medieval strategy.

Also if that not enough the game will crash your whole pc about every 1-2hrs or in the later movie segment.  I got near the end where you fight the king almost kill him game crashes.  I  just to finnally gave up on this game unistal this crap.  only positive is i got this on sale 

p.s. don't torture yourself like me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024559087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1815, 'last_played': 1501644305}
review:
I am sick and tired of games with game breaking bugs.  This game was a very good game until...

the characters disappear, the game becomes unresponsive, reload same thing.  The devs have known about this issue for a long time with no fix.  I have tried the fixes suggested on this board to no avail.

Game breaking bugs are becoming the norm.  I had the same issue with underrail.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048101201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 1622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1622, 'last_played': 1500164557}
review:
I was a bit hesitant to start playing this, what with the very mixed reviews, but I ended up quite enjoying it in the end. Blackguards is a straightforward, simple RPG with short battles that are easy to complete in a short time frame, so that's already a plus. There's something about the setting that's nice too - the world is nicely presented and portrayed, considering the budget the game was clearly under. 

The combat and RPG elements are mostly pretty entertaining. There aren't any levels, just experience points you can throw into any part of your character development more or less whenever you want, though you probably won't have points to max out everything you want for each character. My only complaint would be that there are a lot of key skills locked to certain trainers in the world who can be hard to find, and it's never clear who trains what without individually mousing over skills while visiting them.

Combat is pretty typical tactical fare, though it has the usual RNG problem of attacks with very high percentage odds seeming to miss half the time. I think this is because the game displays your base chance to hit, but doesn't factor in your opponent's chance to dodge or parry - bad interface design for sure if that's the case, and in any case it's annoying how often your attacks miss. On the other hand your opponents' attacks will miss a lot too, so it's kind of a wash. Still, basic but fun combat here. Sometimes neat stuff happens, like the time my dwarf knocked back an opponent and he flew past two of my spearmen, each of whom attacked him spontaneously using their attack of opportunity as he flew past, killing him before he stopped moving.

A note about the marketing - the game is trying to sell itself as being a dark and violent game about criminals, but it's really not much darker than any other fantasy RPG. The main characters are mostly criminals, sure, but they're more the loveable rogue type than actually repulsive people - there's a mage in particular with a hilariously over-acted voice who's really fun to listen to, but even the dreamweed-addicted elf and the arsonist dwarf are more quirky than anything. And the game's story is still a typical save-the-world plot, despite a bit of grit thrown in. Go in expecting typical fantasy with a slightly darker edge, and your expectations will be met.

All in all, a fun if not particularly remarkable RPG. Worth a look!

author: {'steamid': '76561198087979217', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1198, 'last_played': 1420850423}
review:
Welcome great hero! Oh wait, you're no hero, you been wrongly accused and your world is threatened. It now lies in your hands with a bands of misfits and criminals to save the world! This game is dark. TOO DARK. Coupled that with a boring story and a lackluster battle system, it all goes downhill.

Battles are based on luck and your characters' attack are more than likely to miss even if chance is high that it will hit. Furthermore, story is linear based, boring, and lack any real depth. Add in those awful voices,...this game is not recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028494830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1499140608}
review:
It's been a pretty bad experience.  Several of the fights have 'gotcha' gimmicks that aren't apparent until it screws you, then you replay the fight and stop the gimmick.  Its so tedious, especially when layered on top of the overwhelming rng. 

Good god, the rng.  These old school game mechanics have been mostly dropped by modern devs for a good reason, they're just anti fun.  Having your plan be ruined by missing several +80% chance attacks in a row is beyond frustrating.  It makes the fights success or failure be up to rng, and at that point, why am I even playing?  Could just throw a pile of dice onto a table and have the same experience...

author: {'steamid': '76561198001151045', 'num_games_owned': 752, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 706, 'last_played': 1497085322}
review:
I've been enjoying the game, even though I've had to take a break because of work. It's a nice casual RPG - there's no epic amounts of exploration to do, or a world to freely explore. So it's even more linear in that sense. What you do have is a focus on tactical turn based combat, trying to figure out how that system interacts with your stats, and how to exploit the environment to your benefit. I won't mention graphics because this game is several years old now, they're quite adequate though, and the environments are nice.

Pros:
+ Nice mechanics
+ Voiced characters
+ So far interesting story
+ Relaxing, casual

Cons:
- Hitting in combat feels very RNG sometimes

author: {'steamid': '76561198262118401', 'num_games_owned': 2416, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1498655083}
review:
Ich muss jetzt hier mal eine Lanze fÃ¼r das Spiel brechen. Ich kann die ganzen negativen Reviews echt nicht nachvollziehen. Ich habe so viel SpaÃŸ an diesem Spiel. Die Story ist toll, die Charaktere glaubwÃ¼rdig (ich hab sie sofort ins Herz geschlossen), es gibt wirkliche toll gemachte Nebenquests. Ich finde die KÃ¤mpfe spannend, vielleicht sind sie nicht das Non plus Ultra was Taktik angeht, aber das stÃ¶rt mich nicht. Im Gegenteil, ich mag es eh lieber etwas "oberflÃ¤chlicher".

Man darf natÃ¼rlich keine High-End Grafik erwarten, aber ich finde die Optik passt hier sehr gut zu dem Spiel. Ich bereue es wirklich, dass ich aufgrund der vielen negativen Reviews so lange mit dem Kauf gezÃ¶gert habe.

Wenn ihr auch nur ein wenig auf RPGs und Rundenbasierte Spiele steht, bitte, bitte entscheidet euch fÃ¼r den Kauf, euch entgehen sonst viele Stunden SpielspaÃŸ in einem tollen Game.

Und noch eine Bitte an alle, denen das Spiel SpaÃŸ gemacht hat: Lasst doch eine positive Review da. Blackguards hat diese Durchschnittswertung wirklich nicht verdient!

author: {'steamid': '76561198068502559', 'num_games_owned': 647, 'num_reviews': 233, 'playtime_forever': 3358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3290, 'last_played': 1498527154}
review:
NÃ£o entendo uma avaliaÃ§Ã£o tÃ£o ruim desse jogo.. TÃ¡ certo, dÃ¡va pra melhorar muito, mas ele diverte.

Blackguards Ã© uma mistura de RPG em turnos com pointÂ´nÂ´click. As batalhas sÃ£o em turno, mas a histÃ³ria se desenrola sobre cenÃ¡rios onde as possibilidades de diÃ¡logos jÃ¡ ficam marcadas. Eu agradei e tb nÃ£o vi ninguÃ©m reclamando disso.

O sistema utilizado Ã© complexo, mas nÃ£o Ã© difÃ­cil de entender. Ã‰ bem verdade que terminei o jogo sem entender direito algumas coisas, mas isso Ã© outra histÃ³ria. kkk. Uma coisa interessante Ã© que o tamanho do personagem Ã© levado em conta. Vc pode atirar uma flecha no oponente mesmo se um anÃ£o estiver na frente. Mas se um humano estiver na frente jÃ¡ nÃ£o pode. Isso influencia tb no dano, um char muito alto dÃ¡ menos dano em inimigos muito pequenos. Interessante...

No mais o jogo tem uma dificuldade razoÃ¡vel. Algumas lutas sÃ£o fÃ¡ceis demais e outras (bem poucas) sÃ£o complicadas e exigem muita estratÃ©gia e sorte. HÃ¡ possibilidade de interagir com o ambiente, o que torna algumas batalhas bem fÃ¡ceis.

A histÃ³ria Ã© sofrÃ­vel, linear e nÃ£o empolga. Assim sÃ£o tb as sidequests. Os personagens tem o carisma de um zumbi. kkk
Faltou um capricho com armas e armaduras, elas nÃ£o sÃ£o muitas. Os drops sÃ£o poucos e hÃ¡ tb poucas magias para se utilizar. O quinto capitulo Ã© bem maÃ§ante e as duas ultimas lutas eu nÃ£o tenho vergonha de falar q coloquei no easy pq nÃ£o aguentava mais. kkk. Mas mesmo com todos esses defeitos, Blackguards me divertiiu por mais de 4 meses nessas 56 horas que eu joguei.

Nesse precinho que estÃ¡ Ã© quase uma pechincha!! Se vc gosta de um RPG em turnos, pode ir na fÃ©!

author: {'steamid': '76561198217090680', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1928, 'last_played': 1512227004}
review:
OK, I can't really understand why is this game receiving so many negative opinions ??? I mean, ok, a lot of them are about too hard level and that there is sometimes only one way to pass the battle and that it's hard to find it. I can see that it's bothering some people but for me it's actually one of the biggest pros. Game is not only the story, fact that I have to think and actually struggle a little with defeating my opponents makes my gameplay a lot more interesting. Furthermore, in the most of the battles there are actually a lot of ways to go through it, and that you can choose what is the best fit for you is super cool. OK, leaving level's topic behind, I really like characters (voice actors did SO GOOD WORK, like, reaaaallyyy, I can play this only for listening to Zurbaran accent) and storyline here. Also most of side-quests are cool  but it's true that they are more like side-MUST-TO-DO-TO-BE-ENOUGH-POWERFUL-FOR-MAIN-QUEST-quest... still it'd be a shame to not see what's in them so that's ok. Oh, and I just love jokes and all of these little peculiarities which are everywhere. Even in the tutorial's msgs~

And about cons, there's one that somekind bothers me. Your choices don't really affect the story. They are climatic, yeah you can choose if you wanna be "i-don't-care-i-just-want-a-lot-of-money" or "defender-of-justice" buuuuut that affects only your in game's wallet :p

Still, highly recommended (y)

author: {'steamid': '76561198076666056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 4512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3922, 'last_played': 1498386122}
review:
My biggest gripe is that you can miss 3 times in a row even with 90%+ hit chance thus making the battle very tedious especially toward the end game. Also, magic users are penalized too heavily by restricting them to only be able to wear about 20% armor of the non magic users' armor. While the story telling is quite good, it is very linear most of the time, even though the game sometimes ask you to choose, they dont seem to matter. The graphic is decent imo.
Overall i have a hard time to recommend this game, i enjoyed the first half part of the game, but like i said, the battle becomes very boring and frustrating because my 90%+ hit chance failed to hit. 
I will be going to blackguards 2 now, hope the sequel has more worth than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018335461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3385, 'last_played': 1498258091}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043584907', 'num_games_owned': 732, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1497996851}
review:
Es un buen juego?... No
Es un mal juego?... Tampoco

Una historia interesante pero mal planteada, un estilo de juego y mecanicas con potencial pero se plantearon de forma muy debil, y quizas lo peor, lo que lo hace mas monotono es su Hud y toda la interfaz grafica.
No le puedo dar un negativo porque no lo terminÃ©, me aburriÃ³. Pero si quieres probar algo diferente y esta a un par de dolares... Arriesgate
Es un juego "aceptable", pero no le llega a los talones a los [b] XCOM [/b].

author: {'steamid': '76561197976799778', 'num_games_owned': 1287, 'num_reviews': 564, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1497882481}
review:
Eigentlich mag ich rundenbasierte Taktikspiele. Leider ist Blackguards einfach nur kaputt. StÃ¤ndig stÃ¼rzt das Spiel ab oder irgendwelche Trigger im Spiel werden nicht ausgelÃ¶st, so dass unendlich viele Gegner spawnen und man irgendwann einfach stirbt.

Obwohl das Spiel auf DSA basiert werden im Kampf die WÃ¼rfelergebnisse nur unzureichend angezeigt (viel zu kurz). Wie will man denn eine Taktik entwickeln, wenn man das WÃ¼rfelergebnis nur fÃ¼r ein Bruchteil einer Sekunde sieht?
Warum bekomme ich von dem Spiel das falsche Feedback angezeigt. Wenn ein Spiel anzeigt, dass man zu 80% trifft, sollte man auch in ungefÃ¤hr 8/10 FÃ¤llen treffen und nicht niemals!!!

Da das Spiel immer wieder abstÃ¼rzt, stellt sich fÃ¼r mich auch gar nicht die Frage, ob ich es weiterspiele. Bisher gingen mir die Charaktere und Story aber am A... vorbei. Schade

1/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198085093968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 329, 'playtime_forever': 2899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1576646322}
review:
Was NOT the customizable campaign strategy game we were advertised, nor were the playable characters a dysfunctional bunch of jail-worthy psychopaths. If you don't want another basic RPG don't buy this.

Edit: I decided to actually play the game a year after my initial 2-hour review, and while there is some semblance of an actual CRPG in here, it's chock-full of bugs, confusing mechanics, and superlinear storyboarding.

The game, once again, is not a Darkest Dungeon clone where you manage boxed criminals into doing all your adventuring, but a standard The Dark Eye Tabletop Adventure with a mostly pre-generated party of True Neutral adventurers, half of whom happen to be criminals, while half are equally as guilty.

Except your party is imbalanced from start to finish. Two warriors, two mages, and a TEMPORARY archer who has to go back [spoiler]to her addiction, followed by getting killed by a giant monster for the Arena's amusement[/spoiler]. While the game has a complex cross-class system to compensate for this imbalance, it's too complex; trying to discover the system on your own will mainly result in poor long-term skill point choices that you won't discover until it's far too late, and there are no re-specs. (Also, don't use skill books unless they're absolutely useful. They eat up your AP and I guarantee you can find every single skill from a trainer somewhere in the world for free.)

Story wise, the game cripples itself. While the adventure and its modules are fairly entertaining, nearly all of your choices only influence a single consequence: [spoiler]whether or not your mage decides to screw you over. It all boils down to whether you blindly trust a former murder-cultist or the rest of your semi-unhinged team, and is strange and disturbing overall.[/spoiler]. Your main character has little to no impact on the story otherwise, as your other party members will do all the charismatic (or anti-charismatic, in the case of the melee units) talking for you.

But the worst mechanic is the special win-conditions; rather than spice up the fight, they typically turn it into a slog-fest as you fumble around looking for the exact tile to stand next to, so you can waste an entire turn activating some obscure background-looking object that MAY help you or just complicate the battlefield even further. Ever tried conquering a narrow maze filled with respawning Crypt Lice and a dozen pressure pads that will lock the exit door? The game fluctuates between easy and frustrating and is ultimately annoying to play through during these moments.

review:

Ich konnte das zum GlÃ¼ck auf tun. Ich kann mir aber denken das man auch schnell verzweifelt und aufgeben mÃ¶chte. Mache Abschnitte benÃ¶tigen wirklich viel Geduld und ich glaube auch das es passieren kann das der ein oder andere sich so verskillt das es nicht schaffbar ist. 

Die Story selbst war an sich zwar ganz gut aber ich fand dass das Charkterverhalten das eine oder andere Mal sehr unnatÃ¼rlich ist. 

Es ist halt ein DSA ableger. FÃ¼r mich spricht auf alle FÃ¤lle mehr dafÃ¼r als dagegen.

review:
= 2017/05/30 =

Here is what you get from Blackguards by Daedalic Entertainment.

Linear story based
Pre-made heroes (characters)
Skill based characters (not class based)
Spell caster or non-spell caster class (all skill available except spell type for non-spell caster, spell casters have a one time use of AP(Adventurer Points) in the beginning when creating your character)
Close range weapons : Dagger, Sword/Saber, Axe/Mace, Rapier/Foil, Staves, Spears, 2-Handed Sword, 2-Handed Mace
Long range weapons : Bows, Crossbows, Throwing weapons
Left/Right hand slot : One-hand weapon + shield, Dual wield, 2-Handed wepon, or bare-fist (not recommended)
Armor slots : Head, Chest, Legs, Hands, Feet, Waist (for belt to put items usable in combat)
Attributes : Courage, Cleverness, Intuition, Charisma, Dexterity, Agility, Constitution, Strength, Vitality, Astral-energy(mana), Magic resistance [Each attribute points contribute to Base Values]
Base Values : Vitality, Attack, Parry, Dodge, Ranged combat, Initiative, Magic resistance, Astral Energy, Speed
Talents : Body-control, Will power, Perception, Traps, Street-wise, Survival, Animal Lore, Warcraft, Treat Wounds
Special Abilities : from Power Blow, Tripple Shot, Dual Wield, to Astral regeneration. 16 main abilities, 39 including sub-abilities (for example Dodge 1->Dodge 2-<Dodge 3)

[b]= The below is a personal review/feeling of the game, you may feel differently! =[/b]

The goods
1. "The complex rule system". All these stats doing all sorts of different things! A must for the sophisticated(?) nerdy RPGer.
2. Equipment changes the character outlook (even made me use a lesser equipment just for the looks that I prefered)
3. Each hero (or should I say villain) has a unique touch of personality in the story
4. Graphics/Animation of skills shows the effort of the developers.

The bads
1. Not-so-good-working "The complex rule system".
If I see a 60% hit chance, I expect to hit 6 times out of 10 tries, or 3 out of 5.
But I miss most of the time.
The game is a liar in this sense and no one likes to be lied to.
2. Limited AP (Adventurer Points) to level up your characters.
No random mobs. All encounters are pre-decided.
3. Some encounters are almost impossible if you level-up incorrectly due to the limited AP.
Makes you restart the game because you cannot go any further.
So don't think of making a jack-of-all-trades bard-like character...
Your frustration level will rise to max gauge.
4. Receive same amount of set Experience points (or Adventure Points) for each encounter, no matter how many opponents you fell. There are some encounters where you will meet infinite (respawning) mobs. If you down 1 mob and finish the objective, it will give you the same reward as downing 100 mobs before finishing the objective.

[b]= conclusion =[/b]
It almost felt like a puzzle game more than an RPG because some (if not most) encounters had specific methods to win easily. Other methods, not so easy or impossible (to me).
Personally, I like to farm/grind, especially when I cannot beat a certain area but not with Blackguards.

Perhaps you will survive better than me but comparing the enjoyment to the frustration level, Blackguards is not recommened.

author: {'steamid': '76561198375256219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 927, 'last_played': 1495619308}
review:
El juego esta bien, la verdad. Entretenido, buenos graficos, Muy, muy tactico. Lo comprÃ© a        
8Â´90E y creo que los vale

A los que os gusten este tipo de juegos: Estrategia por turnos y Rol te vas a divertir. 

Pero tiene una gran pega. La dificultad.

Es     "E X T R E M A D A M E N T E"    difÃ­cil y llega un punto que se hace exasperante. Y eso que estoy casi en tan solo las 10 horas de juego. Al principio te da 2 opciones de dificultad, pero incluso la mÃ¡s sencilla hace las batallas muy complicadas y complejas de resolver.

Te puedo asegurar que si eres de los que aceptan los retos hasta que o mueres tu o el juego, te lo vas a pasar muy bien. 

Pero si eres como yo de los que comienzas a golpear la mesa cuando ves que no hay manera. Ni te lo plantes, busca un reto mÃ¡s sencillo y no rompas nada, que entonces el juego te sale muy caro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055250612', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 6323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6311, 'last_played': 1395731765}
review:
A great RPG based on the Dark Eye system, but with a few flaws. It's been a while since I played, but here's my take:

The Good:
* Engaging storyline with memorable characters
* Good conversion of the Dark Eye system with a few tweaks for balance
* Each combat is different thanks to hand-crafted maps with interactive environments

The Bad:
* The Astral regeneration mechanic pretty much forces you to artificially prolong fights so that your casters can regain their astral power (as this only works during combat), making mid-to-late-game combats more painful than fun
* Not available under Linux

There also used to be a few issues with to-hit percentages not showing up correctly (showing 95% even if your chance was much less) and lack of in-game help on mechanics, but I believe these have largely been addressed now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039462623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2550, 'last_played': 1494268226}
review:
DIe kurze Version: 
Das Spiel ist weit besser, als die meisten Reviews Euch glauben machen wollen. Es ist absolut nicht unfair in dem Sinne, wie viele, viele der Schreiber suggerieren. Aber: es hat eine Menge Design-fehler und man sieht dem Spiel leider an, dass es nicht von Taktikern, sonder von Storyschreibern kreirt wurde.
Normalerweise wÃ¼rde ich dem Spiel nie und nimmer eine Kaufempfehlung geben, ich nehme nur den Daumen hoch um ein Gegengewicht zu all den Verrissen zu bieten.

BITTE STEAM macht einen NEUTRAL-Button!

Die lange Version:
Zuerst einmal mÃ¶chte ich klarstellen, dass ich nicht ganz neutral sein kann. Ich spiele DSA-Spiele seit 1984, als die erste Box herauskam und ich bin ein Fan von Daedalic, die so groÃŸartige Spiele wie "A new Beginning" oder "The whispered World" heraus gebracht haben, ganz zu schweigen von der weithin beliebten Deponia-Reihe (die nicht mein Geschmack ist) oder den Edna und Harvey-Spielen. Man kÃ¶nnte mich also als einen "Fanboy" bezeichnen. Wer jedoch meine Reviews liest, der weiÃŸ, dass ich dadurch eher noch kritischer werde, schlieÃŸlich hat sogar X-Com2 einen dicken Daumen runter von mir bekommen.

Mit Blackguards hat Deadalic sich an ein Genre gewgt, dass eigentlich auÃŸerhalb ihrer Expertiese liegt: dem taktischen RPG. Das Spielprinzip ist dabei denkbar einfach. Ãœber Vorgegebene Wege reist man zu verschiedenen Orten, wo man Quests annehmen kann (oder muss), die dann in einer Art "Kampfarena" gelÃ¶st werden. Innerhalb dieser Arena laufen die KÃ¤mpfe absolut rundenbasiert ab, man zieht abhÃ¤ngig von einem Initiative-Wert Ã¼ber ein Hexgitter, gibt Befehle wie verschiedente Nahkampf- oder Fernkampf-Angriffe oder aber Zauber, dann kommt der nÃ¤chste dran. Jede Figur verfÃ¼gt dabei Ã¼ber 2 Aktionen, wobei die eine Aktion immer eine Bewegungsaktion darstellt und die andere fÃ¼r das Benutzen von GegenstÃ¤nden oder Attacken oder Bewegungen etc. ausgegeben werden kann. Macht man erst diese zweite Aktion, so verfÃ¤llt die erste. Das alles erinnert stark an Spiele wie die X-com Reihe. So weit, so gut.

Doch hier kommt schon der erste schwere Design-Fehler um die Ecke. Denn das Kampfsystem basiert auf DSA-Regeln und diese sind nunmal nicht intuitiv. Zudem werden Zahlenwerte eingefÃ¼gt, die nur die halbe Wahrheit erzÃ¤hlen und die fÃ¼r die groÃŸe Wut in den anderen Reviews sorgen. In jedem Kampf bekommt man nÃ¤mlich eine Anzeige, mit wieviel Prozent eine Aktion, bspw. eine Attacke, gelingt. Doch dieser Zahlenwert berÃ¼cksichtigt NICHT die Verteidigung des Ziels! So kann man durchaus bei einem Gegner, der bspw. 30% Ausweichen hat, ein Drittel seiner SchlÃ¤ge ins Leere hauen, auch wenn man 95% Angriffschance hat. 
Dies ist nicht in dem Sinne Unfair, nur nicht unbedingt ersichtlich. Macht man aber wÃ¤hrend des Kampfes die Konsole an, so sieht man sehr schÃ¶n, was im Hintergrund "gewÃ¼rfelt" wird. Es geht alles mit rechten Dingen zu, es wird nur, und das ist ein schwerer Designfehler(!), nicht erklÃ¤rt.

Der nÃ¤chste Designfehler liegt in manchen Maps. Denn so manche Map ist extrem einfach, wenn die erste Runde "gelingt" und fast unschaffbar, wenn sie nicht gelingt. Das kÃ¶nnte bspw. sein: gelingt mein erster SchuÃŸ auf den Gegnerischen Caster? Gelingt oder MiÃŸlingt der Debuffzauber? Werde ich am Anfang vergiftet oder weiche ich aus? Usw.. Endlosspawns und daraus enstehende Pattsituationen, wo es nicht vor und zurÃ¼ck geht, tragen da nicht zur Verbesserung der Motivation bei.

FÃ¼r mich der schwerste Designfehler liegt jedoch in der Gruppenzusammenstellung. Ich bin eh kein Fan von Begleitern, die ich mir im Laufe des Spiels zusammen suchen muss. Die optimale Gruppenzusammenstellung zu finden und Charactere selbst zu erstellen und aufeinander ab zu stimmen ist ein wichtiges Taktik- und SpaÃŸelement, dass den meisten modernen Spielen schlicht fehlt. 
Doch mir nicht nur vorgekaute Chars zu geben, sondern diese auch immer mal wieder aus der Gruppe zu entfernen oder ihrer wichtigsten FÃ¤higkeit zu berauben geht meiner Meinung nach gar nicht. Ich hÃ¤tte gerne EINEN FernkÃ¤mpfer, den ich von Anfang an oder wenigstens vom Moment, wo ich ihn finde, dabei habe. So hatte ich ein GroÃŸteil des Spiels 3 sehr Ã¤hnliche NahkÃ¤mpfer und einen Caster. Da ist mit den DSA-Regeln aber mehr Variation mÃ¶glich!

Noch ein Fehler? Aber immer doch! In den DSA-Regeln werden Waffengattungen unterschieden und beherrsche ich die eine, kann ich noch lange nicht mit einer anderen umgehen. Dazu muss ich erst ein weiteres Talent steigern. 
Das finde ich gut so, doch - das Spiel hat mehrere Flashbacks, wo ich gezwungen bin mit einem Holzschwert oder einer Axt zu kÃ¤mpfen, vÃ¶llig egal, ob ich das kann. Dabei wÃ¤re es so einfach, eine Waffe entsprechend der FÃ¤higkeit zu zu teilen... 
Ich kann ja nachvollziehen, wenn es Storybedingt ist (also man beim GefÃ¤ngnisausbruch keine Waffe aussuchen kann), aber warum sollte jemand, wenn er mit seiner Freundin auf den Asselverseuchten Friedhof geht, zu ihrem Schutz eine Waffe mitnehmen, die er nicht beherrscht?!?

Ein fÃ¼r Daedalic unverzeihlicher Fehler schlieÃŸlich ist das mÃ¼de und unmotivierte Ende, das keinesfalls fÃ¼r das Spiel belohnt, sondern mir ein "ist das WIRKLICH euer Ernst?!" entlockte. Schade.

Macht das Spiel Ã¼berhaupt was richtig?
Ja.Die AtmosphÃ¤re. Die, fÃ¼r Daedalic typische, Liebe zum Detail in der Grafik. Und das - zwar nicht immer aber oft - aufkommende gute GefÃ¼hl, einen fairen, aber schweren Kampf geschafft zu haben. Die Motivation, die Story weiter zu erleben. Das grundsolide Voiceacting. Die Darstellung des nun wirklich nicht schÃ¶nen Aventurischen SÃ¼dens mit seinen Giftmischern und SklavenhÃ¤ndler, der BrutalitÃ¤t und der Gnadenlosigkeit gegenÃ¼ber dem Schwachen. All das bringt das Spiel hervorragend zur Geltung.

Reicht das fÃ¼r ein Daumen hoch?
Eigentlich nein. Aber fÃ¼r ein faires 6/10, was bei mir heiÃŸt: "grundsolide mit SchwÃ¤chen". 
Und fÃ¼r einen waagerechten Daumen. Aber den gibts bei Steam ja nicht

author: {'steamid': '76561198041940354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 3215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3215, 'last_played': 1493952981}
review:
I just finished the game and found it very enjoyable. I will echo the limitations that others have stated as I do believe they greatly take away from the enjoyment of the game.  There are multiple fights in a row that really create an overly challenging situation.  There were times I lost several hours of progress and had to replay.  It was frustrating.  I was finally successful with the battles but they really killed enjoyment and turned the game into a grind. A little more balance would have been helpful.  

I also recommend having a strategy for building your characters before you start.  You can adapt during the game but it just makes it harder.  

All in all I did really enjoy the game.  After the issues in chapter 2 I think the rest was fun.  The story was interesting although not amazing.  

I give it a 7/10 and would recommend it despite the issues.


Addition to review.  

I've switch my thumb from up to down.  I've played several other games recently and just want to say I'm so happy to be playing other games.  Blackguards as I said has some nice features and playability but it's just not complete.   It's a 7 still but I think people can find better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032623014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1489206814}
review:
The devs' heart is in the right place here. I tried really hard to like it, but nope.

A lot of the mechanics are fun, the story and characters are not bad, but the core gameplay - the combat - just isn't doing it for me. Equipment choices are bland and fighting is tedious.

That being said I'm willing to see what they've learned from this one and give BG2 a go.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975539981', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 2001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1982, 'last_played': 1691317791}
review:
Don't get me wrong, I love this game, I have played an embaressing number of hours outside of steam with it.

BUT NO ONE, NO ONE IN THEIR RIGHT MIND should waste a single penny on this utter rubbish.

This game is cancer, the worst of the worst, about the only people that might like it are morons who thought Darkest Dungeon was good (I didn't, thats just how far out of field this game is).

If you are insane, retarded and have no life, there are 100 other games better than this one, if you run out of those, then try this. As a last resort, befor suicide. Although I'm beginning to debate that last one.

An example of this games mechanics : 74% - miss, 74% - miss, 74% - miss, 74% - miss, 87% - miss, 40% - critical hit.

Another example is one of the arena fights: 2 of your team go up NAKED with WOODEN weapons against an enemy pair, one in full metal armour with a permanently poisoned weapon and 2 health potions, both with more hit points and skills.

This game is not just hard (on hard) - it is UNFAIRLY HARD, hence my Darkest Dungeon comparison.

So you were warned: it can suck you in and you can spend an inordinent amount of time with it, yet in NO WAY will you ever be rewarded by the game for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011513677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1385885798}
review: Presents a problem when you hit a wall because you cant beat the bad guys.  Theyll talk about strategy and whatnot, but the reality of it is, when youre missing on high % shots (at least a high % based on what the computer tells you) strategy doesnt matter.  Theres nothing more disheartening than watching your team drop one by one and knowing there is nothing you can do to stop it..just load last game.  This imbalance causes more frustration than the game is worth.  Could have been better, just wasnt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041949592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 605, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1492631621}
review:
Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is a RPG(RNG) Turn based strategy game.


[h1]Interface/Menu/Settings[/h1]

There is a difficulty level settings available.
You are able to toggle the tutorial.
There is a master volume slidebar available and it is also % based.
There is a music volume slidebar available and it is also % based.
There is a effect volume slidebar available and it is also % based.
There is a voice volume slidebar available and it is also % based.
There are some different resolution sizes available.

[h1]About the game.[/h1]

Before you are able to play your game, they will ask you if you do wish to be a Mage, Hunter or a warrior. Each class has their own advantage and disadvantage. This game is borderline... Well let's say uncreative. You click on a map location and that level will start. You are either fighting against an enemy or you are in a town. Once in a town you are able to buy/sell items at a shop, Rest to recover the stats, Talk to some people or even doing quest activities. Whenever you are fighting against an enemy the combat rules are pretty simple (It's like Heroes of might and magic). The battlefield is on a Grid and each unit take turns for their action. The character speed is known as "initiative" and the higher number, the faster a character is able to perform again in a battle. Sadly enough the game suffers from "Random number generator" in fights (Such as X-Com) which means, Even if you have a 95% attack chance against an enemy. Well jokes on you, The 95% is not really 95% as you are still missing pretty often. Your character is able to level up and they are able to learn new spells, talents and other things. They can be equipped with items to make them stronger in battles.

Subtitles are voiced over. You are able to skip and fastforward it.
Great Graphics.
Turn based Combat.
Decent story.
Random number generated % based in battles.
Character has some customiziation.
There is a rules control overview.
Alot of ingame tips/explainations.
It has dialogues and cutscenes.


[h1]Other things.[/h1]

The random number generator in turn based games is simply NOT WORKING and will always ruin the game. Xcom is a good example (MY OPINION) as the enemy always have a higher hit chance than you will ever get.
So in short words. "Combat mechanic is unfair towards the player as it is happening too often"

-------------------

I Give this game a 5/10
