author: {'steamid': '76561198101361037', 'num_games_owned': 427, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1010, 'last_played': 1448345709}
review:
[b][h1]Blackguards[/h1][/b]
[h1]Spielbeschreibung:[/h1]
Blackguards ist ein Tabletop Strategie Spiel, welches zarte RPG Elemente enthÃ¤lt.
Dabei kann man seine vorgegebenen Charaktere, flexibel, verbessern.
Das ganze Spiel hat eine vorgegebene Story, welche man nur bedingt beeinflussen kann. 
Meistens kÃ¶nnen durch gewisse Entscheidungen nur KÃ¤mpfe vermieden oder getauscht werden.
Der Kernfokus in diesem Spiel sind die KÃ¤mpfe.

[h1]FÃ¼r alle die mit dem Begriff "Tabletop" nichts anfangen kÃ¶nnen:[/h1]

Die KÃ¤mpfe spielt man auf Sechsecken. Man hat begrenzte Lauf- und Aktionsreichweite und kann sich auf Zauber, Nah- oder Fernkampf spezialisieren. Die Zugreihenfolge wird nach dem eigenen Initiative Wert gewÃ¤hlt und so wird der Kampf Zug fÃ¼r Zug abgehandelt.

[h1]Positiv:[/h1]
[list]
[*] Die KÃ¤mpfe sind innovativ, es gibt viele verschiedene Monster und die SchauplÃ¤tze werden nicht recycelt.
[*] Man kann in den meisten SchauplÃ¤tzen, in den KÃ¤mpfen, mit der Umgebung interagieren.
[*] Der Talentbaum fÃ¼r Waffentalente ist gut umgesetzt.
[*] Grafisch ist das Spiel sehr ansprechend.
[*] Ab dem dritten Kapitel kann man sich relativ frei bewegen.
[*] Gute Synchronisation.

[/list]

[h1]Neutral:[/h1]
[list]
[*] Es gibt Attribute/Talente die fÃ¼r die Gruppe gut sind, man benÃ¶tigt nur einen Charakter der diese hat und die ganze Gruppe erhÃ¤lt den Vorteil.
[*] Man ist bei den KÃ¤mpfen meistens in der Unterzahl.
[*] Die Karte Ansicht ist Geschmackssache.
[*] Es gibt eine maximale Traglast, welche bei Ãœberschreitung Mali verursacht.

[/list]

[h1]Negativ:[/h1]
[list]
[*] Man muss bei manchen KÃ¤mpfen mit der Umgebung interagieren.
[*] Jeder Charakter hat den gleichen Talentbaum, der einzige Unterschied ist der das bei manchen einfach Talente gesperrt sind. Dies ist nicht nur Ã¤sthetisch unschÃ¶n, sondern nimmt auch den Tiefgang bei der Gestaltung eines Charakters.
[*] An sich ist das System gerade fÃ¼r Magier und deren Zauber sehr begrenzt.
[*] Eine Stadt unterscheidet sich kaum von einer anderen. Personen und LÃ¤den werden hier einfach wiederverwertet.
[*] Die eigenen Charakter sind Abschaum, mir fÃ¤llt es schwer nur einen davon zu mÃ¶gen.
[*] Die Hauptstory ist weder innovativ noch annÃ¤hernd interessant.
[*] Zufallswerte entscheiden maÃŸgeblich Ã¼ber Sieg oder Niederlage in einem Kampf.
[*] Durch das Versagen in KÃ¤mpfen, muss man diese (vom letzten Speicherpunkt aus) wiederholen. Dies sorgt dafÃ¼r das man immer wieder die gleichen Gegner, SprÃ¼che, Taktiken und Umgebungen vor sich hat und das frustriert und nervt.
[*] Am Anfang hat man enormen Gold Mangel, man kann sich einfach nichts richtiges kaufen.
[*] Es gibt enorm wenig AusrÃ¼stungen, dazu noch etwas sinnvolles zu finden ist noch viel seltener.
[*] Hat man mal das Gold um einen Charakter komplett auszurÃ¼sten, bringt dies einem keinen spÃ¼rbaren Vorteil.
[*] ImmunitÃ¤ten gegen gewisse Zauber- und Waffentypen sind so gewÃ¤hlt das man seine Charaktere so weit in den Fertigkeiten fÃ¤chern muss, das sie zu schwach fÃ¼r die normalen KÃ¤mpfe wÃ¤ren.
[*] Das Spiel warnt einen nicht, wenn man was komplett falsch macht.
[*] Die eingeblendete Hilfe ist mMn nicht sinnvoll und stÃ¶rend, lÃ¤sst sich allerdings ausschalten.
[*] Es gibt bei den Zaubern fixe Schadenswerte, somit sind sie am Anfang enorm stark und am Ende ziemlich schwach.
[*] Die KI ist ziemlich bescheuert..., man kann sie leicht in Fallen etc. locken und sie verhÃ¤lt sich bei jedem Gegner gleich.
[*] Das Spiel hat ein paar Bugs, so sollte man auf der Weltkarte nicht zu weit scrollen da man sonst nicht mehr zurÃ¼ck kommt und ohnmÃ¤chtige Charakter werden als tot betrachtet, was zu einem Sieg oder zu einer Niederlage fÃ¼hren kann.
[*] Der RPG/P&P Aspekt kommt nicht zum tragen.
[*] Wenige Sidequests, und langweilig sich immer wiederholende Aufgaben.
[*] Laufwege, in KÃ¤mpfen, lassen sich nicht richtig bestimmen.
[*] Um sich komplett zu heilen muss man zuerst irgendwo Ã¼bernachten und sich dann bei einem Heiler heilen. Dadurch werden die Manareserven und Lebenspunkte aufgefÃ¼llt und die Wunden geheilt. Macht man dies anders herum, also man geht zu erst zum Heiler und dann Ã¼bernachtet man irgendwo so zahlt man den vielfachen Preis fÃ¼r das gleiche, da der Heiler Lebenspunkte und Wunden heilt und seine Kosten darauf aufbauen, und die Kosten einer Ãœbernachtung in einer GaststÃ¤tte gleich bleiben und diese Lebenspunkte und Manareserven auffÃ¼llen.

[/list]

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]

SpielspaÃŸ: 2/5
[spoiler]Also am Anfang war es ganz nett, aber durch die dauernden Wiederholungen und das stÃ¤ndige kÃ¤mpfen, fehlt einem die Motivation weiter zu spielen. Dazu eine eher schlechte Story und langweilige Nebenquests, hat es einfach nicht raus gehauen. [/spoiler]

Grafik: 4/5
[spoiler]Ich finde die Grafik grÃ¶ÃŸtenteils ansprechend. Einziger Kritikpunkt sind die StÃ¤dte und die Karte die mir nicht gefÃ¤llt. Dennoch finde ich das hier gute Arbeit geleistet wurde.[/spoiler]

Musik: 3/5
[spoiler]Hat mich nicht besonders gestÃ¶rt, aber auch nicht besonders bereichert.[/spoiler]

Kostenfaktor: 1/5
[spoiler]GrundgÃ¼tiger, ich habe das Spiel zum GlÃ¼ck nicht fÃ¼r den Vollpreis von 40â‚¬ gekauft. Das ist vollkommen Ã¼berzogen. Ganz ehrlich, ich wÃ¼rde das Spiel nicht noch einmal kaufen.[/spoiler]

Gesamteindruck: 1/5
[spoiler]Schleppend, ich ging eigentlich ohne groÃŸe Erwartungen an dieses Spiel heran, und wurde dennoch enttÃ¤uscht. Das System ist zwar einigermaÃŸen komplex, aber ziemlich schlecht umgesetzt. Da ich RPG's liebe und auch P&P in verschiedenen Spielsystemen leite, muss ich auch sagen das ich KÃ¤mpfe an sich nicht die Wichtigkeit zu spreche, wie sie hier zugesprochen wird. DafÃ¼r ist der RPG-Aspekt, fÃ¼r mich, viel zu mager ausgefallen. Nur zu empfehlen, wenn einem Story und Charakterentwicklung egal sind und man gerne Tabletop spielt.[/spoiler]

Schwierigkeitsgrad: 2/5
[spoiler]Wenn man sich mit dem System beschÃ¤ftigt hat ist es nicht schwer zu meistern, das einzige Problem ist einfach der heftige Einschlag von Zufallswerten.[/spoiler]
Hinweis:
Der Schwierigkeitsgrad soll nur eine Richtlinie darstellen und flieÃŸt nicht in die Wertung mit ein.

Gesamt: 2,2/5
[spoiler]Durchschnitt aus 'SpielspaÃŸ', 'Grafik', 'Musik', 'Gesamteindruck' und 'Kostenfaktor'[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198064599475', 'num_games_owned': 434, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 3217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2839, 'last_played': 1447629304}
review:
Pros
genre is underrepresented
No game breaking bugs
Significant protag customization
Interesting crapsack world
Portraits, mesh, and texturing is fairly decent
Voice acting is competent
Gave a moderate sense of player choices' mattering on first playthrough

Cons
Balance is poorly implimented in virtually every aspect of the game, from weapon and spell utility and encounter design, to difficulty curve, and pervasively undercuts every aspect of the gameplay
Mechanics are vastly overcomplicated, convoluted, and poorly explained.  VERY POORLY EXPLAINED.  
Animation is very basic

After I got over the needlessly high learning curve by experimenting with several builds, restarting the game a few times when they proved extremely frustrating to play, then reading several character build faqs, I discovered hamfisted, though not completely fruitless, neutral dark storytelling and moderately enjoyable, if one note, TBS gameplay.  Having finished the game I can conclusively say this is a game ONLY for extremely dedicated, veteran fans of the genre who are tolerant of some pretty serious lack of polish.  If you are such a person (and unfortunately since I completed it I was) you may consider this game a frustrating but sometimes enjoyable exercise of the TBS muscles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257696182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 5866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3812, 'last_played': 1494050804}
review:
Blackguards is a textbook example of a TRPG.  Sadly, this genre seems to be dying out, though the Blackguards series gives me some hope for the future of gaming.  I love how the Blackguards system is based off of a German roleplaying engine.  Old AD&D games like Pool of Radiance, even Baldur's Gate and Neverwinter NIghts (though I hate the real-time aspect of these) are my favorites, and Blackguards is definitely along that same line.

Some of the positives.  
*The customization available is one of this game's many strengths.  They allow the player to keep each character unique throughout this game without having too many options as to overwhelm.  
*The story isn't that happy-go-lucky anime stuff.  It's dark and intriguing.  The complaints regarding the main character's amnesia seem gripey to me.  Amnesia happens, but it's not overdone.  What I mean is that your main character may forget a few things, but won't go through the game complaining about missing memories.  The amnesia just adds to the mystery and allows the player to catch up on what has transpired.  Make no mistake, though, the focus is on the combat.
*Most battles allow for different ways of completing your mission using objects in the field or terrain.  The complaint some make along the lines of "I use the same tactics every time and this game becomes boring" is the result of the choice the individual player has made, not the limitations of the game. 
*I love the variety of the enemies you'll face and their crazy portraits.
*The soundtrack is mostly dark but there were several battle tracks I enjoyed.
*Don't expect to get the "+5 Sword of Fiery Judgment" toward the end.  The weapons in this game do not provide the means to become amazing in combat, which is very unusual for RPGs.  I appreciated the change.

What I didn't like.
*Around 75% through the game, my melee fighters were essentially maxed out.  Without assistance from magic, fighters need a lot of luck to be helpful.
*Speaking of luck, that D20 (the to-hit random number generator) is the most evil creature in creation.  90% treated me more like 70%.  1s were very rare and usually happened when I was finishing off a foe with few HP.  20s were frequent, as was foul language coming from me.  On top of that, there appeared to be a glitch.  I tossed, say, a 14 when 19 or below struck, yet the result was miss.  This occurred about one in every 15 attacks  (Despite this, the game is very beatable, I've finished it).
*I wish there was more story.  Not better story, just more story.  I still don't understand the motive for one of the player-controlled characters to follow around the main character.  I wish one of the foes was more-developed.

Those that haven't succumbed to mainstream gaming and still appreciate TRPGs can not go wrong in buying this game on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059321709', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1986, 'last_played': 1448507324}
review:
"Niam's targeted shot missed. (Chance 100%)"

That's about all you need to know; you will miss when you have a 100% chance to hit. It feels like an old game, but not in a good way. The concept of story and mechanics are all good, but it feels unpolished. Voice acting is not very convincing, character models are not very detailed, even in static conversation screens, and even the character personalities aren't very believable. [spoiler]At one point, some of your team tries to sell another into slavery. You kill the slaver and the offended team member doesn't even complain about the attempt to sell him.[/spoiler]

If you enjoy the brutalness of Xcom and want it mixed with a fantasy RPG, this is your game. But I, for one, have utilized the F-word in every variation during this play through. Get it on deep discount, like I did from Humble Bundle.

DSA und rundenbasierter Strategiekampf mit einer Heldentruppe. Das Ganze schÃ¶n und stimmungsvoll umgesetzt. Horasreich und teile des Tiefen SÃ¼dens als Kulisse, feine Musik. Charakterentwicklung gut umgesetzt. Die Charaktere sind kernig machen Laune. Spielgeschehen passend (Landkarte fÃ¼r die Geschichte, Questen und Interaktion und dann Strategie-Karten fÃ¼r den Kampf)

Eigentlich ein Pflichttermin. 8 von 10 Punkten. Kaufen, zocken, SpaÃŸ haben!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009169294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1447174980}
review:
Before playing this game I spend some time with [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/314830]Blackguards2[/url], and ultimately decided to wasn't worth my time.  I fired up Blackguards 1 to see if the original got it any better.  Surprisingly, the first game has a better pace to it, things move along a bit faster and the story gets way.  The protagonists seems more interesting, at least to me, and my crew is certainly an improvement.

Ultimately, the gameplay is still just so slow.  The combat and movement crawls like a snail.  Other titles like [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/237990/]Banner Saga[/url] have succeeded quite well with turn-based combat. 


[b]Pros[/b]
[*]144hz support
[*]Decent graphics, art tends to look reasonably good, it will immerse you.
[*]Itâ€™s better than [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/314830]Blackguards2[/url]
[/list]

[b]Cons[/b]
[*]Even though the game is turn based it needs to allow the user to speed things up a bit.  It takes far too long time to accomplish anything in the game
[*]No camera rotating?  Some objects are placed behind others with an obscured view.  It's not an isometric game so this is seemingly pointless limitation. 
[*]Combat doesn't seem to have a lot of strategy to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077349985', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1477844791}
review:
Ich hab noch nie ein taktisches Spiel gesehen was so extrem Zeitaufwendig ist wenn man im Modus : Normal spielt. Der Rundenbasierende Kampf dauert jedesmal mindestens 5 Minuten.. und es ist nicht wie bei Might of Magic, dass da dann mal was stirbt oder so. Das Spiel kann man nicht beschleunigen, man muss jedesmal wenn die Runde ungÃ¼nstig lÃ¤uft das ganze von Neuem beginnen und es ist sicher, dass man maximal ne 20% Gewinnchance hat, wenn man ein bestimmtes Ziel in der Runde erreichen soll. Es ist zum Kopf wÃ¤hrenddessen auf die Tischplatte hauen. Da manche Runden so etwa 20 bis 45 Minuten dauern, weil alles so unenedlich lange dauert.. dabei bewegt sich eine Figur eventuell maximal 12 Hex-Felder oder 4 bis 6 Hexfelder und wirft nen Speer oder ein magisches Geschoss oder haut einmal zu.. aber nein.. allein das dauert pro aktion mindestens 20 Sekunden. Npc's sterben grundsÃ¤tzlich daran, dass die gegner zu stark sind. -.- 

Und wer auch immer gemeint hat es ist schlau sich vom Spiel die Werte auswÃ¤hlen zu lassen hat einen an der Waffel. Nach knapp meheren Stunden bin ich immer noch im Startgebiet. hmpf.  Ne. Kaum Lust noch. WÃ¤r das nicht DSA wÃ¼rde ich mich da gar nicht erst durchquÃ¤len wollen. Die Spiele Entwickler haben doch einen an der Waffel, dass sie vergessen haben eine die MÃ¶glichkeit zu implementieren, das Kampfgeschehen zu beschleunigen. -.- War das Absicht? Damit die Story endlos lang dauert? Wobei es jedes mal nur Sprachfetzen sind.. an die man sich kaum noch erinnert, wenn man ungÃ¼nstiger Weise stÃ¤ndig einen Kampf verliert und nach einer Stunde noch die Selbe Stelle bearbeitet?

author: {'steamid': '76561198052261087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1446611844}
review: Incredibly bad game. Battles are essentially impossible to win in the beginning even with good tactics and taking advantage of every chokepoint you can. Activating environmental effects barely give you an advantage. You have to fight battles way too many times until simple luck stops an enemy from dodging your tenth attack in a row so you can finally hit them. Lost a battle to an enemy who had less than 5hp and proceeded to dodge all my attacks and wipe me out. It's absurd. Not worth even as part of a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088877976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1446957620}
review:
While I only played this for 30 minutes I was bored out of my mind the entire time. Story is all over the place. Starts with a common trope of put in prison for something didn't commit and has no memory. Another prisioner "rescues" you for no apparant reason, and you resuce another prisoner on your way out. So of course you become close friends and adventure together.
Combat was bland. I chose a ranger as my class and after the first battle which saw me kill a single creature in two attacks, I spend the next three combats using a torch as a melee weapon against armed and armoured guards. I won of course.
Maybe it gets better over time, but I'm not wasting mine after the introduction.

review: I love this game! I think Blackguards defines a template for what a perfect RPG should be. The only thing that annoyed me was lack of lighting in many areas. Everything else is just perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045549641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6170, 'last_played': 1445420978}
review: I came here twice to give a scathing review, out of frustration.  I couldn't bring myself to post them, and I'm glad I didn't.  I ended up having more fun with this game than I've had in a long time, but keep in mind it has a learning curve.  This game is complicated, and incredibly fun once you understand how to play it and the fact that it is not designed for you to hit every shot you make (which seems to be the biggest complaint, but in my opinion only made it challenging and in turn fun in the end).  My advice is that on your first playthrough, when you get to the point to where you feel you cannot get past, start a new game.  You will then understand the game enough to really play it and will have learned how to develop your character.  This will be one of those few games that I will play through again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100477286', 'num_games_owned': 946, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 2119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2119, 'last_played': 1446406948}
review:
Game is funny , but short , not much customisation but have good story. Far too much fighting and it's easy when you know what to do. Yet have something which made me rush to finish ;) 
It is like a good movie , but longer. Was hoping for more but 35 hours and game finished :) 
Characters in game are awsome especially my beloved Dwarf ;) almost like  from pen and paper games ;)
Music sometimes is annoying , few to loud sound effects of few spells but higly recomend game.

Do not play anything else then expert mode it is easy to read all descriptions. 
Last fight is difficult so prepare for it do not let somones down in first faze as it will not be present in 2nd.
ALSO IMPORTANT : do not  use magical dmg weapons  only as in few quest you have to have only normal damage.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986997483', 'num_games_owned': 846, 'num_reviews': 314, 'playtime_forever': 1382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1177, 'last_played': 1526374336}
review: I can't understand the bad reviews.  This is everything I want in a tacticle RPG game.  Every combat is a unique experience, often with puzzles for you to figure out to make things easier.  The story is interesting, with fun twists, the dialogue is well-written.  I particularly love the static town screens so that you don't have to talk to every uninteresting twit there to make sure you haven't missed anything.  My only slight negative is that the upgrade system is rather complicated, and I had to restart the game once after I figured it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017062350', 'num_games_owned': 1505, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1467869490}
review: It's like playing D&D 4E with a rather railroad-y DM. Were I playing actual tabletop, that would be a bad thing but this game is the closest I've come to a full-production digital D&D adventure, without it actually being a D&D product.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976498153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 4426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4061, 'last_played': 1446006259}
review:
*Consideratelo come pollice giallo*
*Giocato ad Hard*

Gioco di ruolo ambientato nel mondo di Dark Eye del tutto focalizzato sul combattimento a turni. Da subito si nota una curva di apprendimento ripida come l'Everest, la scheda del personaggio Ã¨ forse la piÃ¹ complessa nella storia del genere. Come prenderete confidenza con le regole vi accorgerete che il bilanciamento Ã¨ fatto alla pene di segugio: combattimenti che dovrebbero essere facili spesso sono difficilissimi, altri che dovrebbero essere difficili sono facili, stesso discorso per le armi magiche trovabili, le quali sembrano buttate in giro senza una logica. Problemi di game design si presentano a piÃ¹ riprese, esempio: avventurarsi nella sezione finale non livellati abbastanza o senza certi incantesimi fondamentali renderÃ  quasi impossibile passarla.

Se tutto questo per voi non Ã¨ un problema, ed anzi, siete alla ricerca di una sfida, allora questo Ã¨ il gioco che fa per voi, anche perchÃ© tutti gli altri aspetti non analizzati qua sopra sono piÃ¹ che dignitosi.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987388969', 'num_games_owned': 1728, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1446012888}
review: Blackguards is a Turn-based, Tactical RPG, where you have the freedom to customize your character to your own playstyle.  You can roll a Hunter, Warrior, or Mage, and cross train each if you choose. You will lead up to five characters whom you save or recruit on your travels to help you in your quest. Blackguards has a dark story, which may not be suitable for the very young gamer, but teenage gamers have seen a lot worse on television. Visually speaking, Blackguards looks beautiful, it is well designed, intricate and detailed. There are over 100 different scenes, each as detailed well designed as the last. While I am not a huge fan of turn-based play, this was a very fun game I could come back to again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048905432', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1385, 'last_played': 1442973246}
review:
I would call this an excelent turn-based fatasy combat game with weak RPG elements.  I stopped playing before I finished the game.  The combats were cool, but plot was far too linear for my taste.  It did not seem that anything you could do would affect on the overall plot and the game sometimes does bad things to your characters regardless of the choices you make.  I don't think the creators have a very deep understanding of the RPG player mindset.  The term "railroaded" feels appropriate.  

Overall I would rate it a 6 on a 1-10 scale.  Worth my money, but not one that I would played through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021508010', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2332, 'last_played': 1445113788}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971118263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3880, 'last_played': 1446342112}
review:
This game is hard, its fun and its not for everyone. plan on playing it and then restarting once you know whats going on. I find the difficulty refreshing. there only a few games like this that are this difficult. Its constantly challenging you wih unfair situations and at times the battles are more like puzzles to be solved. If your looking for a game where you can just put together the most effective , winningest party and then just consistantly  kick everythings ass, this isnt it. If your looking for a game that will constantly challenge you to find the way to win each battle or string of battles, this is the one.

That being said, there are definitly character builds that work fine up untill a certain battle and then they will not let you procede no matter how hard you try. Its highly reccomended that you check out one of the guides out there that will give you pointers on what to avoid and whats more effective.

author: {'steamid': '76561198248511294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1441618471}
review: I really liked the mechanics, the writing and the setting, but the combat becomes quite repetitive. Plus melee chars are quite boring. 7/10 points is fair for its genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006167184', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3369, 'last_played': 1445171378}
review:
Before saying anything else: this is a hard game. Getting to know how everything works may require time, and you will feel frustrated sometimes when your attacks or spells fail again and again. But that also can make it satisfying when you manage to do things well! So, knowing that, if you feel brave enough... go for it!

The game can be a bit expensive for its real content, but I would surely recommend getting it on sale. Combat system's really good, you'll depend on strategies and using the environment to get some advantage. Characters are not very developed but are unusual and funny in many scenes, and the story is... well, a bit different, though it has its cliches.

Be careful when designing your main character! You'll probably end up failing your first game hard and noticing he's useless when it's too late... Start with an archer if you feel lost - you can't go wrong with that.

Pros
+ Tactic and varied combat, with lots of maps and strategies
+ Fully voiced, good dialogues
+ Many different weapons, spells and items you can use during the fights
+ Shady characters, not your classic heroes
+ More content than I expected, with a lot of sidequests
+ A real challenge if you want to go into the hard mode... or even normal difficulty
+ One of the best dwarfs ever

Cons
- Some fights can be really hard compared to the rest of the game
- Learning curve? More like learning wall
- You won't understand how combat works until you've failed a lot
- Game controls feel a bit clumsy sometimes, you may end up casting heals on yourself instead of the intended target
- The ending doesn't live up to the rest of the story, it's too abrupt and you feel like you're missing a cutscene or something
- You may find yourself trapped... if you built your characters wrong, you won't be able to survive to certain parts of the plot and may even need to restart everything. I'm thinking about you, Nine Hordes...

author: {'steamid': '76561198056698823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 4668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4668, 'last_played': 1469878696}
review:
Blackguards is a RPG with a decent number of dialogue choices. The story has its ups and downs and early it is a bit confusing because they throw alot of unknown terms at you and and most of them you will only learn halfway through the game. And the end is kinda lackluster in my opinion.

The combat is turn based and the battles are mostly diversed since some can have puzzle elemnts others can have a few stages and so on. And your choices along the game influences some of the battles you have.

One of the biggest problem in the game is the amount of stats and character builds you can do makes the game way to difficult and players that dont understand how the game works in that regards can completely screw their games and be forced to start from scratch. The game does a really poor job of explaining how the overall stats work and the only way to learn about them is looking at help menu and read it or go to the manual. 

On the positive side when you learn to make a proper build your mid-late game characters can have quite impressive abilities and power, the high level spell effects are rather impressive.

Also it is worth mentioning some of the achievements don't work properly or don't work at all.

Overall I liked the game however the high learning curve that can really punish you is something that only some people can tolerate. And the game only really offers a couple of playthroughs in terms of story and in regards to builds I dont think that people will play purely on the interest of seeing builds with diferent weapons, the spells are nice but they will not make the players play the game again just to see their high level form.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025676649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1695, 'last_played': 1444101274}
review: Gameplay is fun - tactics are good, character building is flexible and enjoyable. The amount of RNG in battles does get frustrating and the skills aren't well balanced. Story and characters leaves a lot to be desired.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007227242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1444560806}
review:
Another entry for the Thank-you-German-Game-Developers award. The game does not even start. I tried every little thing from 5 different forums. Nothing. Crashes on start. So after

The Guild 
The Guild 2
etc
yet nother reason to never buy games from Germany ever again. Pains me, as I am from Germany. But I guess bug fixing and quality assurance do not exist for German game developers. Refund requested.

review:
SchÃ¶nes spiel macht sehr viel laune und hatt auserdem auch ein gewisses dÃ¼steres setting macht mir sehr viel spaÃŸ und ich finde es klasse stry hat schÃ¶ne plot twist und ist ansich auch schÃ¶n gemahct auserdem ist fast alles vertont wuhu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038538764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 8981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8662, 'last_played': 1444013609}
review:
Bockschwere lineare Rundenstrategie im Das Schwarze Auge (DSA) Universum mit kleinen Macken und nicht funktionierenden Steam-Erfolgen.

Die grosse StÃ¤rke dieses Spieles sind die KÃ¤mpfe. Sie haben eine grosse taktische Tiefe und spielen 
im Rundenstrategie-Genre ganz oben mit. Oft ist auch der Einsatz von interaktiven Objekten bei einem Kampf gefordert,
damit man siegreich vom Platz geht. Es kommt auf das richtige Zusammenspiel der Spezialisten (Nah,- und FernkÃ¤mpfer,
Magier) an. Echt super!

Wichtig ist auch zu wissen, dass der Schwierigkeitsgrad recht heftig ist. Ich habe viel Rollenspiel und DSA Erfahrung,
hatte aber auf "hart" teilweise sehr heftige Herausforderungen. Dem Normalspieler empfehle ich den "leichten" und
erfahreneren Spielern den "mittleren" Schwierigkeitsgrad. Damit man mit dem Schwierigkeitsgrad gut zurecht kommt, sollte man sich am Anfang Zeit einplanen und Ã¼berlegen, wie genau man seine Charaktere entwickeln will. Beim Magier kann man nur ein paar Zauber maxen und die wollen gut Ã¼berlegt sein. Ob die Ãœberlegungen stimmen, bekommt man im spÃ¤teren Spielverlauf immer mehr mit und machen auch nen grossen Reiz des Spiels aus. Aber dadurch ist halt auch ein verskillen mÃ¶glich!

Insgesamt war der Schwierigkeitsgrad in den ca. 200 KÃ¤mpfen konstant und fordernd, mit einigen Ã¤rgerlichen Ausnahmen. Einige dieser unbalancierten KÃ¤mpfe waren optional, einige der KÃ¤mpfe aber nicht. Sehr schade, dass man
so oft neuladen muss, bis die Gegner nicht tÃ¶dlich vorgehen, ohne das man was machen kann.

Auch gab es zuviel Erfahrungspunkte im Spiel. Ich konnte meine Party voll ausbauen und noch einige "Extras" leisten.
So geht der Schwierigkeitsgrrad ab nem bestimmten Punkt leider nach  unten...

Leider gibt es auch nen Zauberspruch (Hast Stufe 3) der fast wie ein Cheat ist und auch den Schwierigkeitsgrad
bedeutend absenkt.

Apropos Zauber: Richtig super sind Ã¼brigens die Effekte der Zauber. Die Zauber selbst gibt es jeweils in 4 Stufen und die hÃ¶chste Stufe hat oftmals nen Effekt fÃ¼rs ganze Schlachtfeld. Da die Zauber jeweils optisch und akkustisch echt gelungen sind, hat man noch mehr Spass an den KÃ¤mpfen.

Der grÃ¶sste Negativpunkt: Trotz das viel Arbeit und Liebe in das Spiel gesteckt wurde, wird es nach Erscheinen
kaum "gepflegt". Es gibt ziemlich viele Steam-Erfolge, die einfach immer noch nicht funktionieren! Das ist den Entwicklern schon lange bekannt. Getan hat sich da aber seitdem nichts mehr. Auch wurde im Forum zugesagt,
Waffenschadenssteigerungen durch KÃ¶rperkraft klar zu machen (ab welchem Wert gibt es eine Steigerung). Trotz Zusage der Entwickler im Januar 2014 im offiziellen Forum ist dies immer noch nicht geschehen. Schwach!!!

Trotz allem freue ich mich auf Blackguards 2, da es wenige Rundenstategietitel mit dieser Tiefe und der starken Lizenz auf dem Markt gibt! Deshalb klare Kaufempfehlung an Fans des Genres!

Tip: Das Spiel mit nem Krieger zu spielen ist am einfachsten. Schwerer wird es mit BogenschÃ¼tze und ganz schwer mit Magier (besonders am Anfang).

author: {'steamid': '76561198083366021', 'num_games_owned': 1142, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1443965595}
review:
Looks great, plays horribly...

-Percentages don't mean a thing apparently... 100% chance to hit shot, misses... how, why?
-Immense difficulty spikes majorly created by the shabby percentages...
-sufficient gear and cash are hard to come by, no grinding possible...
- have to quit playing, easy basic game, miss every shot every time even though  all the shots have percentages between 80 and 100%... on easy.... every shot... and the foes hit nearly every shot... on easy... nearly every shot...
This could have been a great turn-based rpg, but this way of being defeated, may be alluring to some, but to me this game is the dark souls of turn-based strategy, not because of skill requirements, but just just impossible hit-percentages...

author: {'steamid': '76561198026667042', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 2412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2216, 'last_played': 1444531350}
review:
I really like this game and the German pen and paper system it's based on. The plot is very good compared to today's standards. The voice acting is superb, except for a few characters- executioner.... It's a pleasure to look at, and for the most part the game runs smoothly. That said, it can be worth it if it's on a 75%+ sale.

I'm still giving it a negative rating because of how many times the damn game crashes or freezes on a loading screen. The latest save-game file constantly corrupts making you backtrack. The tooltip isn't kidding- save often!!! Waaay too much fubar and frustration, when most of my games work fine.

<Edit: I am struggling to just play without crashes, and it completely took out my new rig last night. Unexpected shutdown was attributed to the apps path of this game, as well as the temporary files in memory. I don't know why I'm even strugglebusing myself through the rest of the game when it freezes on every other loading screen...>

author: {'steamid': '76561198032268167', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5088, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4264, 'last_played': 1444068548}
review:
Das Spiel orientiert sich sehr stark an der Regelvorlage vom DSA Pen & Paper, mit allen StÃ¤rken und allen SchwÃ¤chen.

Wer die Vorlage kennt, findet sich schnell zurecht, denn die FÃ¤higkeiten und Zauber werden wie Ã¼blich gesteiert. Neulinge werden jedoch etwas Einarbeitungszeit einkalkulieren mÃ¼ssen. Man kann die Charaktere definitiv verskillen.

Das Spiel besteht eigentlich zu 80% aus einer Aneinanderreihung von Kampfszenen, die nach DSA-Manier in Kampfrunden ablaufen. Die KÃ¤mpfe werden lose durch die recht klassische und liniare dÃ¼stere Story zusammen gehalten.
NatÃ¼rlich gibt es auch viele Nebenquets, die aber selten sonderlich aufregend sind.
Die Story geht an sich in Ordnung, verliert aber durch die Kampflastigkeit etwas an Fahrt
Positiv finde ich, dass man nicht die klassischen Helden spielt, sondern Antihelden, die mehr oder weniger unfreiwillig in die Story hinein geraten. 
Im Spiel sind auch div. klassische Rollenspielerwitze und Klischees nett verarbeitet, was ich wirklich witzig fand.

Negativ finde ich, dass die Story recht locker insziniert ist. Die KÃ¤mpfe als solches sind nicht sonderlich mitivierend, da auch das Zufallselement sehr hoch ist und man mit etwas WÃ¼rfelpech auch hÃ¤ufiger verliert und neu laden muss. Erst zum Ende hin werden die Videosequenzen dichter und man wird mehr mit genommen.

Insgesamt kann ich das Spiel fÃ¼r Rollenspieler bedingt empfehlen, wenn man mit SchwÃ¤chen in der Spielmechanik leben kann und nicht allzuviel Wert auf eine aufregende Inszenierung legt.
Wer mit Pen & Paper nichts anfangen kann, sollte auf jeden Fall die Finger von dem Spiel lassen. 

Ich persÃ¶nlich wÃ¼rde fÃ¼r das Spiel nicht mehr als 10â‚¬ ausgeben. Ich habe es im Sale fÃ¼r 3,99 â‚¬ bekommen und dafÃ¼r war es schon in Ordnung. Als Vollpreisspiel hÃ¤tte ich es mir aber nicht gekauft. Im Vergleich mit anderen Vollpreisspielen wie z.B. Skyrim oder Mass Effect ist dann der Vollpreis eigentlich auch nicht zu rechtfertigen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995497021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 2745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2640, 'last_played': 1442762119}
review:
Blackguards parvient Ã  rester satisfaisant sur certains des fondamentaux du genre, Ã  savoir le leveling et les combats.

La montÃ©e en expÃ©rience des personnages se fait sans niveau dâ€™expÃ©rience Ã  proprement parler. En effet, tous les points dâ€™expÃ©rience accumulÃ©s au cours des combats et des quÃªtes terminÃ©es vont pouvoir Ãªtre dÃ©pensÃ©s dans lâ€™intÃ©gralitÃ© des  caractÃ©ristiques (force, courage, etc), compÃ©tences (piÃ¨ges, soin, etc), maitrise des armes et des sorts, comme bon nous semble. Sachant quâ€™il y a plÃ©thore de paramÃ¨tres pour chaque personnage, la dÃ©couverte du systÃ¨me de leveling est un peu abrupte au dÃ©but, mais une fois quâ€™on sâ€™y est fait, le systÃ¨me nous apparait comme trÃ¨s complet et nous permet de spÃ©cialiser nos personnages finement, comme bon nous semble.

Les combats, malgrÃ© quelques soucis de finition question jouabilitÃ©, sont trÃ¨s tactiques, et ils se jouent Ã  la faÃ§on du X-Com moderne, Ã  savoir que notre personnage a le droit pendant son tour Ã  Â« un mouvement plus une action Â» ou bien Â« un mouvement Ã©tendu Â». Si ce systÃ¨me a fait ses preuves, on regrettera cependant lâ€™absence du systÃ¨me de points dâ€™action Ã  la maniÃ¨re dâ€™un Fallout qui permet une gestion encore plus fine des opÃ©rations tactiques. Le plateau de chaque zone de combat est divisÃ© en hexagone et lâ€™ordre dâ€™initiative des participants (personnages ou ennemis) est clairement affichÃ© en bas de lâ€™Ã©cran.

Malheureusement, lâ€™ensemble du reste du titre prÃ©sente trop de dÃ©fauts qui, mis bout Ã  bout, finissent par gÃ¢cher lâ€™expÃ©rience de jeu. En voici les principaux :

La gestion de lâ€™inventaire est simplement une calamitÃ©.
Le classement des objets dans lâ€™inventaire gÃ©nÃ©ral (globalisÃ© entre tous les personnages) se fait en fonction de leur date dâ€™acquisition, ce qui est stupide.
Le systÃ¨me de comparaison entre lâ€™arme/armure Ã©quipÃ©e et celle disponible dans lâ€™inventaire est bien trop imprÃ©cis pour Ãªtre dâ€™une quelconque utilitÃ©. 
Chaque personnage dispose de 3 slots dâ€™armes (main gauche + main droite). Mais par exemple la nÃ©cessitÃ© dâ€™allouer Ã  chaque arc (main gauche du slot X) son lot de flÃ¨ches (main droite du slot X) est Ã©galement une aberration sans nom, puisque ces mÃªmes flÃ¨ches ne pourront Ãªtre utilisÃ©es par ce personnage avec lâ€™arc du slot Y.
Jâ€™en passe et des meilleuresâ€¦

Le jeu nous impose en permanence son rythme.
La gestion de lâ€™aventure au cours des chapitres 1 et 2 est une catastrophe, avec un ultra-dirigisme qui donne la nausÃ©e, et on se doit dâ€™enchainer parfois jusquâ€™Ã  3 combats sans que le jeu ne nous demande quoi que ce soit. Sachant que la gestion de lâ€™Ã©quipe ne peut se faire quâ€™en dehors des combats, leur enchainement peut vite tourner au dÃ©sastre.
Les choses sâ€™arrangent nÃ©anmoins Ã  partir du chapitre 3, avec la quasi-intÃ©gralitÃ© des lieux qui se dÃ©bloque et la possibilitÃ© de faire les quÃªtes secondaires comme bon nous semble.

Enfin, le dÃ©faut IMPARDONNABLE pour un jeu de tactique faisant intervenir autant de "lancers de dÃ©s virtuels" : la gestion des statistiques ne suit simplement aucune logique mathÃ©matique. 
Chaque action dâ€™attaque entreprise par un personnage au cours dâ€™un combat est notifiÃ©e Ã  lâ€™Ã©cran par un pourcentage de rÃ©ussite. Mais le jeu est simplement incapable de gÃ©rer proprement ces statistiques et il mâ€™est arrivÃ© de rater un coup affichÃ© initialement Ã  100% de chance de rÃ©ussite. VÃ©ridique !!! Et il nâ€™est pas rare dâ€™enchainer avec vos personnages des Ã©checs successifs affichÃ©s Ã  90% de chance de rÃ©ussite. Ce manque flagrant de cohÃ©rence mathÃ©matique fait quâ€™il nâ€™est pas rare de devoir recommencer de nombreux combats sous prÃ©texte que nos personnages dÃ©butent tous leur premier tour avec une action ratÃ©e, le retour de bÃ¢ton de lâ€™adversaire Ã©tant alors souvent saignant. A devenir maboule dingo !

En conclusion, Blackguards prÃ©sente dans son ensemble vraiment trop de dÃ©fauts, dont certains sont fondamentaux, et qui mis bout Ã  bout finissent par rendre le joueur fou. Vous voulez du combat tactique en tour par tour, prÃ©fÃ©rez lui le dernier X-Com, voire les premiers Fallout !

review:
I've just finished this game!!! That's awesone!!! I really can't find the words: the plot, the atmosphere, the gameplay, the music, the characters. All things are on the highest level!!! After I finished the game I wanted to try to make my own character.

I really can recommend this game... even if the man doesn't like turn-based games! 
10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019672607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1540019503}
review:
Very nice! The story is interesting, the characters are fun and believable. And the combat! Its so fun to play something that isn't as easy as everyhting else these days. Also the combat mechanics are pretty strong.

If you think you like a challenge and turn based combat, this one is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018390149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1438700236}
review: A game I highly anticipated but found extremely boring. The story was staid and stale and the constant fighting got dull real quick.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161696496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1442604263}
review:
Boring.
Game consist only of chain of fights with running over ridiculous hexes.  Yes exactly that - one boring fight over small map with hexes is chained to another equally boring fight by small borring dialogue.
That could be forgivable with group DnD novices with paper and pen, but not for game.
Besides invetory information is either buggy or terrible - all armors shows armor rating 0 (0) - that is no any protection by any armor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036655374', 'num_games_owned': 728, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1442412466}
review:
This is a game that was recommended by my games magazine. Still after reading the reviews here on steam I was not convinced so it ended up on my wish list,  I gave it at a try when it was for sale at 75%.

This is a game of tactical rpg combat but for me it gets old very fast, I want more from my rpg:s than only combat. Also since this is combat only they should at least have let you build all characters but no you can only build one, you are stuck with the rest of the team.

The layout is also in my opinion clunky and you can't rotate the map to get a better view, sometimes characters can be hard to see hidden behind objects on the map.

I cannot recommend this game but if you are really in to the tactical combat part of roleplaying games and want a challenge give it a try.

review: petit jeu en tour par tour basÃ©e sur le monde D&D, enfin , plutot sur la serie l'oeil noir, pour les fan qui ont connus les jeux de plateau durant les annÃ©es 70 -80 ^^ bien fait, belle histoire, y a du challenge et on ne s'ennuie pas, pour le prix vous n'Ãªtes pas voler ^^ essayer aussi l'addon ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198032729607', 'num_games_owned': 1080, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 4287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4287, 'last_played': 1442546070}
review:
Where to start? 
Most reviewers/trolls/noobs outright complain about the difficulty of the game, calling out bugs on things like dmg type resistance or getting knocked down because they cant figure out character builds.
if you want a game that its pretty much like click here to win, you are in the wrong genre.
if you want a game where you dont want to retry the same fight a few times to get it right, you are in the wrong genre.
This is a turn based rol-playing game, you won't get things right from the beginning withouth knowing the game beforehand. 
I can almost assure you that you might screw up the builds of your party and there wont be an easy way to fix that, but thats the idea of the game, you either push through, start over or go to forums or reviews to whine like a noob because you failed to see the game manual/help/build guides.

Now if you like challenges, and turn based RPGs this one is for you, you have magic, killer snipers and swords! 

bit of a spoiler if you may
you get a very functional party consisting of: A greedy sort-of-crazy dwarf, a gigollo magician, a stoner elf, a killer jungleman and a witch.
you can mold the characters as you damn well please, with some restrictions of course, but who dosnt want to have a mage in his party?

what else? main character is not gender or class locked so that gives you some freedom to choose what you want to do.

oh and yes don't forget: willpower -> def vs spells : body control -> falling/getting knocked!

author: {'steamid': '76561198015421701', 'num_games_owned': 370, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1682, 'last_played': 1643835686}
review:
Dieses Spiel hat all das was man sich als DSAler erhoft!

Einen super Soundtrack, eine atmosphÃ¤risch stimmige Spielwelt
und einen guten Einblick in das doch recht komplizierte Regelwerk.
Wenn man ein standart Abenteuer mit standart BÃ¶sewichten in 
einer visuell ansprechenden Welt erleben mÃ¶chte funktioniert
das hiermit sehr gut.
Das wichtigste am ganzen Spiel ist eigentlich das es sich auch tatsÃ¤chlich wie DSA anfÃ¼hlt!
Wenn man seit Monaten leider keine Pen&Paper Gruppe mehr zusammenbekommen hat 
ist das hier eine Lohnenswerte Alternative mit dem schÃ¶nen Zusatz das man jeden Char selbst 
spielt und levelt.
Die KÃ¤mpfe sind anspruchsvoll aber mit einer guten Portion Taktik immer zu schaffen. 
Zu bemÃ¤ngeln ist lediglich das der Umfang nicht das volle DSA Universum darstellt und sich eigtl. nur ( bis zum jetzigen Spielstand ) auf kleine Teile des Horasreiches und Al'Anfa beschrÃ¤nkt. Dadurch wird das Spiel aber auch fÃ¼r DSA Neulinge greifbarer und leichter verstÃ¤ndlich. AuÃŸerdem bekommt man selbst als DSA Spieler einen schÃ¶nen Einblick in Klassen die man selbst noch nie gespielt hat.

Wenn die Spielreihe so bleibt und sich der Umfang noch erweitert bin ich ein neuer Fan! 
Man muss sich von der bescheidenen Wertung keinesfalls abschrecken lassen. Klare Empfehlung!

review:
Das Spiel ist nicht schlecht, ich empfehle es aber nur, wenn man verzweifelt auf der Suche nach einem Rollenspiel ist.

Ich habe es auf Schwer gespielt und muss sagen, die KÃ¤mpfe basieren grÃ¶ÃŸtenteils nur auf GlÃ¼ck und sind teilweise absurd unfair. Zum GlÃ¼ck ist die KI dÃ¤mlich sonst wÃ¤re es noch frustrierender. Ich hatte zwar keine perfekt geskillte Gruppe aber das ist auch nicht das Problem. Das Problem sind die teilweise an dÃ¼mmliche Bedingungen geknÃ¼pften KÃ¤mpfe. Wie z.B. inerhalb von 5 Runden einen  bestimmten Punkt erreichen. Sehr frustrierend wenn man den selben Mist  Ã¼ber 10x versuchen muss.

Die Charkterentwicklung ist dafÃ¼r aber gut gelungen, ganz im Gegensatz zur Gestaltung. Ich hatte nach der Erstellung schon keine Lust mehr da man nur 5 "KÃ¶pfe" zur Auswahl hat und die sich an HÃ¤sslichkeit gegenseitig Ã¼berbieten.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971019221', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 4697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2357, 'last_played': 1445920752}
review: Some maps are just brutally hard and have to be repeated many times until random dice rolls work out in your favor. An otherwise OK game is really ruined by this lack of balancing and tuning. The engine is pretty cool, but the game content feels rushed and slapped together. Maybe Blackguards 2 is better. This is worth a couple bucks, not much more IMO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121881744', 'num_games_owned': 1407, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2219, 'last_played': 1441413037}
review:
Blackguards ist ein wirklich hervorragendes RPG, in das man sich eigentlich nur verlieben kann. Der aktionsÃ¼chtige Gamer ist hier allerdings vÃ¶llig falsch. Wer allerdings spannende und mitreiÃŸende Storys liebt und sich nicht schnell von FehlschlÃ¤gen und teilweise stundenlangen Versuchen einen Kampf zu meistern entmutigen lÃ¤sst, wird dieses Spiel lieben. 

Ich kann nur eine absolute Empfehlung, mit einem unmissverstÃ¤ndlichem Wink auf die vielen schlechten Bewertungen, aussprechen. Das Spiel basiert nun einmal auf DSA und in Aventurien funktioniert halt nicht immer alles direkt so wie man will, ganz genau wie im echten Leben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018236570', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 768, 'last_played': 1442621311}
review:
I bought this on sale for like $3. I regret buying it.

Pros:
Hex-based tactical combat
Lots of character customization
Points system for leveling skills
Environmental effects such as setting bushes on fire, slipping in puddles, or knocking stalagtites off the ceiling of a cave

Cons:
You will likely hit your opponents maybe 10% of the time. You have a hit percentage ranging from 0 to 100. This is based on your skill with the weapon, your attack stat, and the level of the creature you're attacking. This does not take into account their ability to dodge or parry. A character (opponent or ally) can parry the first physical attack against them each turn. They can dodge any number of attacks per turn. So, if you have a 90% chance to hit, it is then further reduced behind the scenes by their dodge rating, and again by parry if they have not yet been hit. If you have anything less than say, 80% chance to hit, it may take you dozens of turns to end a battle that could have ended in like 6.

Enemies at the beginning of the game hit every hard, and rarely miss. You can increase your dodge and parry ratings through skills, but at character select you can't exactly make it huge. This would be fine, if it weren't for the fact that enemies can quite often hit for 10-15 damage, while your character only has about 30 health. Early game you only have 3 party members, and very often face off against 5+ enemies. It's easy to get swarmed, so using choke points is a must-- at least it would be if the majority of the levels they put you in weren't open rooms.

Cover doesn't seem to do anything. One of the earliest tips you get is that you are harder to hit in partial cover, and even harder to hit in full cover, like behind a tree. Archers have no trouble hitting you from the full length of the map behind full cover for 5-8 damage a turn, and it will take at least 2 or 3 turns to be able to reach them.

Some quests/scenarios are outright impossible if you try them too early, and the game has no qualms about sending you to your death. A good example of an early scenario in this game is facing a Wood Troll (like a treant). It has a ton of health and does a lot of damage (like 15-20 per hit), but it's slow and in a gaseous swamp. You can stand in front of a gas pocket and  use a fire spell or torch on the gas to explode it a few times to win the fight. You could do this at level 1 if you wanted, but an uninformed player would try to rush it and die quickly. 

A bad example is later on. You fight some dwarves in an arena. They have a lot of health, do a lot of damage, and can move as far as you. You're *supposed* to use the same method as the Wood Troll. Stand in front of the mace trap before it activates, lure the enemy into it, and do most of the damage through the trap. My issue is I was underleveled, and there was no way for me to know this until it was too late. The enemy dodged 100% of my attacks, knocked down a character per turn, and the melee dwarf hit for 15+ damage per turn plus 5 poison per turn while 2 of my characters had ~30 hp, and one with 46. The melee dward also parried the trap that was supposed to deal the damage to him each turn, so he was functionally invincible. I tried at least a dozen times, looked online, and saw the only real way to win the fight is to ignore the mission until you had another party member and were a little more leveled. Looking at my saves, I had one auto save right before the fight, a quick save right before the fight, and a manual save about an hour and a half prior (Which isn't the game's fault, but frustrating nonetheless).

You can't level skills without finding a trainer, even if you meet the pre-requisites to unlock it, or had the option to learn it during character creation. If I don't spend at least one point into the mend wounds ability at character creation, I cannot learn it until much later when I find the right trainer. I would understand for some skills, but for the basic levels of some passive abilities or skills it doesn't make much sense.

Overall, the game is difficult for the sake of being difficult, but not in a way that self improvement can make it any easier. Unlike an action game like Dark Souls, dying isn't always the result of you fucking up. A lot of the time, it's because a creature rolled the highest it possibly could 3 turns in a row, or all 3 of your characters missed every single roll 3 turns in a row. If you're okay with restarting a mission over and over just to beat it, or to avoid getting knocked down and started on fire before your first turn, go for it. If you're as easily frustrated as me at a game where RNG is the core mechanic of the game, avoid it, even for $3.00

author: {'steamid': '76561198035857861', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1441135005}
review:
Grandi potenzialitÃ ... sfruttate di merda.

Una serie di comparti, da quello grafico alla customizzazione e al combattimento, sono davvero ben fatti e molto curati e mi fa incazzare che tutto ciÃ² che di buono ha questo gioco sia rovinato da scelte di gameplay, stuttura mappe, gestione incontri/finanze e sopratutto il BILANCIAMENTO della difficoltÃ  dei nemici e scelte di design delle sfide.

chi Ã¨ il genio che ha pensato di mettere scontri in serie senza possibilitÃ  di cure (limitate giÃ  di suo) con mappe fatte a dir poco col culo (ctrl+c e ctrl+v su questo quello e quello. poi ricopro il 75% della mappa di trappole e di NOIOSISSIMI buratti che non colpiscono mai e danno solo noia e fastidio nell'aspettare che finiscano la loro animazione), con scelte di bilanciamento delle medesime sfide al limite del ridicolo? ("ma si per salvare tizio devi essere qui entro 5 turni, 3 ti servono per arrivarci e in mezzo hai 6 nemici con altrettante trappole", oppure "ma si, mettiamo due nani fullati di pozioni di cura che asfaltano ogni pg, senza contare che il party Ã¨ NUDO e senza possibilitÃ  di usare gli oggetti precedentemente acquisiti". davvero si, ottima idea!)

in definitiva; il gioco, per un'amante degli rpg tattici a turni, sarebbe anche molto bello, se determinate scelte di level design e bilanciamenti vari non fossero stati fatti col culo! giocare al normale Ã¨ frustrante da morire, senza parlare che se sbagli un salvataggio al momento sbagliato, tipo entrare (senza sapere NULLA di cosa sta per accadere) in una sequela di eventi no stop senza tregua ne possibilitÃ  di rifocillamenti vari...  devi ricominciare da capo.
e non dimentichiamoci la bellisima parte "sei nudo, vai e combatti ma prima comprati questo equip costoso come un rene che poi non ti servirÃ  piÃ¹ appena riavrai la tua roba". 200 monete d'oro butte via nel bottino, ole!

no programmatori, no... prendete chi ha fatto queste scelte di level design e mandatelo a coltivare rape in zimbawe, forse farÃ  meno danni.

consigliato per l'acquisto? NO.
mi brucia il culo ad averlo comprato anche se ci ho speso sopra solo 3 euro, non oso immaginare se qualcuno volesse spendercene di piÃ¹. pazzia pensare di spendere piÃ¹ di 4 euro per un titolo del genere.

 se volete un buon gioco dello stesso tipo, prendete la saga X-COM, non questa merda.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030767212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 1643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1643, 'last_played': 1441209497}
review:
Soll man das Spiel nun lieben oder hassen? Eine bei Blackguards sehr schwierige Entscheidung. Die Story und die KÃ¤mpfe sind an sich ganz gut umgesetzt. Aber die Details und das Drumherum sind irgendwie nicht stimmig. So sind die KÃ¤mpfe z.B. durch den Zufallsfaktor manchmal recht schwierig und erst im zweiten Anlauf zu meistern. Aber womit wird der Sieg belohnt? Das Gold reicht kaum um sich auch nur einen Heiltrank zu kaufen und die eroberten GegenstÃ¤nde sind fast immer der gleiche Schrott. Und was tun mit der Erfahrung? Jetzt mit 50 bis 500 Punkten eine der mehr als 50 FÃ¤higkeiten, Zauber oder Talente um einen Punkt steigern um ..., ja um was Ã¼berhaupt dadurch zu erreichen? Ah, eine neue RÃ¼stung, bei der sind 2 von 10 Eigenschaften besser und nur eine schlechter als vorher..., ist die jetzt eigentlich wirklich gut?
Zusammengefasst, das Spiel belohnt den geneigten Spieler kaum und konfrontiert ihn stattdessen mit einem unÃ¼bersichtlichen Zahlensystem, dessen tatsÃ¤chlicher Nutzen dem verwÃ¶hnten Spieler von heute weitgehend verschlossen bleibt. Insbesondere beim Ausbilden der Charaktere weis man eigentlich kaum, was man dort tut und was dies am Ende bewirkt.
Wer sich fÃ¼r Rollenspiele interessiert, kann gerne mal im Sale zuschlagen, aber fÃ¼r den Vollpreis kann ich das Spiel nicht empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026461830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 2855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 888, 'last_played': 1536777667}
review:
This is a game for the hardcore.  I got Blackguards 1 & 2 for $11 on sale; I wouldn't buy it before because of the mixed reviews.

It's basically like old school King's Bounty but better.  I'm only 10 hours in, but it feels like 20, which is a good sign.  I love the customization of the character and I am annihilating shit on normal, though I've read that the game is extremely hard.  Maybe I am just hardcore.

If you like a challenge and are willing to reload, get this game.  I can't reccomend it at full price; I would never risk $40 on a game with 60% positive reviews.  If it's $8 or less, go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008455392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1440961899}
review:
I've been playing rpgs since before Baulders Gate.  I saw this title on sale for 3.99 so I thought well how bad could it be? Well, bad, really bad.  If I had paid full price I'm not sure what i'd have done.  Save your 4$ and get a coffe or something.

Graphics are fine, no ability to rotate map to get a better view,  menus are just meh, loot drops are trivial, there are not enough quests available to prepare the characters for extended fight with multiple times the number of higher lvl npc's, animations severly interrupt the flow of the game, just all around annoyance.  

It looks like a deal but save yourself the trouble.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117901261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 3126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2384, 'last_played': 1511017329}
review: An entertaining turn based strategy. The plot is not very deep, still it is meaningful. Dialogues are ok. What I liked most was the fact that you can interact with the environmet - it can have nagtive effects on you and your enemies which you can turn to your advantage. Another good thing is that there is sometimes more than one way to win a battle and that seems to affect the plot at times.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986504785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3460, 'last_played': 1399353830}
review: The game was great, the QA for the game was not. Ran into a number of issues that got me stuck because of glitches.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981176523', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 950, 'last_played': 1440891221}
review: Blackguards was released over a year and a half ago and it STILL hasn't worked out all the bugs (First series of lizard fights, I could take out the first crystal with melee or ranged, but the second crystal doesn't allow a ranged OR magic attack, only melee. Either way you look at it, there's a bug in there), a sequel has been released before the first one was balanced correctly (apparently a foot of water has a 75% chance of knocking over someone walking through it - total bullsh!t), and the devs didn't fix NUMEROUS complaints that I've read about on forums (You have a fixed AP pool as you play the game, if you pick the wrong skills to level then you literally and I do mean literally F yourself right into a corner and are completely unable to recover unless you want to start over. Random battles on already-completed maps would be an easy fix for this but apparently the coding team is too lazy to put in the work to make it happen)......I'm glad I got this game for 4 bucks and waited for the sale. I won't make that same mistake on the sequel. Uninstalled. I had high hopes for this game but when the devs don't fix problems and the game clearly has balancing issues, there's no way I'm going to waste more time and effort trying to play it or bothering with a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978337815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 2261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2261, 'last_played': 1429661622}
review: Wow.  This game is 3.99 right now. If you like turn based combat it's definitely worth a shot.  The character progression and how to build your character properly is a bit different from the norm, but half way through the game I was at the point where I was seriously considering restarting just to focus my builds a bit more. Aside from that though, the game can be quite challenging and will take up a good chunk of time, so you will surely get your monies worth.

- An einer Stelle verlor ich fast meine komplette AusrÃ¼stung und Gold (Dukaten). Ich weiss nicht wieso. Bug?

- Die KÃ¤mpfe sind unfair, meist hat man es mit  anzahlmÃ¤ssig mehr Gegner zu tun, als man selbst Partymembers hat. Ausserdem werden die Gegner bevorzugt, zB durch einen Heilkristall, der alle Gegner pro Runde komplett hochheilt!
- Manche Gegenden kann man gar nicht komplett erforschen, weil man sich auf einmal vorher schon wieder in einem GesprÃ¤ch befindet, plÃ¶tzlich und unerwartet. Im Anschluss findet man sich total woanders wieder und kommt nicht mehr zurÃ¼ck.
- Die KampfschauplÃ¤tze sind unÃ¼bersichtlich, manchmal kann man gar nicht jedes Feld sehen bzw. anklicken.
- Wenn ich auf einen Gegner klicke, um ihn anzugreifen, muss ich manchmal Ã¼ber 10x klicken, bevor der Angriffsbefehl endlich ausgefÃ¼hrt wird.
- Die Magie ist praktisch wertlos. Man verbraucht sehr viel Mana (AP) im Vergleich zu dem Schaden, der bei einem Kampfspell rauskommt. LÃ¤cherlich! Da macht ein ganz normaler KnÃ¼ppel mehr Schaden und verbraucht nichtmal Mana.

KEINE SPIELEMPFEHLUNG!

author: {'steamid': '76561198063389004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 4323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4323, 'last_played': 1440712291}
review:
Very oldschool-ish RPG with turn-based fights, rich dialogues and wide character advancement options.
Pros:
1. RNG (it makes the fights so challenging)
2. Dialogues with humor and consequences
3. Rather advanced character development system with lots of attributes, talents and special skills
4. Plot twists
Cons:
1. RNG (when it stops being fun it becomes so annoying you will sometimes hate it)
2. Not so many useful spells
3. Crappy loot system (traders don't refresh their inventories, lots of similar useless weapons, limited ammunition supply, mage armor almost non-existent)
4. Buggy achievements
Still highly recommended to any RPG fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995253696', 'num_games_owned': 836, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1485, 'last_played': 1440360065}
review:
The game starts off well enough but I eventually had to quit.  I was getting so frustrated I nearly threw my mouse through my monitor.  Blackguards is presented as a game returning to the core roots of RPG strategy goodness.  Just check out the multiple videos from Daedalic above for all the stuff that sounds so great about this game.  What is presented sounded awesome to me but in reality my two attempts through the game turned into a frustrating slog from one scenario to the next.  

I got hooked on the story from the start which turned out to be a prison break.  Nothing ground-shakingly new here but it worked for bringing three main characters together and launching them off on what was to be a quest to save the world.  The cut-scene interactions just propel the story forward, but did contain some humorous dialogue.  City/settlement locations are really just screens you click on to visit the tavern/shop/quest giver, etc.  Again, nothing earth-shattering for the genre but where this game was supposed to shine was in the combat.

And the combat on many of the levels was excellent.  Some of the scenarios were very challenging and I truly felt good when I had achieved victory conditions.  You certainly cannot simply build up your characters and then rush through everything.  Planning was necessary.   All that was great.

Specific building of your characters is crucial to the point that if you build them wrong, you will find that the difficulty spikes.  Character building is handled through allocating skill points.  There are a lot of options (FIVE screens worth) and very little in-game guidance on what to build up first.  I am sure most players will do what I did and end up resorting to the forums and walkthroughs to know how best to maximize their points.  It should not be this difficult or nebulous on building up your characters - especially with this many options.  The game reminds you to save often so you can go back to an earlier time and rebuild if needed.  But that still stings a little knowing that you lost that progress and will need to make it up.

But then the game started throwing out some curve balls on the scenarios and I found myself needing to restart certain ones again and again.  These levels were often fronted by a cut-scene dialogue that had to be clicked through again and again.  I just do not understand why they couldn't simply start the level with your characters on the field.  Many of these levels had special rules or situations that were not made apparent until you played them.  So you learned the "special" rules through failing at the level and had to try again.  And again.  And again.  

It does not help when the game chains scenarios together without a way to rest in-between.  You may find that by the end of the 2nd or 3rd scenario you are completely out of potions/health/magic/whatever.  And you may need to not only restart that level, but perhaps go back to a prior level so that you end with enough health/magic to be successful in the next one.  I could see the game doing this on hardcore difficulty for those who really enjoy upping the difficulty, but I just wanted to veg out after a hard day at work.  

By the time I was into the gladiator fights in chapter 2 I realized something.  The. Game. Was. No. Fun. 

I am recommending a pass on this one.  If you do buy it, wait for a nice Steam or bundle sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140365370', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 5000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2180, 'last_played': 1569862313}
review:
Basato su "The Dark Eye", Blackguards rappresenta una sorta di esperimento per i ragazzi di Daedalic Entertainment ben noti per le loro avventure grafiche, esperimento che chiarisco fin da subito risulta riuscito anche se il gioco non Ã¨ adatto a tutti a causa di una meccanica di gioco un po' atipica.

Senza svelare nulla sulla trama chiarisco fin da subito che i cosidetti "cattivi protagonisti" non sono poi quel gruppo di degenerati che si puÃ² pensare ma risultano piÃ¹ che altro un branco di disperati che tra intrighi e misteri decidono di collaborare tra loro; non mancano situazioni tragiche ma anche umoristiche che perÃ² lasciano spesso il tempo che trovano.
La trama in sÃ¨ non Ã¨ all'ultimo grido ma subisce un'evoluzione e tutto sommato invoglia a proseguire, alternando persino qualche flashback e approfondendo alcuni aspetti dei compagni di gioco, a patto perÃ² di dedicarsi ad alcune quest secondarie.

Graficamente il gioco risulta curato nelle ambientazioni ma non nei personaggi che appaiono come se fossero di una generazione precedente.
Personalmente ho apprezzato la scelta di disersificare le icone di alcuni nemici (per esempio tra gli scheletri c'Ã¨ nÃ¨ uno con la benda, altri hanno espressioni diverse e via dicendo) durante le battaglie, perÃ² il tutto si poteva applicare direttamente anche ai modelli dei personaggi.
Il gioco nonostante la natura strategica si adatta molto bene anche alla modalitÃ  Big Picture, a patto perÃ² di usare la risoluzione 1920X1080.
Nonostante le apparenze il gioco non Ã¨ propriamente digeribile per l'hardware moderno e puÃ² capitare qualche leggero calo di framerate sopratutto durante l'esecuzione degli attacchi magici di livello 4.

Riguardo al sonoro Ã¨ buono il doppiaggio (esclusivamente in inglese) dei personaggi mentre la colonna sonora risulta tutto sommato orecchiabile anche se difficilmente sarÃ  ricordata al termine del gioco.

La giocabilitÃ  Ã¨ affidata quasi esclusivamente al mouse con qualche scorciatoia a livello di tastiera, fortunatamente viene in aiuto il tutorial iniziale che aiuta a comprendere le meccaniche di base anche se la maggior parte delle battaglie richiede piÃ¹ l'astuzia (in particolare interagendo con gli elementi di sfondo) e la magia rispetto alla forza bruta. 
In Blackguards non esiste il "farming" e le battaglie spesso danno un numero di punti esperienza esiguo rispetto alle stesse, diventa cosÃ¬ importante distribuire i punti esperienza piÃ¹ verso le abilitÃ  che riguardano magia e attacchi a distanza piuttosto che al resto e sopratutto diventa fondamentale fare affidamento sugli istruttori (ce ne sono in tutte le cittÃ  principali).

La longevitÃ  di Blackguards Ã¨ sicuramente buona, ho impiegato piÃ¹ di 36 ore per completare la modalitÃ  storia al livello di difficoltÃ  normale dedicandomi anche a diverse quest secondarie, tuttavia penso che la maggior parte delle battaglie (che poi sono il fulcro del gioco) siano state eccessivamente lunghe e che probabilmente si poteva strutturare meglio il gioco, ad esempio l'inserimento di qualche minigioco (magari come tributo agli altri titoli di Daedalic) avrebbe allentato la presa e spezzato il ritmo.

In conclusione questo Blackguards Ã¨ un titolo di buona fattura, un po' punitivo ma anche appagante e tutto sommato persino divertente, qui su Steam Ã¨ ancora troppo caro ma la versione retail si trova intorno ai 10 euro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056095914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 847, 'last_played': 1440160647}
review:
So I've recently started Blackguards, and despite initially feeling a bit iffy on whether or not I would like it, I can say I've been pleasantly surprised. The plot line is good, with enough mystery to leave you wondering at what's happened (alongside the protagonist, who can be either male or female, and is voiced appropriately) and what's going to happen next. 

I haven't quite finished the game yet, but would recommend it to anyone. The characters are vibrant, each with their own personalities and quirks, and the battles are satisyfingly challenging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089299679', 'num_games_owned': 7216, 'num_reviews': 392, 'playtime_forever': 3671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3671, 'last_played': 1439348918}
review:
Well.. you know  when you watch TV and see the that really Juicy Burger in the commercial? Well. They actually use plastic burger with special lighting and a lot photo editing to create such an effect. When you actually go to that fast food and order the same burger it's quite different and the taste is no where near as good as you imaginged when you see it on TV.

This game is like that burger in the TV commercial.. 
Graphic is great, Sound is great and packaging and concept is awesome.

But when you actually play it it's like a Plastic burger that you will have a lot problem to chew on and it taste bad.

First.. The Story is Linear with supposed plot twist but it's quite badly rewriten with a lot things unexplained.
Second.. The Game combat mecanism is following a old DND3 type dice/board game. Which they did a good job translate into a PC game but it just doesn't work out.. Repetitive and uninteresting.
Third.. each battle map suppose give you options on how to finish the each map solution seems very linear and easy to guess. Each battle may have different enemy but they don't feell unique when i see a different one.
Fourth.. The Game difficulty is super hard. I am a DND vetern and studied quite abit of that dice game before i started and I have a tons of difficulty finish the game.
Fifth.. the game interface is not well designed and hard to operate.
Six:.. there are about 7 Achievements broken at the moment and from what i heard in the forum the developer is not gonna fix them.

Unless you are a die hard Dice game fan i wouldn't recommend anyone trying this.
4.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013731775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1922, 'last_played': 1439558125}
review:
I can not recommend this game. Even if it is purchased on offer.
I really wanted to like this game, as both the type of game and the developer, usually is something I love.
Daedalic Entertainment is usually  quality in my eyes.

Pros ..
Okay history
Okay voise acting
Great XP system
Nice skill tree
Difficult game, even at the lowest level, it is a struggle.

Cons ...
Very linear history
Unimportant person gallery
Monotonous in length
Mediocre graphics, but had the rest of the game worked, it had not had any impact
Too few weapons and equipment
Difficult game, even at the lowest level, it is a struggle.
Very small world
Messy quest log

author: {'steamid': '76561197970329288', 'num_games_owned': 2781, 'num_reviews': 1449, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1434312513}
review:
A non-biased quick look @ the game:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TrU3b1p3oQ8

What happens when the only hope of a threatened world lies not with heroes in shining armor, but in the hands of a band of misfits and criminals? Blackguards, a new turn-based strategy RPG, explores this very question. You will discover over 180 unique hex-based battlegrounds within a dark and mature story of crime, drugs, and murder. 

Play as a warrior, mage or hunter and customize your character's skills as you see fit. The challenging campaign delivers a story of doubt, treason and loss. You decide the course of the story at key turning points and determine its outcome. - Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198012782759', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1546, 'last_played': 1437914845}
review:
This game is all about luck. No matter what you do, prepare to reload plenty of time because because you missed at a critical time. Or just missed your 95% chance serval times in a row while your enemys crit you and stack up those wounds on you.

This game oes many things right, I like the story and presentations. The characters and their interaction are fun but it all comes to naught because it utterly fails at the most important point: the combat.

I guess everyone that has fun with slot machines would like this game, everyone else shouls stay away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003232053', 'num_games_owned': 2189, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1437312641}
review:
My interest in Blackguards didn't last long, for 2 reasons.

1. Character development seems to offer very many options, but barely appeals me. Other games manage to motivate by  meaningful and game changing new upgrades, I don't see that in Blackguard. Or it is too well hidden among dozens of minor options.

2. The UI is terrible. No further describtion required.
