author: {'steamid': '76561198048668185', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2233, 'last_played': 1437193711}
review: The game itself is not bad, however DONT buy it for $40. Got it myself for about $5 with the expansion I believe, and its a great game or $5-$10 bucks. Graphics arent bad and gameplay isnt terrible, however its definately not worth $40. Wait for it to hit a good sale, then buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063811135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 3810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3810, 'last_played': 1436338048}
review:
Dicen que de la vista nace el amor, bueno, en este juego no se aplica, a primera vista el juego cae gordo y a segunda, mÃ¡s gordo. Pero si le dedicas una tercera, vas a encontrarte con un gran juego. 

Es muy entretenido, con una historia muy bien desarrollada. Combates desafiantes pero gratificantes de superar. Personajes carismÃ¡ticos, enemigos despreciables y una ambientaciÃ³n hermosa.

Un punto negativo es el apartado tÃ©cnico, aunque en general me trabajo a 60 fps estables la mayor parte del tiempo, en algunos escenarios parece haber fugas de memoria inexplicables, igualmente cuando se activaban algunos hechizos el juego tartamudeaba. Pero por ser un juego de turnos, no afecta  mucho, aunque es molesto.

8/10 sin duda alguna.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989243295', 'num_games_owned': 893, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1435549404}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198005908329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 2765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 945, 'last_played': 1450122876}
review:
This game is brilliant from top to bottom. The characters are rich and fun, and they interact with eachothers and the world in entertaining ways. The story hooks you up from minute one and has you enthralled throughout the game. Combat is tactical-and-strategy-heavy, you have to put your head on every single one of them, and even so, they can still get merciless if you fuck up a single turn. I wholeheartedly recomend this game, If i would make a game, it would be exactly like this.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198078492616', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 9283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5000, 'last_played': 1439346537}
review:
If you are looking for a solid challenging turn-based tactical RPG, loving to prepare carefully before each battle, enjoying conquering seemly uncontrollable RNG madness, you probably will like Blackguards.

Otherwise, if you're not hardcore enough, you might will hate this game a lot due to its difficulty and unfriendliness against causal gamers. You have been warned.

Pros: 
storyline
soundtrack
spells
character development (mechanics)
depth of the combat system

Cons: 
lack of internal combat information or complete instruction (ingame)
intensive resources for smooth walkthrough
annoying inventory management
slow progressing
limited itemization
outdated visual comparing to modern games
enemy girls always have sexier protraits *lol*

author: {'steamid': '76561198006885910', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1915, 'last_played': 1435866923}

author: {'steamid': '76561198065545417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 8937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8508, 'last_played': 1410729108}
review:
**** (of 5)
As a big fan of the role playing game DSA, I would give it even five stars, but to be honest, at times the game can be a bit tiresome in its battles, because they take quite some time. Still the grafics and the story is good. I also like the turn-based battles and the variations in it. There are many ways how you can improve your character and you have to decide on what strength you want to focus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022514722', 'num_games_owned': 1078, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 2767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2767, 'last_played': 1437423733}
review:
NACHTRAG #1:
Ich habe nun den "Endkampf" gesehen ... oder eher ein Massaker. Ich weiÃŸ wirklich nicht was bei den Entwicklern "Einfach" bedeutet. Haben die das jeweils gespielt? Es gibt bisher in meinem Leben nur ein einziges Spiel, das mich mehr aufgeregt hat als das hier ... und Blackguards ist gerade dabei die #1 zu werden.

Ich bin Magier, Buffe meine Leute. Aurelia ist tot, weil ich von den 12(?) PrÃ¼fungen nur ein einziges Mal einen Fehler gemacht habe. Wow ... wozu dann sich bei den anderen 11 Ã¼berhaupt noch anstrengen?

Also KÃ¤mpfen wir zu 4 gegen endlose Massen an Gegnern. Die Zauberer werden dauernd niedergeworfen, sodass man keine Zeit fÃ¼r Buffs irgendeiner Art hat. Sobald die es dann schaffen mal nicht niedergeworfen zu werden ... tja ... dann sind die schon so am Arsch, dass sie nur noch sich selbst heilen dÃ¼rfen.

Meine Leute werden durch gegnerische Buffs geschwÃ¤cht, sodass ich permanent gerade mal 40% Treffsicherheit habe. Das macht wirklich 0 SpaÃŸ. Taktische Herausforderun? Ich weiÃŸ nicht ... wenn man nicht ein mal zum Zug kommt ... da kann man noch so viel taktieren versuchen.

Ach ja ... was mich auch tierisch aufgeregt hat war, als ich mit Befreiungsschlag die Massen niederknÃ¼ppeln wollte ... 5 Runden hintereinander ... 3 Gegner gleichzeitig ... 95% Treffsicherheit ... kein einziges Mal getroffen.

Ich weiÃŸ nicht, ob ich das Spiel mit diesen Settings Ã¼berhaupt noch schaffen kann. Ich habe es jetzt mehrmals probiert ... aber in der letzten Runde gegen Urias habe ich keinerlei Chance auch nur einen verdammten Zug zu machen. Nur Naurim hÃ¤lt es einigermaÃŸen aus ... trifft aber nichts, ist geblitzt, vergiftet etc.. Ich habe Antidots, HeiltrÃ¤nke (+500) etc. mit ... aber das ist innerhlab 3 Runden aufgebraucht ... Alternative: Tod.

Ich bleibe dabei ... das Spiel ist nicht gebalanced. Wenn man einen auf Heiler macht und nicht weiÃŸ, dass spÃ¤ter Aurelia ins Team stÃ¶ÃŸt und ebenfalls zaubern kann ... dann hat man am Ende so viel ScheiÃŸe geskillt. Dabei habe ich mich sogar noch beherrschen kÃ¶nnen und die Heldenpunkte(?) gesammelt ... ich hatte Ã¼ber 8000, die ich dann entsprechend geskillt hatte. Killermagier, Buffmagier, Naurim der Tank und Takata, der SpeerkÃ¤mpfer. Alles hat Sinn gemacht, reicht aber wohl nicht. Ach ja ... Talente etc. habe ich natÃ¼rlich auch "gut" geskillt ... 

Eventuell wÃ¼rde ich es neu starten und einen anderen Weg ausprobieren. Ich habe keinen einzigen FernkÃ¤mpfer ... dachte in der Mitte des Spiels, dass Niam zum Team gehÃ¶rt und da bleiben wÃ¼rde ... tja. Takata und Naurim als FernkÃ¤mpfer? Ne.

NACHTRAG #2:
Also ... ich habe einen uralten Spielstand geladen und habe mich bis zum Endboss durchgeschlagen ... Ã¼berraschenderweise, wenn man weiÃŸ wie gespielt wird, wird es wesentlich einfacher. Man kennt die Tricks und man benutzt eventuell Zauber, die man normalerweise nicht nutzen wÃ¼rde in iwelchen anderen Games.

Unterm Strich wÃ¼rde ich sagen, dass man das Spiel doch empfehlen kann ... aber nur fÃ¼r < 10â‚¬ und nur fÃ¼r Leute, die sich trotz Rage dazu entschlieÃŸen kÃ¶nnen ein Spiel bis zum Ende durchzuspielen. Manchmal bewirkt eine lÃ¤ngere Pause Wunder.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138282847', 'num_games_owned': 22, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1434972733}
review: Lange ist es her, dass ich mal Das Schwarze Auge als Pen & Paper Spiel gemacht habe und fÃ¼hle mich hier im Spiel schon sehr stark daran erinnert. So viele Einstellungs- und EntwicklungsmÃ¶glichkeiten fÃ¼r den eigenen Charakter und dessen Begleiter sind am Anfang schon sehr Ã¼berwÃ¤ltigend. Die Tutorial ErklÃ¤rungen helfen aber auf jeden Fall schon mal sehr gut durch die ersten Begegnungen. Mal gespannt, was mir im Laufe der Zeit im Spiel noch so alles Ã¼bern Weg lÃ¤uft bzw. was fÃ¼r Abenteuer bestanden werden wollen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044768454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1147, 'last_played': 1437661038}
review:
They said it was hard. They said it was rough. My advice is: watch a couple basic-tutorial-videos on youtube to know what the hell you are doing with the AP system. If you understand that, you'll have real blast. Without giving anything away, the whole Mengbila bit is great! I mean, the sort of thing they throw at you is.... And the finale of that... 
Bottom line: take a bit of time to learn how the game works, choose the character creation expert mode, especialize your characters and have fun. Great purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045377291', 'num_games_owned': 1676, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1434872021}
review:
Typical CRPG with nothing really new but if anything that redeems it from that is one thing, one name, one dwarf...Naurim. He is by far the only character that keeps you playing because he is a master dwarf with a suspicious aggression for everything. The words that pour from his godly beard shatter everyone in a 100 meter radius.  

Hero - "Why did you burn down a tavern?"
Naurim - "Because the tavern had dragon in it's name, and I hate dragons"

420/10 Blaze that Tavern Naurim with your mystical beard, you are a god! Step aside Gimli you bitch, Nauim is the top dwarf now son.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000717877', 'num_games_owned': 1055, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1434937398}
review: A piece of shite.  DON'T BUY THIS GAME !!!!!!!!  This is the German idea of balanced gameplay!?!?  Continual misses by your characters (at 92%!!!!!) but the enemy will hit you, for two or three times your damage, at 45%!!!  WTF !?!?!?!?!?  Dead-alic.........we're done with you.  You couldn't program your way out of a wet paper bag.  It takes a helluva lot more than some pretty sprites to make a worthy adventure game.  And the notion that because this takes place in the Dark Eye somehow justifies this travesty of computer coding.  You're fifteen years to the party too late, and you STILL can't hold a candle to classics like Baldur's Gate.  That's SAD, SAD, SLOPPY CODING.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075640662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2440, 'last_played': 1459358361}
review:
Wo habe ich mich da nur reingeritten...
Jeder der wenigstens einmal in seinem Leben ein Pen & Paper Rollenspiel wie "Das Schwarze Auge" (DSA) gespielt hat, kennt vermutlich diese Situation... 
DSA Blackguards greift das wohl populÃ¤rste Rollenspielsystem nach "Dungeons & Dragons" auf und verfrachtet es in eine Rundenbasierendes Real-Time Strategie Spiel...

Konkret bedeutet das, man verfÃ¼gt Ã¼ber 3 - 5 Heldenfiguren, die man auf einem Schachbrett Ã¤hnlichen Spielfeld zu unterschiedlichen Bedingungen herum schickt. 
In der Regel bedeutet hier die Hauptaufgabe: Besiege alle Gegner.
Hierzu stehen den einzelnen Helden wiederum SpezialfÃ¤higkeiten zur VerfÃ¼gung.

Im Fall von DSA Blackguards wird zusÃ¤tzlich der Rollenspielfaktor des Originals dazu gemischt. Man kann innerhalb einer Welt agieren, muss sich durch KÃ¤mpfe und Aufgaben "Abenteuerpunkte" (APs) verdienen, mit denen man sich dann bei Lehrmeistern wieder neue SpezialfÃ¤higkeiten kaufen kann.
DarÃ¼ber hinaus, muss man seinen Charackter verbessern/ skillen. Auch das geschieht Ã¼ber APs, und natÃ¼rlich kann eine bessere Waffe und eine bessere RÃ¼stung auch nicht schaden. Diese kosten allerdings Gold in Form von Dukaten ;), die man ebenfalls durch die Absolvierung von Quests erhÃ¤lt.

Was braucht ein gutes Rollenspiel noch auÃŸer dem Spielprinzip? Genau, eine fesselnde Story!
Diese ist auch sehr gut gelungen, wie ich finde. (Ohne zu viel zu Spoilern)
Der tragische Held wacht eines Morgens auf und sitzt im GefÃ¤ngnis, aus GrÃ¼nden, die er wegen einer Amnesie nicht erklÃ¤ren kann. Bei einem Ausbruchversuch, gabelt er zwei neue Freunde auf, einen knorzigen Zwerg und einen schwerenÃ¶tigen Magier. Auf ihrer Suche nach den Antworten des Haupthelden gabeln sie weitere Mitstreiter auf, darunter auch Bekannte aus der Vergangenheit des Helden, verlieren einige Freunde, nehmen Rache und stellen schlieÃŸlich fest, das der eigentliche BÃ¶se gar nicht der BÃ¶se war, sondern das der wahre Feind eigentlich der ist, dem man am meisten vertraut hatte. 

An sich ein solides Konzept, mit den Ã¼blichen StÃ¤rken und SchwÃ¤chen.
Hat man sich verskillt, so hat man am Ende ganz schÃ¶ne Probleme. Oder man reagiert nicht rechtzeitig auf eine bestimmte Situation und verliert einen Helden.
Wer an diesen Dingen aber SpaÃŸ findet, kann Blackguards beruhigt einkaufen. :)

Allerdings werden Achievement-JÃ¤ger mit Blackguards keine Freude haben, da viele der begehrten Auszeichnungen aus irgendwelchen GrÃ¼nden noch verbuggt sind und egal wie oft man die Bedingung erfÃ¼llt nicht freigeschaltet werden.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031144522', 'num_games_owned': 820, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 3591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2388, 'last_played': 1436674350}
review:
Habituellement pas fan des jeux en tour par tour, celui-ci a rÃ©ussi Ã  me combler dÃ¨s la prise en main (crÃ©ation du personnage). 

Il est possible d'optimiser son personnage avec les classiques arbres de talents, mais, malgrÃ© le fait qu'ils soient trÃ¨s complets et vous offrant un nombre de sorts/capacitÃ©s trÃ¨s intÃ©ressants (bien sur, vous ne pourrez pas tout maxer sur le mÃªme personnage !) cela ne s'arrÃªte pas la du tout. 

Au fil des combats, votre personnage et les acolytes qui l'accompagne au fil de l'histoire voient leurs points d'expÃ©rience transformÃ©s en points d'aptitudes, servant Ã  remplir les dit talents dans 5 arbres distincts. 
Les caractÃ©ristiques, diverses rÃ©sistances/forces, vie, mana, rapiditÃ©, puissance en mÃ©lÃ©e ou en magie ou Ã  distance, toucher...
Les compÃ©tences d'armes.
Des aptitudes, gÃ©nÃ©ralement passives comme de la dÃ©tection de piÃ¨ges, de magie, des bonus de rapiditÃ© suivant le mileu, rÃ©sistances aux renversements/dÃ©cors...
Les sorts.
Les aptitudes spÃ©ciales pour dÃ©bloquer de nouvelles armures, en rÃ©duire les effets nÃ©gatifs (perte de rapiditÃ© avec les armures lourdes), plus de portÃ©e sur vos sorts, en agrandir les zones d'effets ou dÃ©bloquer de nouvelles capacitÃ©s pour les mÃ©lÃ©es qui n'ont pas accÃ¨s Ã  la branche des sorts). 

Vous aurez donc Ã  gÃ©rer, hors combat, tous les points de vos personnages afin d'avoir une Ã©quipe solide.

Pour ce qui est du systÃ¨me de combat, j'ai apprÃ©ciÃ© le fait de la rapiditÃ© (ou non) appellÃ©e initiative.
Les personnages (alliÃ©s/ennemis) que vous controlez ou non n'obtiennent pas leur tour tous en mÃªme temps mais en fonction de leur initiative. 
Il est possible de joueur en "deux temps", si vous effectuez un petit dÃ©placement, laisse le tour continuer, votre personnage pourra agir ensuite si vous ne vous Ãªtes pas dÃ©placez trop loin. 

Les maps sont trÃ¨s variÃ©es, avec gÃ©nÃ©ralement des Ã©lÃ©ments de dÃ©cors interactifs (passif, quand on marche dessus par exemple ou pour se mettre Ã  couvert mais aussi actif pour inverser le cours du combat). 
Les effets de zones, qu'ils viennent d'un alliÃ© ou du dÃ©cor, se rÃ©percutent aussi sur les membres de votre groupe.

Le seul petit point nÃ©gatif que j'ai pu relever est les chances de rater qui sont assez importantes.
MalgrÃ© la possibilitÃ© d'amÃ©liorer votre toucher, vous pouvez trÃ¨s bien rater trois fois de suite une techniques/sorts/tir qui a 65% de chance de toucher, juste parceque vous avez la lose.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047121179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1773, 'last_played': 1407262916}
review: Blackgaurds is not a masterpiece, no. I have read many reviews over it and most seem to want a perfect game for one that is from $5 - $10 when on sale or not, and it is definetly worth that. TBS based battles are very challenging and saving often is your best friend. Game throws strong challenges at you as you progress through the story and believe me, the fights are just win-able. If your looking for a interesting take on a story done a thousand times, and a good challenge, this is your game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010429902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1328, 'last_played': 1434684168}
review: I remember playing this awesome game on the Xbox called Gladius... I've never played a tactical RPG as good as that was before or since. I wished Blackguards could be more but it's a pale shadow of everything. Taking a band of misfits and leading them to be the heroes of the land... squandered. Moral dilemmas? nope. Relentless brain numbing combat, buckets and buckets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047384882', 'num_games_owned': 4838, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 4255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4091, 'last_played': 1434238325}
review:
Decent turn based tactical game. Tends to get somewhat repetitive over time, and suffers somewhat from the inherent weaknesses inherited from the Dark Eye game system and background. It also lacks somewhat a real feeling of character advancement - after playing a decent amount of matches you feel barely much "better" than in the bginning: the character have little more HP, the weapons do little more damage, etc. 

Full price I'd say it's not worth it, but on a sale it's a nice game to sink some hours into - if you like turn based fantasy tacticals, that is.

I still prefer the "old" stuff like Icewind Dale or Baldurs Gate for turn based combat, though, or the non-fantasy new ones like Shadowrun - which has both better system, and better plot. One thing I didn't really like was the chained battles - in the later part of the game you can have two or three battles chained after one another, without any opportunity to rest & recover, or even to reload bolts & arrows or potions & poisons. 

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198084763151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 5265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5255, 'last_played': 1428271459}
review:
Tactically Reallistic 
its hard to say its good, its also hard to say its bad, so i'll give you both.

The Good
- Battle system is good.
- The Storyline is great.
- Limited sidequest available.
- Weapons & spells are extremely unique (only when you upgrade spells & weapon skills).
- You can use environmental traps.
- Battle skills & abilities are real great & useful.

The Bad
- This game is so reallistic that when you buy too many items & weapons pass your limit, it'll cause your characters to do negatively poor in combat (depends on the weight of items).
- If your not well prepared before events or battles, you'll have a tough time trying to complete that scenario.

my overall, if you are a person of poor judgement, don't buy this game
if you love Strategy/RPG type games, then this game is for you......

I give this game a 9 out of 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198012111055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1434234091}
review:
Otra vez echo de menos el botÃ³n 'Neutral' para clasificar un juego en Steam. 

Â¿Es Blackguards un mal juego? No. Â¿Lo recomiendo? Pues tampoco. 

Me explico un poco. Blackguards sigue el reglamento de un juego de rol alemÃ¡n llamado 'Dark Eye'. Por lo tanto hereda para el combate sus virtudes y defectos. Y para mÃ­ ese reglamento tiene mÃ¡s defectos que virtudes por lo que he visto. Encima el juego no te da casi pistas de para que valen las puntuaciones de las hojas de personaje asÃ­ que andarÃ¡s mÃ¡s perdido que un pulpo en un garaje al principio. Dicen por ahÃ­ que cuando llevas bastantes horas empiezas a enterarte y entonces el juego mola. Yo le he dedicado bastantes y creo que sÃ© por donde van los tiros pero... sigue sin molarme. En el Baldur's Gate (por poner un ejemplo comparativo) tambiÃ©n usaban al dedillo el reglamento del juego de mesa (en ese caso AD&D) pero yo creo que explicaban bastante mejor el funcionamiento bÃ¡sico del combate en el videojuego.

Una cosa que me ha fastidiado hasta abandonar el juego es que aparte de tu tasa de ataque los combatientes tienen una habilidad de defensa. Entonces tÃº te enfrentas a un bicho y dices: vaya, tengo un 70% de posibilidades de darle, a por Ã©l. Y sÃ­, le das... pero como Ã©l esquiva ya no le das. Hala. A fastidiarse. Por eso muchas veces estarÃ¡s pegÃ¡ndote piÃ±os con gente sin que nadie llegue a acertar a nadie. SÃ­ que es cierto que se aplica a ambos bandos y que sÃ³lo se puede esquivar a un oponente por asalto, pero como normalmente el que estÃ¡ superado en nÃºmero es el grupo del jugador la cosa queda bastante descompensada. AdemÃ¡s esto hace que el combate sea impredecible y, para mÃ­, pierda muchos puntos de estrategia.

AdemÃ¡s como digo los desarrolladores no se han esforzado demasiado en explicar para que vale cada cosa por lo que cuando empiezas a jugar vas subiendo de nivel sin saber demasiado bien que te conviene subir o que no. En mi caso lo dejÃ© cuando me metÃ­ en un combate en el que parece que era vital el mago y le fallaban todos los hechizos porque no pasaba una tirada de ConstituciÃ³n. Â¿Y yo como deberÃ­a haber adivinado eso? Si es tan importante Â¡que lo avisen de alguna manera a los novatos! 

Encima al principio empiezas con un equipo mÃ­nimo y, la verdad, cuesta bastante conseguir el oro suficiente como para no parecer un pordiosero y comprar algo con lo que zurrarle a los enemigos. Ahora ya sÃ© lo que sienten mis jugadores de rol en mesa cuando les racaneo objetos (sÃ­, lo tengo merecido, soy un director de juego rata). 

Y sin embargo y pese a todo Blackguards tiene suficiente encanto como para que haya perdido un montÃ³n de horas intentando dominar el juego. La historia, sin ser de echar tracas, estÃ¡ bien. El personaje del mago es muy carismÃ¡tico y el grupo lo forman un trÃ­o de inadaptados bastante simpÃ¡tico. Las conversaciones entre ellos son entretenidas. El sistema de combate, si no llega a tener la peste de las esquivas, serÃ­a bueno. Porque ademÃ¡s puedes usar el escenario a tu favor (se pueden accionar ciertos elementos en cada fase).

Hasta donde yo lleguÃ© en la campaÃ±a la cosa era bastante lineal. HabÃ­a algunas opciones secundarias pero vamos... que esto va de buscar una disculpa para cada combate.

Me queda un sabor agridulce al no poder recomendarlo pero, sinceramente, no me ha convencido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068398360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 4474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4341, 'last_played': 1429221749}
review:
How would you feel when you are unable to proceed because you do not have the required abilities to deal with the enemy?
You could say, tough luck, it is your own fault, because you made the wrong choices. 
And I grant you that. 

But how can I make the right choices when I do not know the strengths and weaknesses of these abilities? And how can I foresee that the story seriously impacts the functioning of my party?  At two moments in the game you will be inflicted with a setback that unhinges your party's fighting power. Once, one of the party members gets killed because the story is written that way. And at another time her replacement, a magic user, gets robbed of her ability to do magic and so thousands of points sunk in developing her magic powers becomes nullified with one stroke. 
So you might expect that the game takes this into account, but not at all: you cannot undo your choices nor does the game allow you to make up for the loss of a valuable party member.

This then, in a nutshell, is the problem with Blackguards.. 

This game is very much like searching for keys to doors, while you do not know which key opens which door, you do not know if a door leads to anything useful, you do not know when or if you will find the key or the door to which it belongs and you might find  that the keys and doors disappeared before you actually could make use of them. 
So what is left is to go back to an earlier point in the game and find the right keys to the right doors: make the right choices. And unfortunately you might have to go a long way back: perhaps all the way to the beginning.

And then another issue pops up.

Blackguards is  basically a tactical battle simulator in which the battles are linked together by a thin storyline that gives the battles context. You will find that many of the common characteristics of a roleplay game are underdeveloped. For one, your party members are a given and so are their classes. Do not expect that you can build your own party. 
Furthermore there are few choices in equipment so your party will be running around with the same armor and weapons for long stretches.  And while many places have shops, you will only visit them to restock your supplies. 
But the crucial issue is that the story is simply too linear. While at some point you can select what to do first, you will be unable to change the storyline in any significant way. And because the story isn't really special at all, redoing this game just so you can change your characters is not enough of an incentive to go through the game again..

Even as a tactical battle simulator the game leaves much to be desired. For instance you are unable to determine the setup of your party members. More often than not the game gleefully shoves your more vulnerable members, your magic users, in the front line.  Hilarious is the ability to set traps. You have almost no time to set traps, let alone set the traps that actually make  difference. The traps are expensive, the relevant skill requires a massive amount of points and you have only a very limited amount of traps.  
In addition some battles confront you with a special setup that is pivotal to the battle, often without explaining to you the specifics. In one battle, for instance, you will be able to make use of automated flamethrowers. But the game doesn't explain this to you, nor do you know what the impact is until you have seen their effect and you figured out how to operate them. It therefore requires you to redo the battle at least once.
Some battles are practically unwinnable until you achieve a certain level, or develop a certain ability to a certain level.

Is it all bad then?

Actually no.
When I went through the game the first time I actually was entertained. The game uses what I call the fall out principle. The fall out principle is that you start out as a nobody and then gradually start to make a difference when the story unfolds. This is the reverse of what you might call the dragon age effect in which  it is clear from the start that you are a special person destined to make a difference.
Personally I prefer the first angle to the last. 
Also the characters are amusing, even though, or perhaps because, they are so cliche. The remarks of the Naurim, the grumpy dwarf, are pretty funny and in line of what you might expect from a dwarf: a fighter who distrusts magic users and elves. 
The story, although linear, has a few twists and also there is some emotional connection as it involves a friend and later on a family member. It isn't also clearcut that the enemy is actually bad and it leaves things fuzzy  for a long time.
So it seems to me that if you go once through the game(using a game guide to form your party) then you might probably be entertained.



Verdict:
Blackguard is a nice filler when you are in between better games. Pick it up when it is in the bargain bin and around five dollars or euros or less.

(Note: steam doesn't allow for a meh score at the time of writing this review. This game most certainly belongs to this category. I gave it a thumbs up just because, when choosing between the negative and the positive, i prefer the latter).

author: {'steamid': '76561198019273313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1420063063}
review:
Starts solid, fizzles BAD later.

Balckguards is challenging tactical RPG great focus on tacital, the characters strenghts are based of of the skill points you allocate into different areas such as weapon profficancy and constitution, and to note you can only carry four items per character in battle that includes arrows.  Combat is the typical turn based Hex grid goto but this is when the game can be a pain, traps are invisible of course you can take an action to scan the area around you for them, BUT to scan furthur areas you must move another character into the area avoiding the traps that are reveal. Movement is crap, the Hex grid makes thing wonky and you end up having the character accidentally move through a trap, inflicting damage, possible status effects, and ending their turn. If you don't end up walking through a trap on your way to the empty space you will likely hit a trap that is still hidden. Also the  AI opponents know where the traps are so unless it plays stupid and tries to make it's way to a weakend ally it will almost never hit them.

I am saddend by this spike in difficulty but if you enjoy masocistic gaming feel free but other wise avoid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015731346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 3792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3476, 'last_played': 1433444410}
review:
Old school RPG with turn-based combat system, nice graphic and pretty fun dialogues. Quite an hard game with some harder difficulty-spike in some point but nothing exceeding. It's about 60 hours game .
Here i put some advice that i would have needed .

General advice:
- Let Naurim tank,he will tank everything on the earth. 
-Buffs,debuffs and almost all spell at level 4 hit the entire map. (for exemple u can buff your entire team or debuff their )
-check all spell teacher to get passives,mage are dumb cows without accuracy passive.
-at the beginning seems that all mage spell has low chance to hit,when you up em and get accuracy passive almost all abilities have 99% chance.
-heals are very important,get em at least al lvl 3 ,pretty nice to heal your wounds.
-CHECK THE ENVIRONMENT,it will always semplify battles.

Starter Class Advices:

first 50% of the game: 
-Normal attack damage class ,specifically 2 Handed weapon  or archer are insanely strong .
-Mages are nice but you've not lvl 4 spells and suffer cause of low mana. 
-hybrid is overpowered: get for example an archer + increased ranged damage buffs.( same for melee)

Other 50%
-Normal attack damage class are still strong,lot of hp,dodge,and damage. (melee weapons with poison are pretty nice)
-Mages now can annihilate an entire battle alone. Just with lvl4  flame spear ,evel 4 shield  and level 3 thunder globe.
-Archers with buffs are still overpowered.

Good luck and have fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198114632624', 'num_games_owned': 1541, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 1914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1125, 'last_played': 1434641834}
review:
Battles Galore! This game is really all about the battles. The story is just something to tie all the battles together. Read up a bit on what skills to buff up..  My tip is to train up on your own bow and arrow skills.

I ended up with some skills I bought earlier on, wasted. Cos someone else I pick up later will have it at a higher level.

Then some skills i thought will be useful, ending up crap. And there is no refunding of points. So good luck picking the right skills.

For all it's worth, this game is still worth a walk through, just for it's unique take on RPG you will not find elsewhere. (Probably during a sale)

author: {'steamid': '76561197960642462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2893, 'last_played': 1433118914}
review:
I am a big fan of RPGS in general and here my view point after finishing in hard difficulty :

PROS : 
1)You can Customize your chars a lot and its real, REAL REAL delight it reminds the good old rpg with lot of customizing.
2)Epic dialogues, the voices are awesome.
3) Real strategy, some battles are pretty hard. 
4) Unlike a LOT of games you dont have a lot of gold during the game so you got to be cautious with what you are doing with it.
5)Game is "quite" long, for exemple it took me 30 hours to finish pillars of eternity max difficulty where i needed 48h for this one.

CONS : 
1)Poison everywhere on the 2nd half of the game. (its pretty boring to have your mage cleansing poison and wasting turns/energy on this).
2)Piercing weapons are bad (you cant hit undead with it, and most of the important "items" you need to destroy are immune to piercing damages but it's pretty fine if you havent more than one char in the team using it).
3)Game is too linear though for me i appreciated (as i said dialogues are awesome). 

I would give it 15-16/20 grade. A fair good game while waiting for Torment Tides of Numenera.
Have fun with this good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030788488', 'num_games_owned': 744, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 4525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4505, 'last_played': 1440366475}
review:
[b][i]Blackguards[/i][/b] is a medieval fantasy turn-based tactical RPG based on the Dark Eye tabletop RPG. Framed and tortured by the one you called your friend, you make your escape with a few other prisoners, trying to find out the truth behind the accusations against you. This review takes into account the Untold Legends DLC.

[b]Pros[/b]: Nice game with enough mechanical depth to offer a variety of gameplay styles: rather than level-based progression, you spend adventure points on anything from attributes, weapon skills, spells and perks and determine exactly how specialized you become with your various talents. The story isn't of a great hero, but of someone who won't leave a mark on history, making your way in shady towns and accepting questionable quests, especially in the multiple side quests added by the [i]Untold Legend DLC[/i] where you must take stances on subjects such as slavery. Graphics are good enough for the genre, tactical maps are clean, most of which have interactive environment elements you might use against your foes if they don't use them against you. The game is sufficiently balanced, and even with the occasional difficulty spikes, you can jump right back in the last encounter to try things differently.

[b]Cons[/b]: Many will find the depth to be a bit too much, scrolling through 5 pages of skills and perks will make it hard to figure the best way to optimize your character. There is a limited variety of equipment, especially armor. The story is pretty linear and not all that complex. The odds of success aren't mushed, so 95% chance of success might still miss, multiple times, in a row, which will frustrate anyone who isn't used to rolling dices. The music is somber, and sucks life and excitement out of the game whenever you're not in a combat situation.

[b]Verdict[/b]: â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜†â˜† - It's up to you

This is an ok RPG. It is definitively ported directly from its tabletop RPG roots, which might feel very "meh" to the average gamer. I still recommend it, just make sure you also get the [i]Untold Legend DLC[/i], or you'll feel the game is short on side-quests.

â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”
[i][b]This was just my opinion.[/b]

If you found this review helpful, please consider giving it a thumbs up, and feel free to check out more of my (purely opinionated) [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/CJsOpinions/]reviews[/url].[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561197961264502', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 1799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1799, 'last_played': 1425025020}
review: You must think in this game to beat it decently. There are times where if you don't think through the battle, it feels like it's impossible to win. Also, start with weapons (at least one on any non mage) before you do all the fancy skills.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028351123', 'num_games_owned': 835, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5536, 'last_played': 1433054476}
review: First time I played this through, I got myself stuck in a position where it was impossible to proceed.  I'd just get wiped over and over again in the late game.  My first impression was that the game was broken.  It's not broken.  It's difficult, challenging, it assumes you know what you're doing from the very beginning of the game.  I read up on preferred magic spells and melee builds and then I went in for a second play through.  BOOM, my team kicks so much butt that even though I do a WTF! occasionally at the sometimes Xcom-like RNG, I'm still enjoying what Blackguards has to offer.  It's not like there's a lot of information on this game.  But one dude (vigomiller) on Gamefaq put together the most comprehensive guide to helping me understand how to succeed at this game and now I have to recommend both the game and the guide.

review: It's just okay, average in every conceivable way. Nothing incredible to see here, though the story is a bit interesting. There are better alternatives out there though, and you should stick to them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152804177', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2431, 'last_played': 1431558075}
review:
I would first like to pre-face this review by saying that I bought this Deluxe version and Blackguards 2 as part of the Daedalic bundle for Â£9.99, making each game in effect worth Â£4.99 to me. Based on this price I think Blackguards is definitely worth it. The full price of Â£29.99 is however WAY off the mark for the amount of game you get (hint: not much) 

Despite me finishing the game in 40 hours, it is a very combat focused where pretty much every event youâ€™ll encounter will be a fight. Whilst this is fun to begin with, as a lot of battle maps are quite interesting, after 20 odd hours it just got tiresome. After every cut scene, conversation, exploration, etc I knew I would be fighting something. So you can imagine my utter delight when after defeating the final boss, the final cut-scene was just that a cut-scene!

Outside of combat there is unfortunately very little to the game, hence I only recommend it at a steep discount. There is no exploration to speak off, the town screens are static and the story kind of gets lots amongst 180 fight scenes youâ€™ll have to slog through. 

I also have a few gripes about the story, but these could just be personal preferences. For example, I donâ€™t see how this is a â€œdarkâ€ story as it seems very much like any other RPG where you-are-our-only-hope-to-save-the-world story (spoiler: you save it). Also this games is called Blackguards and makes the point of your character being an outlaw. I was picturing more of a vagabond, a mercenary on the run, or some petty thief down and on his luck. What I wasnâ€™t expecting however was for my character to be buddies with a PRINCES whilst chilling at a home of a COUNT in the first â€œmemoryâ€ cutscene. Less of a BlackGuard, more of a Brodude! Also in this game you have no meaningful choice â€“ it really just railroads you along the main story-line with some side-quests where you have a choice between killing guy A or guy B... with no impact on main story-line. 

A lot of negative reviews about this game are regarding the dodgy RNG, and whilst I have encountered some odd miss on a 95% chance, I have never experienced a 3 in a row miss. If you read the manual and understand how the rules work. The % you see isnâ€™t the % to inflict damage, but rather to do an action, then the enemy gets a couple of saving rolls â€“ parry / dodge. So you might have successfully rolled an action, but then the enemy might have rolled a saving throw and so all you see is your guy missing or spell fizzing out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100726516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1431161195}
review:
Ersteinmal vornehinweg, 
ich spiele schon sehr sehr sehr lange DSA, bin aber nicht bÃ¶se wenn ein Spiel sich nicht an jedes Detail hÃ¤lt, aber ich muss zugeben dieses Spiel enttÃ¤uscht mich maÃŸlos, viele kleinere Ã¤nderungen mÃ¼ssen natÃ¼rlich gemacht werden, um die Taktik und das Kampfsystem anstÃ¤ndig zu gestallten. 
Aber damit habe ich gerechnet, und weil ich spaÃŸ an diesem taktikzeug habe, habe ich anfangs auch SpaÃŸ an blackguards gehabt.
Aber warum macht man aus einem Novadischen Derwisch (Zauberkundige Trommler) einen TÃ¤nzer? Warum greifen Echsenmenschen mit PrioritÃ¤t zivilisten an anstelle der Leute die auf sie heraufbolzen, und schlussendlich, wo bleibt die entscheidungs mÃ¶glichkeit.
Ich erwarte hier bei weitem kein Dragon Age, aber DSA das ist Rollenspiel, und ich will zumindestens einfluss auf unwichtige Details nehmen kÃ¶nnen.
Nein, die Story ist schlecht aufgebaut, die recherche lÃ¤sst an so vielen Punkten zu wÃ¼nschen Ã¼brig, und die Sinnlose zurschaustellung des Todes einen Characters (den man meist mehrmals ansehen muss, da der kampf schon ganz schÃ¶n happig ist) hat mir ziemlich den rest gegeben.
Sorry,
aber deadelic sollte kein dsa mehr anpacken, das hat man ja schon an anderen spielen gemerkt...

author: {'steamid': '76561198047334416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2980, 'last_played': 1431309823}
review:
Kurz vor dem Ende und keine Minute bereut!
Auf jeden Fall im Expertenmodus genieÃŸen, da man mindestens genauso viel Zeit in den CharakterbÃ¶gen verbringen kann wie im eigentlichen Spielgeschehen (=

author: {'steamid': '76561197994831518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 8041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5549, 'last_played': 1432732592}
review:
While Blackguards has interesting characters, visually appealing backdrop and a good amount of character customisation. It is linear in nature like most tactical RPGs, it is still engaging enough to keep you playing.


What could of been an exceptional tactical RPG, is heavilly mared by the skewerd RNG.  Enemies with ludecrously low hit chances will regularly hit, while your group with ludecriously high chances to hit will miss quite often.  This simply plays out this way the entire game.

Many of the enemy hits will impose effects but you wont resist them because of penalites of unknown oragin making the skills you developed to resist them, meaningless.  Likewise Enemies will constantly resist your statuses because aparently you dont apply the same penalities to them.

This would be fine for the most part if enemies did similare damage to your group, sadly they typically will almost always do about 50% more, leaving you to scratch your head wondering why.  

In general enemies will always be better than or equal to your group in combat, even if they happen to be some merchant or alchemist they will be exceptional warriors none the less.  They also wont give you the gear they are using (aparently that vanishes in a puff of smoke when they die)

Again this woud be fine through the use of tactics.  However the RNG issues will often destroy the best tactics you can bring to the table.

Plenty of places have traps everywhere and the non-enviromental ones will let the enemies happilly walk over with without triggering them.

At the end of the day unless you are happy to ignore the RNG issues and vague information on many of the combat aspects, I cant really recomened Blackguards (hopefully the second one has improved those issues).   Even then best to get it on a 75% off sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062367748', 'num_games_owned': 1302, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1577241057}
review:
Ein sehr atmosphÃ¤risches RPG mit toller Hintergrundmusik und erstklassiger! deutscher Sprachausgabe!

Zu Beginn kann man unter 3 Klassen wÃ¤hlen: Magier, Krieger oder BogenschÃ¼tze. Jeder Charakter besitzt insgesamt 3 Waffenslots. FÃ¼r jede bestandene Aufgabe erhalten die Charaktere Abenteuer-Punkte, die man fÃ¼r die diversen FÃ¤higkeiten, Waffenskills, Grundwerte, Zauber etc.... ausgeben kann. Die SkillmÃ¶glichkeiten sind wirklich Ã¤uÃŸerst umfangreich, fÃ¼r AnfÃ¤nger wie mich allerdings auch etwas verwirrend. Viel verwendete Skills lassen sich bequem in eine Schnelleiste ziehen.

Es gibt viele Nebenquests und die Geschichte ist nicht linear, sondern bietet auch hier und da EntscheidungsmÃ¶glichkeiten!

Kampfsystem:
- Rundenbasiert
- Hexfelder
- interaktive GegenstÃ¤nde

Als einzigstes Manko empfinde ich das Zufallsprinzip im Kampf. So kann es sein das Zauber oder WaffenfÃ¤higkeiten mehrfach hintereinander nicht treffen und einem Gegner dadurch ganz schÃ¶n zu schaffen machen oder man sogar verliert. Wiederholt man den Kampf, flutscht dieser dann auf einmal wie Butter. Da man aber viele SpeichermÃ¶glichkeiten hat, ist das zum GlÃ¼ck nicht all zu tragisch oder frustrierend! Meiner Meinung nach ist 68/100 Metacritic trotzdem eine viel zu schlechte Beurteilung!

Ich habe mir das Franchise Bundle (Teil 1&2, DLC: Untold Legends) http://store.steampowered.com/sub/64046/ 
fÃ¼r ca. 13 Euro im Steam-Sale gekauft und finde das Geld mehr als gut investiert! 

Wer sich trotzdem unsicher ist, hat ja noch die Demo zum reinschnuppern ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198073736735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1073, 'last_played': 1429419141}
review:
Si te gusta el rol profundo , elegir bien lo que haces, magia con efectos ...  vamos, el rol clasico de toda la vida ... baldurs gate , eye of the beholder, etc ... y ademas no te importa combatir por turnos, tipo Conquistadores del nuevo mundo, este es un buen juego para ti.  Divertido, profundo , exploracion simplificada ... de primeras te puede parecer simplon , pero esta bien balanceado , te lo aseguro.  Pruebalo y juegalo unas cuantas horas.
Recuerda, combates por turnos !!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970807880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 178, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1430925547}
review:
After the first prison area none of my characters could use spells or abilities. Others have been having this problem too

author: {'steamid': '76561197963382404', 'num_games_owned': 917, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 3809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2195, 'last_played': 1566944621}
review:
The ap and loot system feels more like living real life as a poor person oppressed by over priced rent, wishing he could buy steak at the grocery store only able to eventually afford the spam.. But only after he spends a few more days cleaning urinals. The limited amount of story line options in general make this a lack luster experience for a RPG, as its pretty much linear. For a tablet game, playing this while traveling on a plane, would be a decent experience, for a pc game it serves to make me want to go back outside and spend time in the real world despite trying to escape from it for a moment. 

I do continue to play it, and yell words I dont want my mother to hear when I miss 95% chance to hits over and over while the archers on the enemy side hit with 5% chances. Reminds me of my childhood when I played ninja gaiden and swore the game cheated hahah.

All that said, once you get across the border, things get a little more interesting and slightly more free. 

IF you can find this game on a deep sale, and love this sorta play style youll find it is an easy game to fill the void between what ever else you are doing with your life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082061342', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1430418021}
review:
An indie game that tries to be the next big thing.It's a turn based RPG that uses hex tiles. The developer tried to implement enviromental effects and failed, horribly. The classes are bad, the character customisation is bad, and the gameplay is bad. The RNG based battles need to be changed drastically for any of the gameplay to be enjoyable. In my short time playing this game I've lost many (boring) battles due to NOT BEING ABLE TO HIT THE GOD DAMN ENEMY RIGHT IN MY FACE. And don't get me started on trying to cast spells with the mage guy. The voice acting is good although the dialogue is nothing to brag about, but there are a few good attempts at humour. The story is bad, and the choices you make don't seem to matter. Oh and there's no loot system.

2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197990234509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1430286961}
review: I regret purchasing this game as it's just poorly made. There is little customization that really matters, things aren't explained very well and the hit chance ridiculous nonsense is unforgivable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970728484', 'num_games_owned': 3234, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 3823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3823, 'last_played': 1399272903}
review:
Turn based, tactical, story (ish) game.

The faults of this title, the complex system and overly long combats take away from a otherwise enjoyable title.

While most games have a 'completed me' achievement, this title is one of the few where I felt it was truly earned (sadly for patience)

Still if your the type that likes to 'get into' a combat system, you might find some decent hours here.

5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198012621177', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 8627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7948, 'last_played': 1429870490}
review: I found that this game was very fun to play I liked the mechanics of it which was tactical. However I thought the game was based more on just sheer luck - Luck 60% tactics 40%. But still all in all a good game. There were some settings that were rather difficult because you couldn't zero in on the places the fighters were going to do all there fighting it was just rather awkward to control your hero's properly. Also the only thing you do in this game is fight from one end to the the other end that's all you do but I like a game where there is more to concentrate on than just brawling and that could be done in many ways for instance crafting.  Well there were one or two spots where at least you could do some shopping if you had the money for it however this is a game you start dirt poor and you don't get any wealthier the winning of a fight brings you but little and in coin the same. So you might well ask what was good then and well even if that's all you did was battle, the battles most were original giving you choices to play differently. And I heard that it was the best to start your player of as a mage and go the middle road while still being able to play warrior if you wanted. Yet I found I had two good mages or ranged fighters from the others that joined your group so I'm glad I started mine of as warrior and could sink my points into him just being a strong player. I found Naurim the best for this he came up big in more than a couple of instances. And the mages ran out of astral mana to fast anyway and a person didn't have money enough to so you could have astral potions with you extra and you rarely came across any by winning a battle.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983545926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 348, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1609512116}
review: I decided to replay this game after like 5 years and wanting to try a hex-based tactical RPG again. What I will say is that the combat is pretty good and the story is decent enough. What kills me every time is just how much micro-managing the characters all require; and the XP to level up characters is just not that abundant. I think I read somewhere that the game is like 40 hrs. to complete, which would explain the incredibly slow progression. I just feel like the game evolves at such a slow pace, it just can't keep my interest the way other CRPGs and TRPGs can. At the moment, though, you can buy the whole Blackguards franchise for like $2 on sale. If you are remotely interested, just buy the whole lot. That way, if you do like this game, you can have like another 60+ hrs. of game to play without overpaying too much.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970387688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1429469646}
review: Like playing in a straight jacket, a boring, random straight jacket. Not much chance of actually roleplaying anything, Just a few poor mini games strung together with a poorer story. Avoid.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980368232', 'num_games_owned': 468, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1421, 'last_played': 1460799126}
review: Dark souls of strategic genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969302422', 'num_games_owned': 773, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 2408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2408, 'last_played': 1429475945}
review: Not good at reviews so I'll keep this breif.  The randomness of this game is just too high.  I had to restart fight after fight and the increadibly long load times are very annoying.  With my attack power maxed (hit rate) I still miss or get dodged/parried 50% to 60% of the time which just makes for a really long and teadous fight.  Outside of this the overall game is good I'd give it about a 6 on a scale of 1 to 10 so guess I would recommend it.  Though if you don't like watching your characters die over and over due to just really bad machanics, I wouldn't play this.  The late game has the other team with casters and 100% spell everytime and no amount of resist seems to work

author: {'steamid': '76561198072486950', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 5543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5370, 'last_played': 1521283170}
review:
TL/DR at the bottom.

Save Your Games Often. SYGO.

Lore: This games has a great story, or maybe just a good one, but with great soundtrack. Every time the action stops to give me some of the story, be it only with voice over or with a cinematic, it makes me feel like sitting back, dimming the light, lighting up a cigar (I don't smoke cigars, wtf) and just getting immersed in that world. It works. Oh and SYGO.

Graphics: Every graphics outside of the spells and backdrops are ok for a turn-based strategy game, cinematics or gameplay. The backdrops are nice. But the spells are one notch above that. They are cool. Let just say that after 80 hours, I'd gladly skip the crossbow animation in order to save 4 seconds every time, but I'd keep the spells any day of the week. 

Gameplay: I recommend you name your character SYGO. I didn't. I should have. Now I need to restart from scratch. Don't just SYGO. Keep them. You'll need them. This game is unforgiving as it leads you to think that you'll need this skill and that skill in order to make it, yet it surprises you (too) many times with different tactics and resistance to particular damage. If you can finish this game without a single hint from the internet, a walkthrough or without ever needing to backtrack yourself once to change some skill points (let alone back track yourself 40 hours to change almost everything...) you are a God amongst humans. 

TL/DR: One of the best turn-based game I've played, as enjoyable as your favorite HOMM or Civ. Poor DLC value, very good base value. If you don't want a good challenge (60 hours) that kinda forces you into restarting at least once the game from scratch (do I hear 120 hours?), then this might not be for you. Only negative thing is that I'm really dissapointed that the dev made a Blackguards 2 instead of adding more than one DLC to this game. Did I mentioned SYGO? Yeah, SYGO. Or cry. Like the people that wrote bad reviews for this game. They didn't SYGO. Clearly. But you will, right?

author: {'steamid': '76561198019754455', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8710, 'last_played': 1429488568}
review:
This is a great game. XCOM: Enemy Unknown meets Baldur's Gate.

Pro:
- Flexible character build
- Great story

Con:
- Some Steam achievements are broken
- To hit % is only that: to hit. After this come some additional defence rolls, which can negate your hit or nullify damage. A lot of people get frustrated after missing a lot of 90% to hit rolls.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052278126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 2860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2354, 'last_played': 1533879325}
review: A great game for lovers of turn based strategic RPGs. This game is probably not for everyone, it has a very old school feel and out side of battle it is just point and click/ navigate through conversations. But if you are the type of person that is into these kind of games, you will find a great experience here.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974698125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1428480896}
review:
I saw a bunch of reviews posted bashing how hard this game is, do not be fooled, I am on normal difficulty (which is on by default) and I breezed past the entire first part of the game and made it to the world map with no problems at all.
I am not sure what they mean by "only one way to play" it would be nice to know what gave them such trouble.. maybe they tried the game using the "basic" setting instead of "expert".. I opted for expert because I wanted to adjust my own stats and skills.. the game is pretty straightforward, you read all your stats.. it tells you what stuff does.. its basically D&D
The story is also pretty interesting, the game is sure to be a good adventure ahead.. don't listen to the silly people saying its too hard to click on things.. not to mention you can always restart a battle.. the ONLY thing I do not like is that you cannot take back your movement actions once you have made them and its still your turn.. but it will tell you if you click the spaces BEFORE you confirm what your attacks and stuff can hit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032819881', 'num_games_owned': 5432, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1996, 'last_played': 1428354613}
review:
There needs to be a review on this page telling steam users that at least 11 out of the 45 achievements are bugged and most players [u]cannot[/u] achieve them. There are plenty of community posts surrounding the faulty achievements.

The game itself took a while for me to get into, it wasn't until part way through the second chapter that I found myself actually wanting to continue playing the game.

I experienced 2 bugs during my gameplay, once the game crashed when trying to add a new save to my list of game saves and once when casting a spell in battle, nothing happened after the casting animation so I had to crash out and re-load the battle.

As for game play and story line, you can tell this game was not finished when it was released due to the map being more than twice the size of the actual parts of the map you explore during the game. I found the ending very anticlimactic. The whole game is fully voice acted, yet the ending has a few words show up at the bottom of the screen over some scenic views... There is no obvious resolution to anything in the storyline and you are not told how the choices you made throughout the game have affected the outcome of the ending, meaning if you were to replay the game you wouldn't know what to do differently.

The game is visually very nice and the voice acting is good, although some times in battle I had a mans voice sound when I hit a female enemy and vice versa.

As a result, I have to say that Blackguards is a non-recommendation as I don't feel like the story provided me with anything to take away and think about, and also because of the bugged achievements meaning I can never 100% this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971562414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1400804272}
review: This game looked very promising in the early screenshots and descriptions.  Unfortunately, it turned out to be quite boring.  The character development system is neither interesting nor diverse, especially in the early levels.  With such a small party size and limited abilites, success in the early to mid-game battles is more about dice rolls than about planning or clever tactics.  In a party with only one caster, healing is so much more important than damage that it is rarely wise to cast damage spells (except when environmental effects more or less demand it). For a party with two casters....well good luck.  Although there is a dearth of solidly enjoyable tactical, turn-based rpgs, I can't recommend this game to fill the void.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960269409', 'num_games_owned': 565, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 1708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1616, 'last_played': 1428180818}
review:
First: Blackguards isn't bad or good.  It's just extremely mediocre.  If you're into D&D alternatives and dig X-Com, it probably won't waste your time.  But I can't recommend it for most people.

The character customization is surprisingly lacking, despite the illusion of choice.  There are twice as many attributes as a D&D system, but they all just sum together to increase your attack, dodge chance, initiative, etc.  There are only a handful of combat abilities to use, so there's not a lot of choice as far stabbing/shooting.  The magic users are more nuanced; there are a ton of spells, each with 4 tiers, so you're constantly weighing the cost/benefit of those.

Combat itself is very similar to X-Com or D&D 4.0: you get either a move and an action, or a double move.  This all occurs on a hex-grid, and most maps have some sort of interactable element to spice it up.  They do an admirable attempt to differentiate the levels, but you will take place in about a billion combat scenarios, so a lot of them inevitably feel repetitive.  You'll probably be skipping side quests by the end out of boredom.

The plot is pretty linear.  There are batches of side quests that open up at various points, but none of them augment the main plot line at all.  It's your typical RPG "save my daughter" or "escort my caravan" kind of stuff.  You become enslaved and forced to fight in a gladiatorial arena at one point, so that's pretty neat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131701710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1427613898}
review:
I wanted to like this game. I really did. But the extremely clunky UI, the complete lack of explanation of gameplay, and the lackluster story made it very hard to do so. Not a complete waste, but there are much better games out there.
 
Played a few more hours, and it wasn't any better. The game is still wildly uneven in difficulty and very obtuse on how certain mechanics actually work. Everything out of combat is a complete joke; the "dialouge" which consists of clicking your way down the dialouge box until you're done, the fact that you'll most likely still be using starting equipment 5 hours in, the fact that all spells (no matter how trivial) have a failure chance, to the final point that Final Fantasy 1 had more freedom than this game does. Seriously, every single thing out of combat is a single screenshot where floating chat boxes tell you what's going on.  Save your money, buy a better game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007471259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 3769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3647, 'last_played': 1427013107}
review: Great game 8.5/10! At the beginning, I was as irritated as some others about the hit/miss chances, but it already had started to enthrall me with its dark story, the DSA system where you can add your earned EXP points (called AP) after every battle to increase skills and get better. However, what in the end really made this a great game are the many battles, more than I expected, and make it a rewarding experience. So its tactical RPG with a dark setting with nice enigh graphics to make you happy. Will definitely buy Blackguards 2 now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019373741', 'num_games_owned': 4047, 'num_reviews': 285, 'playtime_forever': 2927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2917, 'last_played': 1426968589}
review:
Near the end of the game - chapter five caves of Mok Pan Tohal - the game became totally unplayable for me thanks to the poisonous mist that gets me every time because the  way gets blocked by an absurd number of enemies that position themselves before the 1 or 2 squares that are available to pass through.  I'm so frustrated and angry that its NO FUN anymore, uninstall and play Bulletstorm to wind down.  
Good story, up until this point batlles are ok if your party is well rested and if you are prepared to replay some batlles to think out a good tactic. A bit too linear and repetitive. Only buy if like me you're a huge fan of turnbased RPG's and want to complete your collection. My advise buy it cheap if you can.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011977615', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1426302400}
review:
I'm hugely disappointed with this game. It's nowhere near what I expected from a $40 game. And I'm no newbie to the genre, having played almost everything from Baldur's Gate to Dragon Age and back.
Blackguards is all about the battle, forget about exploring, meeting interesting NPCs, developing any kind of feeling for its dull characters. In order to move around cities, dungeons, etc, you won't be moving your character or group willingly, but selecting dots in some kind of map instead.
Regarding the battle itself... suffices to say there is a spell (that I learned in the very beginning of the game) that would supposedly with a 49% chance, and I haven't been able to land it once. NOT ONCE! And there's no info on what went wrong (unless maybe if you turn on the detailed battle information, which comes cluttered with lots and lots of data).
As I said in the beginning, I could have expected (and gladly accepted) something like this from a game sensibly cheaper, but not from a AAA priced one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997012035', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1258, 'last_played': 1426523902}
review:
Als Video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8wnkohmyY5M

Als reiner Text:
Bei Balckguards handelt es sich um ein Taktik-Rollenspiel von Daedalic im Das Schwarze Auge Universum.
Oder zumindest sollte es das sein. Um mein Fazit vorweg zu nehmen verkommt das Spiel meiner Meinung nach schlussendlich mehr zu einem GlÃ¼ckspuzzler, bei dem die einzelnen Puzzles durch eine Story zusammengetackert wurden.

Aber fangen wir erst einmal bei dem Setting an, das an sich noch sehr vielversprechend ist:
Wir spielen einen Charakter, den wir frei generieren kÃ¶nnen, und der zu Beginn des Spiels im Kerker landet, da er fÃ¼r Schuldig befunden wird eine Prinzessin getÃ¶tet zu haben. Zusammen mit einem verrÃ¼ckten Zwerg, der hinter allem eine VerschwÃ¶rung sieht, und einem Magier, der wohl einen Schritt zu weit gegangen ist, um mit einer Adligen im Bett zu landen, brechen wir dann aus dem GefÃ¤ngnis aus und begeben uns auf der Suche nach dem wahren MÃ¶rder.

Der Spielfluss ist dabei so, dass wir von einem Schlachtfeld zum nÃ¤chsten gehen und zwischendurch ein paar Dialoge fÃ¼hren. Und auch ein paar optionale Quests mit Entscheidungen gibt es. Im Kern des Spiels stehen aber ganz klar eben jene Schlachtfelder.

Und gerade diese Schlachtfelder machen einfach keinen SpaÃŸ. Warum das so ist, liegt an vielen Dingen gleichzeitig. Vor allem zu Beginn sind diese Schlachtfelder winzig, so dass man im Grunde auch nicht viel Spielraum hat, die Charaktere anders zu bewegen oder ganz grundsÃ¤tzlich etwas anders zu machen als wie es das spezifische Schlachtfeld fÃ¼r einen vorsieht. Ein paar mal ist es sogar so, dass der Gegner zuerst zieht und noch im ersten Zug vor einem steht. Nun sind aber die Erfolgschancen von SchlÃ¤gen, SchÃ¼ssen und Zaubern so extrem glÃ¼cksabhÃ¤ngig und der Spielraum der SchadenshÃ¶hen so groÃŸ, dass der Kampf vor allem zum frustigen GlÃ¼cksspiel wird. Das Spiel suggeriert auch, dass man in vielen Schlachtfeldern mit Objekten interagieren kann. So beispielsweise im Tutorial, in dem man einen Kronleuchter auf Gegner fallen lassen kann. In der Praxis gibt es so etwas aber eher selten und wenn es dann einmal so etwas gibt, dann muss man zuerst einmal einen Kampf dafÃ¼r verwenden um zu schauen, wo genau dieser Kronleuchter denn dann landet, um dann neu zu starten und das in seinem Puzzle zur LÃ¶sung des Schlachtfeldes einzubauen.
Ich hatte ausserdem das GefÃ¼hl, dass sich die Entwickler nur sehr wenig Gedanken darum gemacht haben, was fÃ¼r Mechaniken in einem Computerspiel Sinn machen und welche nicht. Viel Frust und Ladeorgien hÃ¤tte man sich sparen kÃ¶nnen indem man ein paar Spielmechaniken abgewandelt hÃ¤tte.
Ganz vorn ist beispielsweise, dass man ausserhalb des Kampfes nur gegen Kosten heilen kann.
Innerhalb des Kampfes geht es allerdings auch ohne, indem man am Ende des Kampfes zig runden mit einem Gegner spazieren geht, dadurch jede Runde Mana regeneriert und diese Mana dann wiederum zum heilen verwendet. Es gibt auch einige KÃ¤mpfe, die sich durch wildes hin und her Ziehen der Gegner ganz einfach gewinnen lassen. Das fÃ¼hrt natÃ¼rlich dazu, dass gerade das Ende vieler KÃ¤mpfe todlangweilig wird.
Bleiben wir noch einen Moment beim Heilen: Will man ausserhalb des Kampfes eine Bandage verwenden, die man fÃ¼r teures Gold erworben hat, gibt es dort ebenfalls eine Chance es zu verpatzen. Das fÃ¼hrt natÃ¼rlich dann dazu, dass man einfach wieder in den Ladebildschirm abtaucht und es erneut versucht. SchlieÃŸtlich ist Gold keine endlose Ressource in dem Spiel und so mÃ¶chte man gut damit haushalten.
So ziehen sich die Mechaniken im Grunde durch das ganze Spiel. Der normale Spielfluss eines Abschnittes ist, dass man in das Schlachtfeld hinein geht, herumprobiert, lernt, was das Schlachtfeld von einem will, dann gegebenenfalls einen Spielstand vor dem Schlachtfeld lÃ¤dt um Vorbereitungen anzupassen, und dann im Schlachtfeld den LÃ¶sungsweg abarbeitet und hofft, dass der Zufall einem keine StÃ¶cke, bzw ganze Bretter, zwischen die Beine wirft, durch die man dann neu laden muss. Zuguterletzt noch ein paar duzend Runden zum Heilen drangehÃ¤ngt und weiter geht es.


Nun kommt aber auch hinzu, dass die Technik des Spiels nicht auf der HÃ¶he ist. Die Grafik ist nicht besonders gut und es fÃ¼hlt sich trotzdem nicht ganz flÃ¼ssig an. Die ersten paar Minuten bestehen bereits aus einem Intro, das Ã¤hnlich billig wirkt wie die ersten 3D Intros der 90er, aus abgehackten Dialogen und aus wild herumzuckenden Charaktermodellen.
Dann gibt es da noch ein grausiges Interface, das unÃ¼bersichtlich ist, bei dem viele ErklÃ¤rungen fehlen und das sich vor allem im Kampf hakelig anfÃ¼hlt.
Das Charaktersystem von "Das Schwarze Auge" ist bereits so schon recht komplex und kompliziert und darÃ¼ber hinaus mÃ¶chte ich auch an dieser Stelle garnicht darauf eingehen. Aber gerade dort wÃ¤re ein vernÃ¼nftiges Interface extrem hilfreich gewesen. Sehr schÃ¶n ist auch, dass viele ErklÃ¤rungen zu Interface-Elementen erst zu einem Zeitpunkt auftauchen, zu dem man diese schon X mal nutzen musste.

Zur LÃ¤nge des Spiels sei kurz angemerkt, dass man mit etwa 40 Spielstunden fÃ¼r das Basisspiel auf dem mittleren Schwierigkeitsgrad rechnen kann. Ich habe es allerdings nach 20 Stunden auf dem Schwierigkeitsgrad Schwer abgebrochen.

Schlussendlich kann ich damit dem Spiel abgesehen von der Ausgangs-Story nicht viel positives abgewinnen. 

Das Debakel um die Collectors Edition hat es ebenfalls nicht besser gemacht. So haben KÃ¤ufer der CE nicht nur auf einen Rabatt der Digitalen Version verzichtet, auf Early Access verzichtet, lÃ¤nger auf Release warten mÃ¼ssen als Spieler der Digitalen Version, sondern die CE beinhaltet auch keinen Steam Key, und der einzige Weg damit an die rein Digitale Erweiterung zu kommen, ist es diese auf der Platform Gamesrocket zu kaufen. DafÃ¼r wiederum liegen der CE Ingame GegenstÃ¤nde bei, die das Balancing komplett zerstÃ¶ren.

Von mir gibt es daher einen klaren Daumen nach unten und ich wÃ¼rde das Spiel wirklich niemandem empfehlen. Wo Daedalic fÃ¼r Point & Click Adventures ein sehr gutes HÃ¤ndchen hat, haben sie leider bei diesem Rollenspiel gezeigt, das Spiele mit komplexeren Systemen nicht ihr Ding sind.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994383050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1972, 'last_played': 1426511237}
review:
It is a good purchase if you can buy it for $20 or less.

Game style is squad turned base tactical strategy and has a lot of customization within normal high fantasy.  You have the ability to play Fighters, Mages and Archers of varrying types.

Fighters - two-handed, dual weild, sword and board, single handed
Damage types - slash, bash and penetration

Mages - Customization is really based on your ability to find and afford training the spells.  They start out weak, mid game are super powerful and in the end of the game are better at buffing your Master Archer and Two-Hand DPS meleer

Archers - You get 4 skills, 2 early on, extra damage shot, bypass armor shot and then later 3 arrows dps on single target (highest damage I can find in game) and then AoE rain of arrows.  Past that there is 1 good bow in game and Crossbow users can use those abilities it seems so 1 archer should do.  My main character was my archer.

If you like turned base squad tactical games this is decent but to me not worth $40, I would wait for a sale and get it at $20 or less if possible.  I did so at the last Winter Sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028140341', 'num_games_owned': 814, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1438011390}
